loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys T., 21, is married and has a son.  According to her, her son is currently in nursery school.  She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. 

Gladys works to provide for the family.  Her husband is a trader in footwear.  Gladys is also a trader.  She trades ready-made textiles for ladies.  Gladys procures goods from Accra and distributes to retailers.  She also hawks in her community and treks to sell in other towns as well.  Gladys has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk.  She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Procure textiles.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine manages a vegetable and fruit vending business in her village. She is hoping to grow her business. That is why she wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 13,000. She wants to buy vegetables and fruits in bulk so that she will able to generate a higher income and save time buying the products repeatedly because of lack of capital to buy once a week. She is already 44 years old and is married to Junicio R.. Their two children are already finished their studying, having attained college and a vocational course. Josephine is working hard doing her best to help her husband support their farming business. Their children are already married and live separately from them.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
Clemente M. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 49 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Clemente operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Clemente has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Clemente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemente is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Clemente from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Mrs. Manju T. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur, a part of Nepal where most people are farmers. She is married and has two sons.

The family lives in poverty because her husband's income is not enough to support four people. To overcome this problem, Mrs. T. opened up a poultry farm five years years ago. Both her sons and her husband help her in her poultry farm. She now makes a living selling chickens in the local market.

Because of her success, her family's conditions are slowly improving. To continue this improvement, she has applied for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buys 500 baby chicks to raise on her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy 500 baby chicks

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Maruja es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maruja viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cuy, gallina, los que son comercializados en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además Maruja se dedica a la crianza de cuy en su casa.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy.
Los sueños de Maruja son tener un negocio mas grande y un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Santa Rita Community Bank. Maruja is married, is 42 years old, and has 4 children. Maruja travels to different fairs in the area, where she buys guinea pigs and hens, which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Also, Maruja raises guinea pigs in her house. Maruja needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested to buy guinea pigs. Maruja’s dreams are to have a very large and stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Maria Demetria

texts.es:
La señora MARIA DEMETRIA, tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3º de primaria porque vivía en el campo, desde niña se dedicó a trabajar. 
MARIA  se dedica a la venta de desayunos, menús y cenas en Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles empezó a vender cebiche, para a la huancaína, papa rellena, en su domicilio.
Este crédito de 800 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, menestras, fideos, harinas, etc para la preparación de sus menús.
MARIA suena con construir su vivencia y tener allí mismo su restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Demetria is 54 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the Sea and Sky II (Mar y Cielo II) Bank. The businesswoman has studied up till the third year of primary school because she lived in the country. Since she was a child, she has been working. Maria sells breakfast, set menus, and dinners in Trujillo. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she started selling ceviche (marinated fish), Huancaina-style potatoes, and stuffed potatoes in her home. This loan of 800 nuevos soles will be invested in the purchase of food products, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetable stews, noodles, flour, etc., to make her set menus. Maria dreams of building her house and having a restaurant there.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetable stews, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Enkhbayar S. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He has lived in Arkhangai with his family now for the past 16 years. Both of his daughters currently attend local secondary schools. Enkhbayar currently operates a meat retail business out of a rented stall at the local market. He has gained many years of experience in the business and has always been able to rely on the help of his family. Enkhbayar started his meat business in 1999 with capital of only 30,000 tugrugs (~21 USD), as this was the only money that he had. The business has since found much success and has been in stable operations for many years. Due to all of his hard-work, his business capital now exceeds 600,000 tugrugs. For the future, Enkhbayar hopes to expand his business. He says, “I wish to own my own workplace and buy a car”. It is also important that he provides for his children's future education.  He  is requesting a loan of 600, 000 tugrigs (approx.$415 USD) to purchase meat for his business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Ankhtuya

texts.en:
D. Ankhtuya is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Arhangai Province in central Mongolia. All of her daughters currently attend a local secondary school.

Ankhtuya operates a sewing business in her town with the help of her family. The family also owns livestock which are maintained by her husband, who works as a herder.

Ankhtuya started her family sewing business in 2005 with an investment of 40,000 tugrugs (approx. $27 USD). She has found success in her trade and the business has been growing steadily. She attributes her success to her family's hard-working attitude and good customer service practices. Today, her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrugs (approx. $345 USD). For the future, Ankhtuya says, “My dream is to expand my business, increase the number of livestock for my husband, and provide a good education for my children.”

Ankhtuya is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase more materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for her sewing business

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Johnson is 35 years old he is married and has four children. Three of his children are in school. He is very hardworking and supportive to the wife in providing food and shelter for his household. He owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. He also sells goat meat in the market. With the loan, he wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil and boxes of biscuits etc. to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve his savings to support his wife in taking care of the children educational needs. He is been in this business for three years now and takes stock of goods from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ruth’. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. Members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this small group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Lucrecia Evangelina

texts.es:
Lucrecia G. hace cuatro años empezó a realizar ropa artesanal, en ese tiempo hacia media docena de batas las cuales vendía en el mercado de Masaya.  Luego de un año, en el 2007, ella empezó atrabajar con Adim lo que principió el crecimiento de su negocio actualmente distribuye su línea de ropa en Managua, Catarina, Masaya, Granada, León y Jinotepe. 

G. afirmó que ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos favorables de Adim y el trabajo en familia, ya que sus cuatro hijos y su esposo le han ayudado.  En estas fechas  inaugura su propio establecimiento que se localizara en el mirador de Catarina un gran centro turístico.

Este es un ejemplo a seguir en el que la perseverancia, el trabajo y los deseos de auto superación con un granito de arena logran llegar a cumplir parte de sus metas. Este crédito lo invertirá en telas, hilos, cintas y otro tipo de materia prima para confeccionar sus modelos de ropa que además de distribuir venderá en su propio local.
texts.en:
Lucrecia G. has been making clothes by hand for the past four years. During her first year, she made a half dozen gowns that she sold at the market in Masaya. In 2007, after a year in business, she began working with ADIM. The assistance she received helped her increase her business to the point where she currently distributes her clothing line in Managua, Catarina, Masaya, Granada, León, and Jinotepe.

Lucrecia says that she was able to get ahead thanks to the favorable loans from ADIM and the hard work of her family, which includes her four children and her husband who provided assistance. During this time, she opened her own establishment in a location that overlooks the large tourist city of Catarina.

She is a role model of perseverance, hard work, and the desire for self-improvement. Like a grain of sand, only a tiny bit of self-belief is all that is needed to realize one’s goals. Lucrecia’s loan will be used to purchase fabrics, thread, lace, and other materials needed to produce her style of clothing that she will sell from her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and other materials

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, cooking oil and groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to purchase onions and green vegetables to sell. Khamis is 32 years-old and married with a husband that is a soldier. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Macoui

texts.fr:
Revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé, cette dame fait face en ce moment à une réduction de son stock de marchandises ce qui a entraîné une baisse de ses recettes. Pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 35 pagnes de diverses qualités.
Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the grand marketplace of Lomé, this lady is coping at the moment with an inventory shortage, which has lead to a drop in income.  To stock up again, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 35 pagnes of diverse qualities.  She is married and the mother of three children.  With what she earns from her commerce, she helps to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 47-year-old single mother of two children who are 19 and 21 years of age.  Both of her children go to school. She rents a two room house where she is staying with three people. 

Margret takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.  

She incurs transportation costs to and from buying electronics in Kiyembe and some shops near Nakasero market, one of the busiest markets in the city of Kampala. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. 

Margret works six days a week.  She receives an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on both a retail and wholesale basis. She has a shop selling electronics on Lubaga Road, Kitawuluzi Zone, and sells all types of of electronics, both new and used ones.  In addition to her electronics business, she has a stall selling fruits. 

Her major business challenges are the ever-increasing prices of electronics, and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works in a muddy place.  

Margret has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for six years.  She is servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more electronics like flat irons, electric wires, extension cables, kettles, and plugs, She is hoping to see her business grow bigger so she can start selling on a wholesale only basis.

loans.use: To buy more electronics like kettles, plugs, extensions, cables and flat irons

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma S. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Gemma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D., 41 years old, owns and manages a small rice farm in Santa Josefa Agusan del Sur. She has two children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and was not able to proceed to college because of financial difficulties. Evelyn wishes to grow her business so that she will have enough income to support all her family's needs.

She is hoping to receive a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase the size of her harvest and her income.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant/cafe

loans.name: 10 De Agosto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 10 de Agosto está integrado por un grupo de mujeres  que siempre buscan oportunidades de superación personal y familiar, ubicado en la parroquia Santa Ana,   ésta es  una comunidad que cuenta con paisajes hermosos en su estado natural,   el 27 de Mayo es  su parroquialización donde  podemos disfrutar  de música, desfiles, danzas, artistas, etc., su gente es muy cálida como nuestras socias que nos brindan sus historias.

La señora  María L. tiene 66 años, vive  sola en su casa propia  heredada por sus abuelos  que tiene 150 años de construida, está ubicada en la parroquia Santa Ana comunidad Latig, además nos comenta que es viuda hace doce años porque su esposo tenía problemas de alcoholismo, con él concibió seis hijos que ahora son todos adultos y han formado su propia familia. 

María se dedica  a cultivar sus tierras, criar animales como gallinas, cerdos  y también lava ropa ajena los días miércoles, jueves, sábados de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. Lleva dos años como socia del banco comunal incitada  por una amiga  manteniendo una gran amistad con sus compañeras del banco comunal.

Con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNCACION ESPOIR le   entregue va a comprar pollos y cerdos, su gran sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y construirse una casa nueva.

Mercedes C. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia El Valle, tiene 26 años de edad y  vive en unión libre  fruto su amor procreó tres hijos  de  9, 4, 2, años de edad,  su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus Intercantonal, viven en  casa de sus padres en un departamento  independiente por ahora están construyendo su casa propia fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo conjunto.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, cuyes, los vende en tiendas de su comunidad  lleva dos  años realizando esta actividad y nos comenta que le va bien. Este es su tercer ciclo en la fundación y fue su cuñada quien la estímulo para formar parte de este grupo de amigas. Con  el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar cerdos, cuyes y el respectivo alimento para su crianza.

Su gran sueño es poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The August 10th village bank consists of a group of women who are always looking for ways to progress individually and with their families; it is located in the Santa Ana parrish. It is a city with beautiful natural landscapes. The May 27th parrish is an area of the city for music, parades, dances, artists, etc. The people of the city are very warm and friendly like the women who make up this village bank. Maria L. is 66 years old and lives alone in her home which she inherited from her grandparents; it is 150 years old and located in the Santa Ana parrish of the Latig community. She was widowed 12 years ago as her husband died from alcoholism; she had 6 children with him who are now all adults and have their own families. Maria raises crops on her land and also raises animals like chickens and pigs; she also washes clothes for customers on Wednesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays from 8 am to 6 pm. She has been part of the bank for 2 years and has developed a deep friendship with the other members of the bank. With the loan she will receive from Fundacion Espoir, she will buy chickens and pigs; her dream is to have good health to keep working and build a new home. Mercedes C. lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the El Valle parrish; she is 26 years old and lives in a common law marriage. She has 3 children who are 9, 4, and 2 years old. Her husband is a bus driver for Intercantonal. They live in her parents' home in an independent apartment but are building their own home thanks to their hard work in their jobs. She buys and sells chickens and guinea pigs and sells them in the community; she has done this for the past 2 years and it has been a good business for her. This is her 3rd loan through the foundation; her sister-in-law encouraged her to become part of the group. With this new loan, she will buy pigs and guinea pigs and food to raise them. Her dream is to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and animal food

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta M. is from the village of Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur Provice. She is 43 years old. Crisanta is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products offered

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.ru:
В нынешнее время всё чаще можно встретить человека, который вследствие жизненных проблем жалуется и критикует всё и вся. Человеку свойственно искать виноватого в какой-либо ситуации, и в основном он находит его в лице других людей: начальника, государства, самой жизни, или ещё в чём – либо, но только не в себе.  Тем не менее, есть и такие люди, которые вместо того, чтобы кого – либо винить всего на всего прилагают усилия в силу собственных сил и возможностей и пытаются изменить свою жизнь к лучшему. В данной группе, люди принадлежат среднему слою населения. И никто из них не отличается чем – то особенным в материальном плане. Байсабаева Дамира – лидер данной группы. Ей тридцать два года. Она замужем и живёт со своей семьёй в г. Карабалта. Для того, чтобы помогать мужу обеспечивать семью, Дамира три года назад занялась розничной торговлей товарами повседневного спроса (различные продукты питания, спички, соль, сахар и т.п.). Дамира, прежде чем заняться торговлей, посоветовалась с сестрой, и они вместе вложили свои сбережения в этот бизнес. По прошествии трёх лет, Дамира имеет ежемесячный доход в размере восьми тысяч сомов ($180). Более того, её бизнес помог ей приобрести автомобиль. В данное время Дамире требуется кредит. Дамире он нужен, чтобы закупить новую партию товаров к предстоящему сезону весенних праздников. В будущем, она надеется купить павильон. 

Вместе с Дамирой в группе ещё три человека:

Фегеле Альфие, тридцать один год. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Старший сын ходит в школу, а младший пока дома. Муж Альфии – сварщик. Он предоставляет услуги сварщика, изготавливает железные ворота, решётки и печи. Когда – то муж Альфии сам устроился к сварщику в помощнику, но в дальнейшем решил работать самостоятельно. Сейчас её мужу требуется кредит. Ему необходимы средства, для того, чтобы купить материалы для работы.

Бекбосун – кызы Жылдыз двадцать семь лет. Муж Жылдыз работает в частной пилораме. Жылдыз имеет двух детей. Дети маленькие и поэтому по большей части обеспечением семьи занимается муж Жылдыз. Параллельно он также занимается перепродажей овец. Сейчас Жылдыз надеется получить кредит, чтобы купить овец.

Сарыбаеву Бекжану двадцать три года. Бекжан холост и занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Три года назад он вместе с братом купили машину и начали таксовать. Бекжан также обеспечивает сестру, которой четырнадцать лет. Бекжану нужен кредит, чтобы купить бычка на содержание.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nowadays it is more and more common to see people who react to their problems by constantly complaining and blaming others. It is human nature to seek fault with someone else, and usually people find someone or something to blame: their boss, the government, life in general, anything but themselves. Nevertheless, there are people who, instead of assigning blame, do their best in order to change their lives for the better. All members of the group being presented is middle-class. No one has any special financial advantage. The leader of the group is Damira B.. She is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the town of Karabalta. In order to help her husband meet the family expenses, three years ago she started a business retailing various everyday goods (foodstuffs, matches, salt, sugar etc). Before launching this business, she discussed it with her sister, and they invested their savings jointly. Now, three years later, Damira has a monthly income of 8,000 somos ($180). Moreover, her business made it possible for her to buy a car. Now Damira needs a loan. She needs it in order to buy a new stock of goods for the upcoming season of spring holidays. In the future, she hopes to buy a retail kiosk. In addition to Damira, there are three more individuals in this group: Alfiya F. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. The older son goes to school; the younger one is still in pre-school age and stays at home. Alfiya’s husband is a welder. He provides welding services, making iron gates, grills and ovens. Sometime ago he was working as a welder’s assistant, but later he decided to work independently. Now Alfiya’s husband is in need of a loan. He needs to purchase work supplies. Jyldyz B.-K. is 27 years old. Jyldyz’ husband works in a private company. Jyldyaz has two children. The children are still young, and so it mostly falls to the husband to provide for the family. He also resells sheep on the side. Jyldyz is hoping to obtain a loan in order to buy sheep for resale. Bekjan S. is 23 years old. He is single, and his business is passenger transport. Three years ago he and his brother bought a car and started a taxi business. Bekjan also supports his 14-year old sister. He needs funds in order to buy a bull calf to raise.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the stock of foodstuff prior to the spring holiday season

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en: Adeola sells religious articles like candles, incense, olive oil and prayer books at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because she is able to support her husband in meeting the basic needs and necessities of the family. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the home. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more religious articles to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more religious articles to sell.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Née en 1961 à Toffo Agué dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin, A. Hélène vit depuis vingt ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Hélène est mariée à YAKPLEDO Paul, et est mère de sept enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais seulement trois des enfants vivent encore avec son mari et elle, à Dogoudo. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Hélène n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Hélène a commencé à produire elle-même, de la farine de manioc qu'elle vend au marché de Allada. Il y a juste un an que Hélène a commencé cette activité. Hélène achète ses matières premières à Allada. Hélène est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les trois premiers prêts qu'elle a reçu de ALIDé. Hélène sollicite un autre prêt afin d'agrandir un peu plus son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Toffo Agué in the"département" (administrative district) of Ouémé in Bénin, Hélène A. has lived for the past twenty years in the Dogoudo district of Allada, in the "département" of Atlantique. Hélène is married to Paul YAKPLEDO and is mother to seven children, all of whom have been or are at school. However, only three of the children still live with her and her husband in Dogoudo. The couple shares responsibility for the various family expenses. Hélène never went to school. In order to provide for her needs, Hélène has started to make cassava flour herself, and she sells it at the market in Allada. She began this activity just a year ago. She buys her basic products in Allada. Hélène is an old customer of ALIDé, who has repaid all three previous loans that she was granted by ALIDé. She is applying for another loan in order to expand her activity a little more and to satisfy better her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cassava

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el sector Molino El Carmen del distrito de Motupe,un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven, empezó trabajando como peón agrícola en diversos cultivos de la zona y con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir hace cinco años un terreno agrícola propio en donde suele sembrar maíz, el suele poner todo su esfuerzo en esta actividad ya que de ella depende el mantenimiento de su familia.

El cultivo ya esta muy avanzado y dentro de poco dará frutos, Francisco quiere asegurarse una buena producción brindandole riegos y fertilizantes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar la actividad propuesta.

Francisco es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos lo consideran una persona responsable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los que lo necesitan
texts.en:
Francisco is the 46 year old father of a family. He lives with his wife and children in the Molio El Carment sector of the Motupe district. This district is part of the Lambayeque province and is located 1 hour and 45 minutes outside of the city Chiclayo. He has worked as a farmer since he was young. He began working as a farmhand in various farms in the region, and with much effort was able to acquire his own farm 5 years ago. He grows corn, and puts all his efforts into this work and he depends on it to support his family. The crop is already very advanced, and soon will give a crop. Francisco wants to ensure good production via water and fertilizers, and for this he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help him complete this task. Francisco is a hardworking person, his greatest longing is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to bring his family a better quality of life. His neighbors and friends consider him to be a responsible person, and he is always ready to help those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for Francisco's corn

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en:
Yamuna is a 40-year-old woman who is married and living with her three children, one son and two daughters, in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle district of southern Sri Lanka.

Yamuna runs a condiment  business independently, while her husband is abroad. He is a retired army officer.  She started this venture eight years ago, and has since seen success. She works very hard and also attributes her success to being a very honest woman.

With this loan of 60,000 rupees (LKR), Yamuna hopes to buy a new grinder for her condiment  business to supply advanced service to her customers.
 
Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy a new grinder  for the condiment  business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 26 years old and married with one child, 2½ years old. He is a farmer in Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya.

Godfrey has been farming for two years and his main product is bananas which he sells to the local market. He relies solely on the income from his farming activities to cater for his family's needs. His main challenge in this business is the low price of bananas, especially during the rainy season.

Godfrey has requested this KES 46,800 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will improve his family's living standard because, with the income from selling milk, he will be able to construct a house and the family will have enough milk for consumption.

In future, Godfrey plans to acquire more cows and construct a zero-grazing shed (to raise improved breeds of livestock under confined conditions in order to make better use of limited land area, feed and organic resources). He plans to lease more banana plantation land to increase his income.

Godfrey says that Juhudi loans are repaid monthly and this gives him ample time to look for money compared to other organizations where they repay weekly. He says Juhudi is also fast in loan processing.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “RICCHARY RUNA”; se reúnen cada mes por la tarD. en el distrito D. Huanchac, D. la provincia D. Cusco y departamento Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. JUANA; Es casada y tiene 5 hijos, la socia tiene 57 años D. edad y es natural del departamento D. Cusco; del tradicional barrio D. nueva alta,  La socia alterna sus diferentes actividades con la venta D. tamales dulces y salados en el mercado central , ella hace unos riquísimos tamales a base D. maíz y harina, a los que le agrega un poco D. aceitunas, encebollado con carnecita y sal; y a los tamales con dulce les agrega pasas. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa, comprar insumos para su negocio D. tamales

La socia agradece el préstamo y valorando el mismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ricchary Runa”; they meet every month in the afternoon in the Huanchac district, in the Cusco province and department.

Our member is Juana; She is married and has 5 children. She is 57 years old and is a native of Cusco, from a traditional neighborhood. She works in different businesses, such as the sale of tamales, sweets and snacks in the central market. She makes a delicious tortilla from corn and flour, which she fills with olives, onions, meat and salt. In the sweet tamales, she puts raisins. She is requesting this loan to improve her home and purchase materials for her tamale business.

She is grateful for the loan and for this reason, she promises to complete the payments of her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase consumables and improve her home

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Buena Suerte y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Alicia es casada y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días desde muy temprano. Además Alicia tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, actividad que realiza en sus tiempos libres. Alicia solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Alicia sueña con construir otra casa en un terreno que ya adquirió y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Buena Suerte (Good Luck) communal bank; what she most likes about it is the savings incentives. Alicia is married and has two children who are students. She has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells groceries every day starting very early in the morning. In addition, Magdalena also has a small seamstress workshop in her home where she makes clothes in her spare time. Alicia is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams are to build another house on a lot she already acquired and that her children complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 53 and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Roberto grows rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 19 years.

Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Roberto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his childrens' tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel B. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 32 years old, married and has 1 very young child. Ruel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ruel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie P. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 39 years old. Josie is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Josie raises livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. Josie has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Josie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion S. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 59 years old. To make a living, Salvacion owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.

Salvacion joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Salvacion from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 49 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP per crop. In 2010, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Liliana Maribel

texts.es:
Liliana de 22 años, vive en una zona del suburbio de Guayaquil es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras). 

Para tener ingresos suficientes y mantener a sus hijos ella comenzó como vendedora Yambal ya que es una empresa que le a permitido pasar tiempo con sus hijos porque las ventas son a sus vecinos y amigos. Ella deja los productos a crédito para que las personas puedan pagar en partes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y pinturas para remodelar su casa ya que necesita el cambio para sus dos hijos. En el futuro quiere ser líder de ventas Yambal y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Liliana, 22, lives in the “El Suburbio” area of Guayaquil. She sells Yanbal products. (Yanbal is a cosmetics firm that sells products at low cost to enterprising women). In order to have sufficient funds to support her children she started to sell Yanbal since it’s a firm that has allowed her to spend time with her children because the sales are to her neighbors and friends. She leaves the products on credit so that the people can repay in installments. She will use the loan to buy cement and paint to remodel her house because she needs a change for her two children. In the future she’d like to be a Yanbal team leader and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and paint.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew K. is 25 years old and from Misikhu area in Kakamega. He is single and has no dependants at the moment.
Andrew has been running a business rearing dairy cows for the past eight months. Most of his customers come to buy fresh milk from him but he also supplies milk to the shops around. He is applying for his first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, after being introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a client. Andrew intends to use his loan to buy another dairy cow to enable him to meet the demands of his customers who buy milk on daily basis for consumption. His hope and dream is to diversify into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to add to his stock

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
PILAR D. O.
Socia activa del banco comunal mujeres valientes. Distrito calleria departamento Ucayali,  Es viuda Tiene  60 años de edad, tuvo 3  hijos, dos ya independientes y uno a su cargo. Que todavía depende de pilar
 Con el préstamo que Manuela Ramos le hizo hace 8 años ha está  invirtiendo en  su negocio  que  tiene de bar- restaurant.
Y con el afán de mejorar la atención a su público asístete  su negocio ha decidido variar sus platos a la carta.
 Pilar  Con su último préstamo  que es de  s/. 1000 nuevos soles y s que saco de Manuela Ramos se va proveer de insumos y enseres que le faltan para seguir brindando la debida atención a sus asiduos clientes.  
 La señora  Pilar se siente bien porque  ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos  y a su negocio aun siendo una mujer sola. Gracias a los préstamos obtenidos de parte de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
PILAR D. O. is an active member of the "Mujeres Valientes" ["Brave Women"] communal bank. She lives in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is a widow and 60 years old. She has 3 children; two are already independent, and one is in her care and still dependent on her.

With the loan granted to her 8 years ago by the Manuela Ramos organization, she invested in her business, which is a restaurant-bar. With the goal of improving her service to her customers, she has decided to offer more varied dishes on her menu. With her current loan through Manuela Ramos, for 1000 Peruvian new soles, she will buy supplies and equipment which she needs to provide proper service to her loyal customers. 

Pilar feels good because she has been able to help her children get ahead, and she has made progress with her business in spite of being a woman alone, thanks to the loans she has obtained through Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama La Virgen de Guadalupe, debido a la fe que tienen las integrantes hacia la virgen de Guadalupe. Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.La señora Matilde Martínez A. es integrante del grupo, tiene 36 años estudio hasta la primaria, tiene una panadería y en total tiene 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a vender pan que inicio hace 5 años, empezó comprando y vendiendo, ahora gracias a los pequeños préstamos ha podido lograr ya elaborar pan junto con su esposo, y vender en diferentes partes del municipio. Gracias a las ganancias que ha tenido con la elaboración del pan, ha logrado comprar un carro para poderles vender su pan a comunidades lejanas. Sus clientes están agradecidos con ella, porque ya pueden comprar pan en su comunidad, sin tener que salir a comprar a otro lado, además de que el sabor de su pan es diferente a los demás.Ella solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar harina y comprar más canastos para incrementar su producción y así ir logrando sus objetivos. Esta luchando para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos, comenta no le gustaría que sus hijos vivieran y sufrieran lo mismo que ellos, le gustaría darles una carrera a ellos para que tengan una mejor vida. Otro de sus sueños es tener expendios de pan en varias comunidades del Municipio para lograr todo lo que quieren darles a sus hijos.
texts.en: This group is called the Virgin of Guadalupe due to the faith that the members have in the Virgin of Guadalupe. It is located in Mexico State. The group is made up of 11 members. Ms. Matilde Martínez A. is a member of the group. She is 36 years old and studied through primary school. She has a bakery and a total of 5 children. She has been selling bread since she started 5 years ago. She started by buying the bread and selling it, but now, thanks to the small loans, she makes the bread along with her husband, and they sell it in various parts of the municipality. Thanks to the profits they have made from baking bread, she has been able to buy a car that enables them to sell the bread in communities that are farther away. Her customers are grateful to her, since they can now buy bread in their communities without having to go far away, in addition to the fact that her bread has a different flavor than other bread. Matilde is seeking this new loan to buy flour and to buy more baskets to increase her production and so meet her goals. She is fighting to give her children a better education. She comments that she would not like her children to live through and suffer what they did. She would like to give them careers so that they have a better life. Another of her dreams is to have bread shops in various communities in the Municipality to achieve all that they want to give their children.

loans.use: To buy flour and more bread baskets.

loans.name: Florence Ewura Akua

texts.en:
Florence Ewura Akua N. sells provisions at Abura. She is married and has eight dependants. Florence uses the income she makes from her sales to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to expand her shop. With her increased profit she hopes to buy some land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to expand her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy charcoal, palm oil, seasoning, salt, pepper, etc. to resell

loans.name: Blanca Betty

texts.en:
Blanca is forty-nine years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone that is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Blanca shares her home with her husband and their two children.

Blanca and her husband own an orchard that they inherited from their parents.  They have mango and maracuya (passion fruit, which is similar to pomegranates and grows on a vine) planted on the land with many mature trees producing fruit.  Blanca cares for the trees and harvests the fruit on a weekly basis given the constant growing season in the area.  Her husband is a professor.  His salary pays for the majority of the family’s expenses, leaving the orchard to provide for additional needs.

Blanca is new to Edpyme Alternativa, and she appreciates the opportunity to access credit at a reduced interest rate as a result of the funding through Kiva.  She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to improve production and protect her crops.  She hopes that the investment will improve ongoing production and thus increase the income of her household.  She is a very hard-working woman with many dreams for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rosa Nila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 46 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a ellos en el distrito de La Victoria, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rosa es profesora de profesión y desde muy joven se sintió comprometida con la educación de los niños, fue así que aprovechó una iniciativa del gobierno a nivel nacional e instaló en su vivienda un centro especializado en educación de niños de dos a cinco años de edad llamado PRONOEI. 

Los PRONOEI son entidades educativas que actúan financiadas por las municipalidades y los padres de familia, su publico objetivo son los niños que provienen de familias de escasos recursos y en ellos se brinda los conocimientos y herramientas necesarios para desarrollar en los niños su capacidad de aprendizaje.

El PRONOEI de Rosa no sólo les brinda conocimientos académicos, sino que también tiene contratados a dos profesores, uno de música y uno de danza. Actualmente ella desea realizar mejoras en uno de sus baños para poder brindar mayor comodidad a sus niños una vez que hayan iniciado las labores académicas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Caital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad ella pudo construir un aula adicional con lo cual pudo atender a más niños. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que a través de Kiva le ayudaron a brindar un mejor servicio en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old, separated, and has two children in her care.  She lives with them in La Victoria district, one of the most densely-populated districts in the region, five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosa is a teacher by profession and since she was very young she felt committed to children's education.  She took advantage of a nationwide government initiative and set up a specialized educational center for children aged two to five (PRONOEI) in her home.

PRONOEI are educational centers that are financed by municipalities and children's parents.  Their public aim is for children who come from poor families to gain the knowledge and tools they need to develop their learning capacity.

Rosa's PRONOEI center does not only provide children with academic knowledge.  She also has contracts with two teachers: a music teacher and a dance teacher.  Currently, Rosa would like to make some improvements to one of her bathrooms so that she can make the children in her school more comfortable once they start their school.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Rosa has already had a Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa and their seed money product.  On that occasion, she was able to build an additional classroom so that she could serve more children.  She is grateful to the people who, through Kiva, have helped her to provide a better service to her community.

loans.use: To carry out improvements in one of her bathrooms so that she can make her pupils more comfortable

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Radha T..  She is married and has three children aged 25, 22 and 21.  In 2004, she established her cow-raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young dairy cow.  In the future, Radha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Katmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian G. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Ian owns and operates a livestock-raising business. His main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Ian has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Ian joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,900 PHP from GDMPC. Ian is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to invest in expanding his business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Ian from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in business expansion

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mi S., 49, is married and lives with her three young children in Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 a day, while her husband works as a construction foreman and makes $12 a day. Over the last year, weather conditions have made farming difficult for people in Cambodia and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. This combination of factors have meant hard times for many Cambodians, including S.. In light of these difficulties, she has applied for a loan for $1,000 to buy supplies to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy more equipment to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita G. is from the village of Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old. Anita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 2000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Anita's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 29 years old, while the youngest is only 20.

Nancy is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She plants and harvests rice crops. Nancy prepared her land well and is now ready for planting rice.

Nancy's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes for a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Purificacion; la socia tiene 25 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanías (tejidos) como mantas, chompas,chalinas,guantes entre otros ella teje en su casa para luego venderlo a sus clientes, ella trabaja de forma independiente esto hace que tenga más tiempo para estar con su hijo esto es algo que le gusta mucho y le pone más esfuerzo a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y de esta manera ella saca a su hijo adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como hilos, agujasa, lana entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". It is located in the community of Yuncaypata, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Purificacion. She is 25 years old, separated, and she has 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with her knitting business. She knits wraps, sweaters, scarves, mittens and others. She knits at home to later sell to her clients. She works independently and this ways she is able to have more time for her son. This is something she really enjoys and she puts a lot of effort into her work. She is a responsible person and this is how she is able to provide for her son.

She requests a loan to purchase materials such as yarn, needles, wool and other materials.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase yarn, needles, and wool

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. 30 years old, married to a working man, and has four children who go to school. She's currently in the food market business. Her future goal is to build a shop for rent.

loans.use: to buy stock for the food market

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es:
Aunque toda su vida Alba Lucía R. Muñoz fue ama de casa, los problemas de salud que debió enfrentar y la necesidad de aportar con algún trabajo que pudiera realizar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, fueron lo que la impulsaron a iniciar con su negocio de sandalias y artículos de cuero que ella misma elabora. Y aunque no son grandes las ganancias que obtiene, a sus 41 años de edad, Alba se siente feliz de poder contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

 

En un espacio de su casa, este emprendedora realizó las adecuaciones correspondientes para poder trabajar sus productos, los cuales vende en ferias artesanales a las que asiste y en su hogar donde igualmente vende productos de uso personal y variedeades. Alba se siente afortunada porque además de ser parte activa de la familia, su trabajo como independiente le permite compartir con sus 2 hijos y desempeñar su rol de mamá. 

  

Alba Lucía debe surtir frecuentemente su taller de marroquinería para sacar nuevas colecciones pero su capital es reducido y no es suficiente para comprar el material necesario para generar la producción, por ello, necesita de un préstamo. Su visión de empresaria es poder tener  su propio almacén y que su marca y sus diseños sean reconocidos no sólo en su barrio si no también en toda la ciudad de Medellín.
texts.en:
Although Alba Lucía R. Muñoz was a housewife her whole life, pressing health problems and the need to contribute, by means of some type of work, to covering household expenses impelled her to start her own business selling sandals and other leather products which she makes herself. Although the profits from her business are not large, at 41 years of age Alba is happy to be able to contribute to improving her family’s quality of life. 

This entrepreneur made the appropriate adaptations to an area in her home in order to be able to fabricate her products which she sells at handicraft markets she attends and from home where she also sells personal use and other miscellaneous items. Alba feels fortunate because, in addition to being an active part of the family, working independently allows her to share with her two children and fulfill her role as mom. 

Alba Lucía must often supply her workshop with leatherworking materials in order to bring out new collections, but her capital is limited and insufficient to be able to buy the necessary items to generate her products. Thus she needs a loan. Her vision as businesswoman is to be able to have her own shop and that her brand and designs be recognized not only in her neighborhood but also throughout the city of Medellín.

loans.use: to purchase leather for making footwear.

loans.name: Bienvenida Reinelda

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de  Manta encontramos la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Metropolitana.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora bienvenida, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal, es fundadora del mismo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son bien ordenadas y responsables.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando él está desocupado, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local. Tiene más de 40 años que se dedica al comercio, empezó desde muy joven a ganarse la vida sola.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the road to the city of Manta, we find the Metropolitana development, where the members of the Communal Bank of Metropolitana meet every two weeks.

In this place we meet Bienvenida, who is 56 years old, is married, and has 6 children. All of them are grown, and one still lives with her. Her husband is a mechanic. She has been in the communal bank for two years. She founded it and she likes it because her fellow members are organized and responsible.

She has a grocery store in her house where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, cooking oils, detergents, etc. She works everyday from 6:00 AM until 9:00 PM, and sometimes until later. Her son helps her with her work when he isn’t busy. She buys her products in the center of Portoviejo, though she takes delivery of most of them at her store. She has been in this business for more than 40 years; she began earning a living when she was very young. 

She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic products.

Her goals are to continue with her business and for her business to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old and married with one child who is 5 years old. Her store offers items such as rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, water, juice, and cosmetics. Her business is open from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Esther has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more  juice, clothes, body lotion and water for sale in her store. She plans reinvest the profits in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more juice, clothes, body lotion and water.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Byambaa is a 42-year-old hard-working woman who helps her entire family to get ahead. She lives with her husband and four children in a small house in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Byambaa’s youngest son and daughter both attend university in Ulaanbaatar while her husband helps to run the business. 

Byambaa is a professional tailor; however she stopped her career in 1996 to start a new business at “Denjiin 1000”, a local outdoor market, selling used fridges and refrigerators with working capital of 400,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). In 1999, she moved to Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia to expand her business. 

She buys used fridges from local people at low prices to fix and renovate. After such repairs, Byambaa sells the fridges and refrigerators at a higher price. As she has been running this business for 15 years, she is well-experienced in the field. Since the start of the business, the working capital has increased to 3,000,000 MNT. She supports her family plus she pays tuition fees for her children.  

Byambaa is requesting a 1,500,000 loan to purchase more used fridges as the business makes fine profits during the summer. She is well-organized and punctual person who is striving to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more used fridges & refrigerators for summer.

loans.name: Norma Georgina

texts.en: Norma is a mother of two and lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras where she runs a business selling agro-industrial products such as hardware, glues, and aluminum. She has operated the business for a number of years and has developed a solid customer base. Norma is requesting a loan of Lps. 18,000 with which to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase glue, nails, screws, aluminum, hardware, and hoses.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad has had a bakery since 2006, where he makes all kinds of bread and pastries. He is 40 years old, married and has three children. Ahmad is from Iraq. He has good experience and a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2700 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to increase his income to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 14, the 3 eldest in school. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past 5 years, Delphine has run a business selling clothes. The profits from her business have helped support her family by providing funds for food, medical insurance, and school fees.  

Delphine will use this loan to purchase more clothes that she will sell for a profit. She plans to use the profit to some day purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has two children.

Since 1983, Ali has been an owner of a workshop where he repairs cars. He has more than twenty years' experience and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to purchase a sewing machine for leather and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for leather and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel tiene 43 años de edad, está casado con la señora Geronima de 36 años de edad, ellos tienen su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santaní.
Es propietario de una discoteca, con todos los insumos necesarios para el mismo. Comenta que la discoteca le genera muy buenos ingresos, en especial los fines de semana ya que muchas personas están libres en esos días y salen a divertirse. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bienestar de familia, es por eso que nunca se cansa de trabajar.
Cuenta que mucha gente, de una gran variedad de edades asiste a su discoteca, tiene un ambiente agradable y muy confortable. Desea poder seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en dicho negocio. Como antecedente dentro de la Fundación tiene cinco créditos, con un excelente cumplimiento.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de instrumentos musicales para equipar su discoteca, con lo cual podrá formar un buen atractivo para atraer a más clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que una vez más esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is 43 years old and married to Sra. Geronima, age 36. They have their own home in the city of Santaní.

Manuel is the owner of a discotheque and has all the necessary equipment for his business. He says that the discotheque generates a very good income, especially on the weekends when many people have free time and want to have fun. Manuel says that everything he does is for the welfare of his family, which is why he never gets tired of working.

There are many people of different ages who come to his discotheque since it offers a pleasing and comfortable atmosphere. Manuel wants to continue growing and investing in this business. He has built up an excellent repayment history with Fundación Paraguaya by taking out five loans.

The loan he is now requesting will be used to purchase musical instruments for his discotheque so that he can make it more attractive so as to draw in more customers. Manuel is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him once again.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments for his discotheque.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del peñón, departamento de león, la Señorea Mayra Del Socorro  Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia en buenas condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo. 
 Actual mente  acudió a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para ampliar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: Arena, Sementó, ladrillo y Pago de mano de Obra con esto empezara a la Mejora de su vivienda, para así alcanzar las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Del Socorro lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon in the Department of León. She is known for being a hardworking individual who knows how to provide for the welfare of her home. Mayra has managed to maintain good conditions for her family. She is known for being an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling her to earn the respect of many people around town. Mayra has three dependent children.

She came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that she could improve the condition of her home. The loan she requested will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and bricks. She will also pay for labor so that the improvements to her home can begin, thus making the way for better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 30, is a hardworking business woman.  She is married and blessed with a one-year-old child.

For the last three years, she has managed a salon to raise money to bring up her family.
