In the next five years, Margaret wants to expand her business. Her dream is to own a hair dressing school. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair drier and braids.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier and braids.

loans.name: Sharofjon

texts.ru: Шарофджон открыл дилерский  центр по продаже кассет, там также установлены 2 компьютера, которые приносят дополнительный доход. Он успешный предприниматель на своем личном автомобиле он также занимается частным извозом (такси). В день он зарабатывает 50-60 сомони. Шарофджон  женат, его жена работает бухгалтером, у них один ребенок. Он хочет приобрести дополнительные шины для своего автомобиля, чтобы успешно заниматься водительским делом (такси). Он просит займ в размере 500 сомони и надеется на ваше понимание и благодарит вас заранее.
texts.en: Sharofjon opened a dealer center, where he sells cassettes and installed two computers, which yield an additional income.  He is a successful entrepreneur and uses his own car to provide taxi transportation services.  He earns 50-60 somoni per day.  Sharofjon is married, his wife works as an accountant, and they has one child.  He wants to purchase additional tires for his car in order to continue running his taxi business successfully.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 500 somoni and replies on your understanding, and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is 51 years old. He is married to Virginia and together they have two children aged nine and 17 years. He is a horticultural farmer, farming watermelons and tomatoes. He has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the business.

This is his third loan from KADET. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to buy melon and tomato seedlings. 

The anticipated profits will be used to expand his business. He hopes to be the best supplier in his area.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon and tomato seedlings

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Senderos está formado por 10 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su clima frió, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de quienes los visitan, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son señoras amables, gentiles y trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Martha, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Paccha en Cuenca, tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos hijos pequeños en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Martha labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la que realiza hace 3 años, trabaja todo el día de lunes a viernes. En su casa cría y vende gallinas y cuyes, también tiene una pequeña tienda hace un año.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir compra gallinas y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es  agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
The “Nuevos Senderos” (New Paths) communal bank has ten members living in various parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is noted for its cold climate.  It’s been a World Heritage Site since 1999.  It has many tourist attractions, a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of all who visit and its residents keep the culture and traditions of its peoples.  The members are kind, agreeable and hardworking; they carry out various activities that allow them to cover household expenses and support their families.

One of the members is Martha.  She lives in Paccha Parish in Cuenca.  She’s 29 years old, married and has had three children who are 12, 10 and 8 years old.  Her oldest son is in secondary school and the two little ones go to a local little elementary school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  The house she lives in is hers.

Martha’s works as a domestic employee; she’s had this job for three years and works all day Monday through Friday.  At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs and also has had a small store for the last year.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy chickens and basic staples to stock her store.  Her goal is to enlarge the store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and basic staple items.

loans.name: Independientes Group

texts.es:
L. señora Esther vive en una ribera pequeña, es casada con el señor  José Iván y con quien procreo un hijo que tiene L. edad D. trece años en primero D. secundaria.

    ElL. se dedica a su hogar   y a su  tienda D. abarrotes en L. que solicito el préstamo  para  invertirlo en  ello ya que le hacen falta algunas cosas que  están un poco altas D. preció y sus clientes lo buscan.


   ElL. se  inspiro  en esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos D. L. casa  y así  también  tener sus  propios ahorros para  comprar cosas que L. hacen falta mejorar su hogar.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad elL.  pueda tener un mejor bienestar para su familia y  agrandar más su negocio con mercancía D. mejor producto.
 
   Las persona que integran en el grupo son L. señora Iddai quien invirtió el préstamo  en L. compra y venta D. marranos, así también se integra L. señora Rosaría quien invertirá el préstamo  en L. compra D. ingredientes para elaborar panes.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther lives on a small embankment along the river. She is married to Sr. José Iván and they have a 13-year-old son who is in his first year of high school. Esther takes care of the home and manages a grocery store. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business because she is lacking a few items. The prices are a little high and her customers are wanting to buy them.

Esther was inspired to start this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and to set asiD. some savings so that she could buy things that were lacking in their home. What she wants most from her business is to be able to proviD. the best for her family’s welfare and to expand her store with more merchandise and better products.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Sra. Iddai will invest her loan in the purchase and sale of pigs. • Sra. Rosaria will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Melida Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Melida del Carmen tiene 35 años de edad,  esta casada y tiene 5 hijos, junto con su esposo se dedican a la caficultura, en la actualidad cuentan con 4 manzanas de café que son la fuente principal de ingresos,  a la vez su esposo se dedica a la agricultura lo que le genera otros ingresos para el consumo familiar. 

Melida utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, la zona en donde viven es muy lejana y carecen de este servicio basico, gracias a este panel solar podran iluminarse por las noches y tambien podran ver television, doña Melida piensa seguir trabajando con prisma para mejorar su finca.
texts.en:
Melida del Carmen is 35 years old, married, and has five children.  She and her husband are coffee growers.  They currently have four manzanas (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of coffee which is their main source of income.  Her husband also works in agriculture which makes extra income for their family.

Melida will use this loan to buy a solar panel.  The area in which they live is very remote and they lack this basic service.  Thanks to this solar panel, they will be able to light their home at night and also watch television.  Melida plans to continue working with Prisma in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and married. She supports a family of seven members. Her spouse, Herbert, is a farmer who provides additional income for the family.  Mary's children are 20, 16, 12, 8 and 6 years old.  Mary has raised poultry in her farm in Kapsabet for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Mary has become a member of one of KADET LTD's self-help groups. She has borrowed KES 20,000 for her first term loan and wishes to use it to purchase more chickens for her farm.  Mary will use the anticipated profits to improve the farm and repay the borrowed amount. Her dream is to see her farm expand and to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for the farm

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Sonia sigue con  el local de multiservicios, ella sigue brindando servicios como por ejemplo venta de paquetes turísticas, locutorio, internet y revelado de fotografías. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para fotografias. 

Sonia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (Ella en la fotografía está acompañada de su esposo y una de sus hijas).
texts.en:
Sonia continues to participate in the "Chaska" communal bank of the microfinance institution Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Sonia is still working in her multiservice business where she provides her services such as the sale of tourist packages, telephone service, internet café and photo development. She has already been in this activity for several years and done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. This time Sonia applies for a loan to buy photographic materials.

Sonia is thankful for the opportunity provided by this means and she commits herself to pay off the loan according to the time schedule. (She is pictured with her husband and one of their daughters.)

loans.use: to buy photographic materials.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, aged 33 years, is married and supports seven people in his family. He has been in farming for the past four years and getting good returns from the harvests.
 
He learned about KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his first loan with KADET and he intends to spend the loan amount on preparing the land for farming and purchasing maize seeds.

His anticipation from the profits generated is to plough them back into the farm and he dreams of becoming a well-known and great farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a hard-working farmer who lives at Furagui, Solana. He is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. 

He has been raising crops for almost 20 years, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell.  According to him, the income generated from the business is just enough to sustain daily allowances for his children and meals for the family. 

He is asking for a loan so that he can improve his farming business. He needs PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.

Hopefully, he will increase his earnings and further improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 

Rosalinda buys and peddles vegetables like string beans and sliced raw jack-fruit for vegetable soup.  She has had this business for 20 years.  She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib 1, 2, ,3,sous Groupe 2

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté1, 2, 3, sous groupe 2 est   un regroupement  de 9  membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe  de 9 femmes regroupées dans le meme secteur d’activité de la couture et de  commerce de tissus et  divers autres produits. Elles   sont représentées par madame  Fatou    qui représente la personne habillée en  jaune sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de tissus  et produits divers. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 9 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle a  19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés à renforcer son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite dans l’avenir diversifier son activité le maximum  possible.
texts.en: Al Ouma Liberté 1, 2, 3, Sous Group 2 is a grouping of nine members who all belong to the same association which is a national solidarity group. This group of nine women are in the same business sector of sewing, fabric, and various other products. Fatou, the person dressed in yellow in the photo, represents the women. For more than ten years she has been very involved with the fabric business and of various other products. She capitalizes on her experience of more than ten years in these businesses and begins her day from 9 in the morning in order to return home by 7 in the evening. She seeks a planned loan to buy fabric intended to reinforce her commerce activity. She wishes to diversify her business as much as possible in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a variety of articles to sell.

loans.name: Jesutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTIN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sydole Vicentia Adjoua est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sydole Vicentia Adjoua est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Luc. Sydole Vicentia Adjoua a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sydole Vicentia Adjoua vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Sydole Vicentia Adjoua vend depuis sept ans, de la nourriture (pâte de maïs) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Sydole Vicentia Adjoua vend de la farine de manioc et du charbon de bois. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Sydole Vicentia Adjoua s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sydole Vicentia Adjoua sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTIN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et de farine de manioc, des condiments.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is 32 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 5 and 8 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to increase his savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Rael, a 33-year-old wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Kapsowar in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Rael always says, “I eat from my sweat." Her primary sources of income are milk and planting different varieties of crops.

Because of poor productivity on her farm and reaping nothing, Rael wants to diversify and start sheep farming. The Kapsowar area has a ready market for sheep meat (mutton) and wool, hence she will not have a need to go and look for a market. Being a hardworking mother, Rael has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school.

Rael detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking the loan. Rael is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly instalments. You can help Rael with a loan so she can fulfill all her dreams. This loan will bring untold joy to Rael and her family because she will be able to sell sheep wool and meat. Kindly help her realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of sheep.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is married with five children and two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She sales charcoal at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.  She works seven days a week.  She would like to build rental houses and also educate her children. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and does not have access to  piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO increase the stock of wedding atire and decoration materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with three children, all in primary school. She started her shop with capital from her husband’s savings back in 1993. She has not undergone any training yet but she has finished her studies. She runs the business together with her husband. They buy beauty products and clothes from the capital city (Nairobi) once a week and sell them locally. With a loan of $300 from PEMCI, she intents to increase her beauty product stock and convert her shop to a wholesale shop. This will enable her to gain enough income to sustain her family. Through her business she has gained a wide range of knowledge and skill, allowing her to teach other local women how to run and manage a business.

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Like many women, Ludmila is excited when she can quickly pick up a small gift such as an accessory or photo album for a friend when she needs it. Today she can not only do just that, but she also provides this valuable service for others. For the last nine years, Ludmila has been investing her time and finances in developing her small business in the busy central market in Melitopol. Years of experience have equipped her to be a very successful entrepreneur. The business has grown to the point now where she has been able to hire an employee to help her with sales. In addition to her daily work, Ludmila also cares for her elderly mother who lives with her and does not receive enough from her small pension to support herself.

Ludmila is known as a goal-oriented business owner, who is optimistic about the future. Recently she purchased a second kiosk and would like increase her inventory in order to boost her earnings. She is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase additional inventory, which will allow her to continually meet the needs of her customers while providing for her own financial responsibilities.

Людмила, як і кожна жінка, радіє можливості придбати невеличкий подарунок, як, наприклад, аксесуар або рамку для фотографій для когось з друзів. Але вона може ще й запропонувати такі товари у своєму кіоску. На протязі останніх 9 років Людмила вкладала час та кошти в розвиток свого бізнесу на центральному ринку м. Мелітополь. За ці роки вона стала успішним підприємцем. Зараз бізнес виріс настільки, що Людмила може навіть взяти на роботу одного реалізатора. Окрім ведення бізнесу Людмила ще піклується про мати похилого віку, яка живе з нею та отримує зовсім крихітну пенсію. Людмила – дуже цілеспрямована людина, вона оптимістично дивиться у майбутнє. Нещодавно вона придбала другий кіоск, зараз хоче закупити товар для того, щоб підвищити власні прибутки. Людмила просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів, задовольнити попит з боку покупців та сприяти подальшому розвитку власного бізнесу.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab K. has a small grocery shop in a village on the outskirts of Makeni town.  She is one of only a few traders in the community and her store is very popular there. Thirty-six years old, she is married to a teacher and they have five children.  Since teachers' salaries are very small, Zainab’s business income plays a crucial role in the paying of education expenses for her children and other basic needs. Her previous loan from SMT, her first, was used to expand the business by purchasing more stock.  She would like to use the loan funds from this second loan for a similar purpose.

loans.use: Increase stock in grocery shop

loans.name: Blasia

texts.es:
Blasia is 38 years old, she is the single mother of two children who are 10 and 15 years old, both study in a highschool in the city.

Blasia began working when she was very little so as to provide for her humble family. Despite the fact that she has had a lot of problems she is very proud to serve as both mother and father to both of her children. With much sacrifice and strength she was able to obtain her own small store from which to sell sweets, fast food and lunches out of her home to people who work in her area.

The business is coming along very well, she tells us that her clients really like the food that she prepares. Blasia wishes to continue progressing and diversifying the products that she sells, therefore she is asking for a credit of $100 which she will invest the purchase of products of highest necessity such as sugar, rice, flour, and noodles to sell in the store out of her house and in this way help her pantry to grow thereby increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blasia tiene 38 años, es soltera y madre de dos hijos, uno de 10 años y otro de 15, ambos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad.

Blasia trabajo desde muy pequeña, ya que ella proviene de una familia muy humilde; a pesar de que tuvo muchos problemas cuenta con mucho orgullo que es madre y padre para sus hijos. Con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo logro poner un pequeño comedor y ventas de golosinas en su casa, vende comidas rápidas y también prepara almuerzos a personas que trabajan en la zona.

El negocio marcha muy bien, nos cuenta que sus clientes gustan mucho de las comidas que ella prepara. Blasia desea seguir progresando y diversificar los productos que vende, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 100 que los invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad tales como azúcar, arroz, harina y fideos para venderlos en su comedor y así de a poco montar una despensa para aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of products of greatest necessity like sugar, rice, flour, and noodles to sell from the shop in her home.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en: The parents have two children (6 and 5 years old) who currently are in school. Their father works as day laborer whiL. his wife takes care their children and works in their green dragon garden. Their average income is $12. 5 per month/ person. They want to borrow $75 to invest their green dragon garden so they can earn more money to save for their children’s education. They will pay back their loan within the next 5 months.

loans.use: Green dragon

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is an active and positive 21-year-old woman who is determined to succeed in life. She is married and will have her first child very soon, as she’s four months pregnant.

Two years ago, Sandra graduated as a hair stylist from a beauty academy. She wants to exercise her profession and make a living. She needs funds to open a small beauty salon, which she will run within her house.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of materials, such as a blower, hair dying products and hair treatment lotion. She says that she has already bought other products, such as shampoo, face cleansing lotions, and a used hair-washing machine, with her husband's help. The entrepreneur hopes she can get the funds before long so that she can make her dream come true.

loans.use: To buy materials to start a small beauty salon

loans.name: Auxiliadora Modeta

texts.es:
Mrs. G. works selling a variety of fruits. She has had her business for 25 years, having started with a sum of C$1,000.00 from her savings.

In the beginning, Mrs. G. sold in the city of Masaya, but seeking to make better sales, she moved to Leon and established her business in the market of the Terminal, where she manages to obtain a space (which, by the way, is not in very good condition).

Mrs. G. is a hardworking person, married, and has three children. Together with her husband, she works hard to raise and educate their three little ones who are studying in elementary and jr. high school.

For the past two years she has benefited from Ceprodel's help, having received 25 loans, which have directly aided in the expansion of her fruit business and fixing up the stand where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio a que se dedica la señora G. es a la venta de frutas variadas teniendo su negocio desde hace 25 años que dio inicio con un monto de C$1.000.00 producto del ahorro que la señora tenia.

Para iniciar con este negocio la señora G. vendía en la ciudad de Masaya pero por tener mejores ventas se traslada a León ubicándose en el mercado de la Terminal donde logro obtener un tramo o espacio físico que por cierto no presenta buenas condiciones.

La señora G. es una persona muy trabajadora, casada y con 3 hijos que junto a su esposo luchan para salir adelante en su proceso de formación y educación a sus pequeños que estudian en niveles de primaria y secundaria.

Ha sido beneficiada desde hace dos años por Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento habiéndole otorgado 25 créditos de los que le han beneficiado directamente en una ampliación de su negocio de frutas y obteniendo mejores condiciones en el puesto de su trabajo.

loans.use: Buying fruit (Compra de las frutas)

loans.name: Iyan

texts.en: Iyan, 37, sells kerosene to earn more income for the family and earns $45 a month, while her husband, A., does not work anymore. She is asking for a loan of $125 to add to her business capital. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is a 48-year-old woman from Visoko. Her husband  has a full-time job in a textile and leather factory. His monthly income  is US$ 300. They have two children  and this is  her second loan  in the amount of  US$ 750. She wants to buy more livestock and she intends to  expand her business with livestock.

loans.use: Buy another cow

loans.name: Sarwer's Group

texts.en: S. P., this group's leader, is married and a mother of four.  Her family resides in the small town of Depalpur, Pakistan. Her husband sells rugs and blankets by going door-to-door. He started this business a few years ago after completing grade 12 of his education. He buys rugs and blankets from Kasur, Pakistan, which is famous for its production of woolen items. To contribute to her household income, she sells milk taken from her family's two dairy cows. The four other group members are:  Irshad B., who raises crops; Shahnaz B., whose husband runs a barber shop; Rani B., who is divorced and is borrowing for her brother who runs a bike rental; and Maqsood S., who wants to rent farming land.  Altogether, they are requesting from Kiva a loan of $1,725.00.

loans.use: To buy rugs and blankets in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Prach

texts.en:
Prach S., aged 32, is a father of two children and lives with his wife in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. He owns a plot of farmland growing rice, earning around $3 a day of income. His wife is a garment worker with a daily income $5 per day. Their two children are students.

He would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump to water his rice crops in the dry season. This will help him to grow rice in both the raining and dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Cường, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She lives with her husband and their 4 children, 3 are still in school age. She uses funds from the loans to buy exotic seafood like eels and frogs then resells to the restaurants in the area. Her merchandises are popular. A good percentage of the monthly income of 300-400USD is reinvested. With a good economy she has been filling her house with furniture and appliances. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Cường, 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 4 người con, 3 trong số đó đang học phổ thông. Vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Cường sử dụng thu mua thực phẩm như lươn, ếch sau đó đem bán cho các nhà hàng. Hàng bán chạy, đồng vốn được quay vòng liên tục nên tạo hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Bình quân một tháng chị Cường thu 300-400USD. Kinh tế phát triển mạnh nên đồ đạc tiện nghi trong nhà được sắm sửa đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị Cường xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Invest in seafood business

loans.name: G Léocadie

texts.fr:
Born on March 3, 1978 in Cotonou, Mrs. Leocadie G K. is married to Mr. Simon Loko and is the mother of two. She lives in Ahouassa in a neighborhood of Cotonou. She specializes in the sale of cereals and she purchases her stock primarily in Parakou, the third largest city in Benin. She travels to make her purchases at least once a month which she orders by commission from the venders. Her customers find her upon her return to pick up their orders they have made with her previously. She is well known in her neighborhood because of her good marketing sense and above all by word of mouth between her customers. Mrs. K. became a member of Alide in September 2007 and this is her third loan request. This loan will allow her to expand her customer base and to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née le 03 Mars 1978 à Cotonou, dame K. G Léocadie est mariée à monsieur LOKO Simon et est mère de deux enfants. Elle habite Ahouassa un quartier de Cotonou où elle est locataire . Spécialisée dans la vente des produits céréaliers, elle fait généralement sa provision à Parakou, la troisième grande ville du Bénin où elle se rend une fois au moins le mois. Elle fait ses achats sur commande. Ses clients viennent dès son retour chercher leur commande. Elle est très connue dans son quartier à cause de son sens de marketing et surtout l’écoute de ses clients. Dame K. G Léocadie est devenue cliente de ALIDé depuis le 09 Septembre 2007 et à ce jour elle est à sa troisième demande de prêt. Ceci lui permettra de toucher plus de clients et surtout de satisfaire leurs demandes.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of corn, 10 bags of ice and 5 bags of beans.

loans.name: Gulharam

texts.ru:
Gulharam V. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 48 years old, divorced, and has 4 children. She has been in the business of cattle farming and production of dairy products for the last 25 years. This is the single source of income for her family since her children are still students in primary and secondary schools. At this moment in time, she would like to purchase one more milk cow. To finance this purchase she decided to obtain a loan for 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Вохидова Гулхарам жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 48 лет, разведенна, имеет 4 детей. Гулхарам вот уже 25 лет как занимается животноводством и производством кисло-молочной продукции. Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как дети клиентки еще школьники и студенты. Вданный момент клиентка хочет купить еще одну дойную корову. Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Virginia Francisca

texts.es:
Virginia, 51, lives in the Edgar Murguia neighborhood in Managua. Her husband works with her in their bakery, making deliveries. They have 4 children; the three oldest work in the bakery as well.
Virgina hopes that her children will continue working on business she started and that their quality of life will be better.
Twelve years ago, Virginia was working in a bakery, and thanks to the experience she gained, decided to start to her own bakery six years ago. At the beginning it was hard because she had little capital and only a small oven to bake, but through these years she has been able to make improvements to her small bakery.
These days the demand for Virginia's bread and pastries is growing and she requests a loan to purchase a larger quantity of ingredients, make more bread and pastries, and keep her customers satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Virginia tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Edgar Munguía de la Ciudad de Managua. Es casada, su esposo trabaja con ella en la panadería, él es quien se encarga de repartir el producto. Tiene 4 hijos, los tres hijos mayores también trabajan con ella en la panadería. Ella espera que todos sus hijos algún día puedan seguir el negocio que ella empezó y así puedan mejorar su nivel de vida. Virginia empezó hace 12 años trabajando en una panadería, debido a la experiencia que pudo adquirir en este negocio, hace 6 años decidió independizarse y poner ella misma su negocio de panadería, al inicio fue duro porque disponía de poco capital y solamente tenía un horno pequeño para hacer el pan, pero a través de los años ha ido mejorando la panadería. Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes es por eso que solicita del préstamo para poder adquirir materia prima para la elaboración del pan y así poder satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of bakery ingredients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Elizabeth K. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 13 to 20. Elizabeth has been running a grocery business since 2004. She sells maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and sugar. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Elizabeth currently earns about US$250 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$450 to buy more inventory. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Elizabeth thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and their small child in Kampong Cham.  She works as a grocer, earning about $7 each day, while her husband works as a taxi-driver between Sihanouk-Phnom Penh and earns about $3 each day.  Say believes she will earn a greater profit if she can buy grocery items in bulk and sell them at retail prices to villagers in her area.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase greater quantities of groceries.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items in bulk.

loans.name: Aicha

texts.fr:
Madame B. Aicha est née le 3à juillet 1988 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ses principaux clients sont les boulangers et les restauratrices de pâtes de maïs à Agoè. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 sacs de charbon de bois et 17 fagots de bois. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aicha B. was born on July 3, 1988, in Sokodé, in the central region of Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. Her business is the sale of firewood and charcoal in the Agoè neighborhood. Her principal clients make and sell bread and pâte [a local dish made of corn flour] in Agoè. The first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 5 sacks of charcoal and 17 bundles of firewood. With this new stock, she will be able to sell more goods and realize more profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap H., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Sokleap Chea, 32, were married in 1993 and have three sons. Two of them attend school and the youngest one is still young and stays at home. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Mr. Sopheap has been a silk weaver since he was married. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old; weaving is a skill she learned from her mother. They sell their finished product to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Therefore, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang C. raises oxen to sell for profit and uses oxen in his cultivating business. He grows different kinds of vegetables, including cabbages and cucumbers, and sells them to a seller at the market 3 months after planting. He is 30 years old and living in a rural area of Siem Reap Province.  He is married to Srey Kheav, 29, who helps him with his crop growing. The couple have three teenagers who attend school.  Eang C. is running his business very well. Unfortunately, insects ravage his vegetable crop and C. is requesting a loan of $600 to buy insecticide to protect his crops and fertilizer to help his crops grow.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
N. Khairullo is a fighter that has not allowed the passage of years to diminish the value of his work and as such has always set a solid example for many youths of today. He was born in a agricultural family that taught hard work of tilling the land and also the joint effort of an arduous work. He has been dedicated for 5 years to agriculture; sowing corn, potatoes, onion and etc. together with his children and wife (pictured). At harvest time he works at the    wholesale market in his locality in order to maximize the profits. Khairullo requests a loan to acquire a greater quantity of fertilizer with the objective of improving the quality of his products. Support Khairullo and his desire to work hard.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing vegetables

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo " Nueva Esperanza " esta representado por el señor Ricardo y compuesto por 12 miembros dentro de los cuales existe un parentesco entre la señora Sandra  y su hijo el señor Isaac  Freddy  todos ellos tienen ingresos independiente uno del otro por lo que no existe riesgos en el grupo. En su mayoría los miembros del grupo se dedican al comercio de productos como cosmeticos, carne, cotillon,comida, ropa, abarrotes y a actividades como la la reparacion de computadoras, pintutra de viviendas, servicio de transporte público de pasajeros.  Dentro del rubro comercial existe la oferta y la demanda y la competencia, todo depende de ofrecer productos de calidad y a un bajo precio, también de la capacidad de los socios de salir adelante ante cualquier obstáculo. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de insumos y materiales para mejorar  sus negocios e incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calida de vida de sus familias. Entre las socias hay quienes tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios y otras que reciben su primer financiamiento pero se sienten capaces de poder cumplir con su grupo y con la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda la oportunidad de un financiamiento con grandes ventajas.
texts.en:
The 'Nueva Esperanza' (New Hope) group is represented by Ricardo, and is made up of 12 members including one mother and son: Sandra and her son Isaac Freddy. All of the members have incomes independent of each other, so there is no risk of dependence within the group. The majority of the members work selling products including cosmetics, meat, party favours, food, clothing and groceries, or work in the service sector offering computer repair, house painting and public transport services. Within the commercial sphere there is competition between supply and demand, and the members rely on being able to offer high quality products at low prices. They also draw on their capacity to make progress despite any obstacle. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and materials to improve their businesses, increase their income and improve the quality of life for their families. Within the group some members have previous experience with solidarity groups, while others are receiving their first loans but feel able to fulfil their obligations to the group and to the Agrocapital Foundation, which offers them the opportunity of credit on favourable terms.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Nhor Martt Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 13 members, is located in the Kor village in the Takeo province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Nhor M. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because the field is infertile; thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Um Sam Arth, is a cook who is hired by people for wedding ceremonies, festival ceremonies, parties, and so on.

Mrs. Nhor M. is 51 years old and the mother of three children: one is a security guard, another stays at home to do housework, and the remaining one attends the local school. The husband of group member Mrs. Borin S. is present in the picture too.

Eleven members of this group loan are utilizing end-of-term loans while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Damaris Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Damaris H. se dedica a la venta de productos diversos teniendo su propia pulpería el cual ha logrado mejorar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Ella es una dama muy entusiasta y con un gran espíritu de superación que ha logrado mejorar su situación y buscado la manera de cómo brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su pequeño hijo por ser menor de edad. La razón por la que acude a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería para ofertarla en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damaris H. sells various products in her mini market. This has helped her provide better sustenance to her household. She is a very enthusiastic lady, and she has a great spirit for getting ahead. She has been able to improve her situation and look for the way to bring a better level of life to her small, minor child. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise to sell in her mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City with her husband and three children. Her husband manages their farm which is located two to three kilometers away from their house.

Daisy already had her business prior to her partnership with HSPFI. Yet she is very thankful, since HSPFI has been assisting her business by providing her with additional capital.

Daisy wants to help her husband in supporting the needs of their three children who are all in school. The opening class is fast approaching and so Daisy wants to take the opportunity to increase her merchandise for sale. She is requesting an additional loan of PHP 11,000 to buy additional stock such as school supplies, bottled water, soft drinks and variety of candies.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza calle del ejercito y cuenta con estudios de 3er grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años e inicio sus préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta abarrotes.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio y poder surtirlo, comprará gaseosas, golosinas, huevos,, otros.
Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
Señora Delfina is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 53 years of age, living with her domestic partner and has six children. She lives in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood, on Army Street, and has completed a third grade primary education. The Señora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last eleven years. She began with a loan of 300 New Sols which enabled her to increase her working capital for her business selling groceries. At present, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 New Sols. This would allow her to buy larger quantities of merchandise and to stock up her business. She is going to buy soft drinks, sweets, eggs and other things. Her greatest desire is to buy herself a little house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy Y. is thirty-eight years old. She is married with five children, one daughter and four sons. She says her children are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital in the Brong Ahafo region.

Mercy trades in smoked fish. She procures it from Dormaa and sells in the local market on a table top. She also treks to other towns to sell and trades in vegetables.

Mercy has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She is hopeful that she can expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Nida is married and has a school-age child. To make a living, Nida operates a hog-fattening business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Nida has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 2006 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future.This will be the sixth loan taken out by Nida from PMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Tito

texts.en: Tito R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Tito is 24 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene 31 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías, paralelamente vende fruta por pedidos que lleva a las casas de sus clientes. Las artesanías las vende en un puesto cercano al centro de su ciudad, todos los días por las mañanas y para incrementar su mercadería también vende artículos que no fueron hechos por ella misma. Nora comenta que las temporadas más exitosas para su negocio son para fiestas patrias (julio), navidad (diciembre) y otro tipo de celebraciones, como las fiesta patronales y cívicas de su ciudad. En los años de experiencia que tiene en esta actividad ha ido aprendiendo a crear y mejorar los diseños de los artículos que realiza. El deseo a futuro de Nora es tener un puesto de ventas con grandes y bonitas vitrinas para exhibir sus artesanías. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo de trabajo en grupo ha notado que ha crecido como persona, esto la anima a continuar con esta modalidad de crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de sus artesanías (muñecas, mantas típicas, etc.), también comprará artículos de madera ya elaborados y fruta al por mayor.
texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking woman who is 31 years old. She lives with her son in her parents' home. For more than 3 years, she has been making and selling handicrafts, and at the same time, she accepts orders for fruit and delivers them to her customers’ homes. Every morning, she sells her crafts from a stall near the center of the city. To increase her inventory, she also sells works produced by other artists. Nora says the best times for her business are during the holidays, mainly Founder’s Day (July), Christmas (December), and other celebrations such as patron saint festivals and civic gatherings. In her years of experience making handicrafts, she has learned to improve the design of her creations. Nora hopes that in the future she will have a shop with large beautiful display cases for exhibiting her work.

This is her third loan with MFP, and during that time, her fellow members have noticed that she has developed as a person. She is encouraged to continue taking advantage of this form of credit. The money she is requesting will be used to buy materials used in her creations (dolls, traditional blankets, etc.). She will also purchase finished pieces of wood and fruit in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Gina Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora GINA ELIZABETH R. M., tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria.
GINA se dedica a la crianza de animales menores: patos, pollos, gallinas, gallos, para venderlos en el mercado de Moche.
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para animales.  También comprará mas animales.
GINA  sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus animales y vender con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Gina Elizabeth Rodríguez M. is 23, and she lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of Las Delicias II Community Bank. This entrepreneur attended high school up until her fifth year. Gina raises small livestock like ducks, chickens, hens, and roosters to sell in the Moche market. She will use this loan for 300 PEN to buy food for the animals. She will also buy more animals. Gina dreams of increasing the number of animals she is raising and of selling more frequently.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for animals and buy more animals

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane M. is from the village of Katipa. She is 35 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Mary Jane owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2005, Mary Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Mary B. lives in the Foyah Market Community. She is widowed and has five children. For about six years, Mary has been engaged in the sale of fish and rice at retail prices. Financial problems and illiteracy have been her biggest challenges, and but she is successful in attracting consumers to her business by using effective sales methods.

She dreams of someday owning a storage center which will help her more successfully to support all of her children.

loans.use: To buy fish and rice for market sale

loans.name: Ana Angela

texts.es: Ana Angela es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 31 años y es madre de dos niños menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ella vende por catálogos  estos productos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se desempeña como chofer de autos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Positiva” desde hace cuatro años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su entusiasmo y las ganas de salir adelante. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue para invertir en productos de belleza para vender, ahora Ana necesitan un préstamo de 1300 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir, ya que tiene una buena cartera de clientes. La meta de Ana es tener una boutique  y seguir aportando en la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Angela is a dynamic and persevering woman who lives in the Pucallpa region of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and is the mother of two young children. She is dedicated to the sale of beauty products. She sells the beauty products by catalog and counts on the support of her husband who works as a chauffeur. She has been a part of the Positive Communal Bank for the last four years where she has always been characterized by her enthusiasm and desire to get ahead. The first loan she obtained was for investing in beauty products to sell. Now Ana needs a loan of $475 (1300 soles) that will be utilized to buy more articles of clothing now that she has an established client list. Ana's goal is to have a boutique and continue contributing to the economy in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is 33 years old, married, and has one child (boy) who is in school. She trades in plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, cooking utensils, etc., and has seven years experience in selling. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in bulk in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She sells her goods by hawking in the community market and its surroundings. Demand for her goods is booming on a straight path, therefore she requests the loan to buy stock. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking utensils, plastics bowls, and oranges

loans.name: Bousso

texts.fr: Bousso K. est une dame de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison comme les mangues, les oranges et les clémentines. Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bousso K., age 44, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells seasonal fruits such as mangoes, oranges, and clementines. This loan will enable her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell seasonal fruits (mangoes, oranges, clementines)

loans.name: Tomas Felix

texts.pt:
Tomas Félix M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, junto a fronteira com a Suazilândia, na Província de Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, viúvo e pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 2 anos. Fez somente 8ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e mais 2 irmãos sobre seu sustento.

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane com os pais por causa da guerra, devido a varias dificuldades encaradas, decidiu iniciar o seu próprio negocio. Faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia e conta com um empregado que lhe auxilia neste trabalho. O seu rendimento mensal é de cerca de 10.000.00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum na sua conta bancária através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa). 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos que fazem a mesma actividade. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, varões de ferro, barrotes e outros) para poder cobrir uma parte da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habitação a sua família.
texts.en:
Tomas Félix M. was born in the district of Namaacha, close to the Suazilândia border, in the province of Maputo. He is 28 years old, widow, and father of two children of 5 and 2 years old. He did only up to the 8th grade at school. He did not continue because his parents had no condition to afford it. He lives in his own house with his two children plus two brothers, all of whom he supports.

He left Namaacha to Boane with his parents because of the war. Due to several difficulties he faced, he decided to begin his own business. He works about 10 hours a day, and has an employee help him. His monthly income is of approximately MZN 10,000, which he applies on supporting his family, as well as on saving on his bank account through Xitique (rotational traditional savings system).

He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through his friends, who do the same activity as him. This is his second loan, of MZN 15,000, with which he intends to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, iron rods, beams and others) in order to cover part of his house. His previous loan was of MZN 10,000, for the same activity.

In the future, he intends to request more loans to conclude his house construction and provide better housing conditions to his family.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (construction sheets, beams and others)

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana A. is from the town of Capas Arwas, Binalonan Pangasinan. She is 51 years old. Susana is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Susana owns & operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Susana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Susana is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Susana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Liutofaga

texts.en:
Liutofaga  F. is 37 and married with 4 children (ages 3 - 11).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Liutofaga  has many years of experience in this business.  Liutofaga  needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Liutofaga  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Liutofaga 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Liutofaga  F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas has worked in flooring since 1995 on a freelance basis. He works hard to earn an income and satisfy the needs of his three children. Today, Abbas is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a small electric motor and a flooring polish machine.

loans.use: To buy a small electric motor and a flooring polish machine

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.es: Dolores Yolanda  solicito un financiamiento para incrementar la venta de su productos, ya que se encontraba en una fecha de bastantes pedidos, y quería la señora cumplir con todos ellos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de perfumes, cremas, mascarillas, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas y faldas. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Dolores Yolanda is seeking a loan to increase her product sales since she has received many orders and she would like to be able to fulfill all of them. She sells general merchandise and is a very hard-working woman who enjoys her work. She puts forth so much effort in order to provide income for her home and her family. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumres, creams, mascara, underwear, pants, shirts and skirts. She dreams of having her own home with better accommodations and to have a very productive business established in the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy Chor, 31, is single and lives with her elderly mother in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been selling bread for 3 years. She buys it from a bakery in Phnom Penh and resells it in her village. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Flora Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Everes en la parroquia rural Pueblo Nuevo en la provincia de Manabí, este es un sector que se dedica a la agricultura y a la avicultura.

 Flora esta dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza,  ropa y zapatos que  lo maneja  bajo  pedidos, la ropa la compra en Portoviejo, comercializa productos Avon  hace 8 años y Yanbal  hace 2,  trabaja sola y  recorre las comunidades por el sector donde vive, tiene 4 hijos el esposo no trabaja y ella se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar para sacar adelante a la familia, su mercderia deja a crédito y cada 8 días realiza los cobros. nuestra socia  invertirá todo el crédito en los productos como cremas, perfumes, tratamientos de belleza y mas cosmeticos así como pantalanes, blusas, camisas, bermudas etc porque  tiene varios pedidos de ropa por entregar a sus clientes, por el momento se siente bien con sus negocios pero no descarta la posibilidad de tener otro trabajo para ayudar mas a su familia cuenta que se le hace difícil porque han bajado las ventas.

La señora Flora vive con sus hijos y el esposo,  uno de sus anhelos es poder salir a trabajar a otro país.
texts.en:
Señora Flora is a member of the communal bank, "Everes" in the rural parish of Pueblo Nuevo in the province of Manabí, which is an area that is dedicated to agriculture and poultry farming. Flora sells beauty products, clothing, and shoes, which she does by taking orders. She buys the clothing in Portoviejo. She has sold Avon products for 8 years and Yanbal products for 2 years. She works alone and travels to communities in the area where she lives. She has 4 children. Her husband doesn't work, and she saw the need to work to take care of their family. She sells her merchandise on credit, and she collects payments every week. Our member will invest all of her loan in products like creams, perfumes, beauty treatments, and more cosmetics as well as pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, etc. She has various clothing orders to deliver to her customers. For the moment, she feels good with her business but she doesn't discard the possibility of having another job to help her family more because it is difficult because her sales have decreased. Flora lives with her children and her husband. One of her dreams is to be able to work in another country.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, beauty treatments, blouses, shirts, pants, and shorts

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en:
S. Valijon is a young married man and the father of two children. He travels to different markets in the region in search of heads of cattle to purchase, which he then sells both at retail in the market and wholesale to butchers.

Valijon now needs a loan of 7500 TJS, which he plans to use to purchase more heads of cattle. His dreams are to improve his business, establish his own wealth and improve his home.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to resell both in retail and wholesale markets.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 61 years old and married with eight children. He is a carpenter who makes lovely furniture to sell. He has been in this business for a long time, and loves it because it is highly profitable. Jacob is a hardworking man who hopes to lift his business and family above poverty. He is very punctual in his business because he believes that punctuality is the soul of business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more wood in order to make more furniture to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for furniture-making

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 57 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo Santos (59), quien es agricultor, y D. sus 2 hijos que ya son jóvenes.

DesD. muy pequeña veía como todos los integrantes D. su comunidad se dedicaban a la agricultura, así aprendió las técnicas necesarias D. la siembra. Ha pasado el tiempo y en la actualidad siembra junto a su esposo productos tales como papa, olluco y habas, los cuales luego D. meses D. mucha dedicación y cuidado recoge para vender a los comerciantes mayoristas D. la ciudad. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es lo que mejor sabe hacer y obtiene buenas ganancias, paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. leche fresca, la cual que comercializa a diario, pues tiene 2 vacas que llegan a dar hasta 25 litros D. leche al día. Para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y comprar una vaca más para producir mayor cantidad D. leche.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. También menciona le gusta trabajar con los integrantes D. su banco comunal, pues todos son muy responsables y puntuales en el pago D. sus cuotas.

Juana tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. abono para asegurar sus tierras para las próximas siembras, también comprará pasto para alimentar a sus vacas.
texts.en:
Juana, 57, lives in her own home with her husband Santos (59), who is a farmer, and their 2 children who are still young. From the time she was very small she used to see all of the members of her community working in agriculture. In this way she learned the techniques needed for cultivation. Now much time has passed, and she currently cultivates, along with her husband, products such as potatoes, olluco (an Andean tuber crop), and beans. After many months of dedication and care, she harvests her products to sell to the wholesale traders in the city. She enjoys her work very much, because it is what she does best, and she obtains good earnings. In addition, she sells fresh milk, which she brings to market daily. She has 2 dairy cows that give her up to 25 liters of milk per day. For the future, she has plans to cultivate a larger quantity of plants and to buy another dairy cow so that she can produce a greater quantity of milk. This is the 4th loan that she has taken with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have maD. this loan possible, a loan that will allow her to continue to work. In addition, she mentions that she likes working with the members of her communal bank, as they are all responsible and punctual with their payments. Juana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of organic fertilizer to maintain her land for the next planting season. In addition, she will buy grass to feed her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and feed for her cows

loans.name: Laminyim East Auma Doreen Group
