texts.en: A. Doreen is a fifty-year-old, hardworking business woman; she is married with three children, and she has three siblings in school too. She has a silverfish business, which she has been operating for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase silverfish, that is to say she will buy more than eight bags for sale. She is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to obtain land and livestock.

loans.use: To purchase silverfish; she will buy more than eight bags for sale.

loans.name: Fidélia

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de couture. C’est pour cela qu’en 2002 elle a ouvert sa boutique de couture dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un aspirant notaire de justice. Elle est très bien connue de nombreuses clientes qui apprécient la qualité de ses services. Cette femme achète des pagnes de qualité qu’elle revend ensuite à ses clientes ; raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Wax Hollandais, 20 pagnes Hitarget et bien d’autres produits. Elle est mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This woman learned to be a seamstress. Because of this skill, she opened a sewing boutique in 2002 in the Hédzranawoé quarter of Lomé. She is married to an aspiring judicial notary. She is very well known by a number of clients who appreciate the quality of her services. This women purchases quality fabric which she then resells to clients. She is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 15 pieces of Dutch, waxed fabric, 20 pieces of Hitarget fabric, and lots of other products. She is the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Nyame Nhyira Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Abena describes herself as active and very dedicated, a woman who sees no challenge too great. She is 50 years old and she is the leader of the “Nyame Nhyira” (translated as "Blessings of God") borrower group. Abena lives in Dormaa and sells earthenware pots. Earthenware is pottery made of fairly coarse-textured baked clay that is fired at a very low temperature. It is made into pots, plates, and bowls. She has been selling earthenware pots for the past 15 years. Abena is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase more earthenware pots from manufacturers.

She wants to use the extra profits she anticipates as a result of this loan to support her children's education. She is married to a farmer and together they have three children from age 14-29 who are pursuing education at primary school level.

loans.use: To purchase earthenware dishes in bulk

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a young man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. At 29 years of age, he is married to a peasant wife and together they have four children aged 8, 6, 5, and 2 years.  He is the breadwinner for his family of six people. They live in a semi-permanent house Alex constructed with the income from his hard work. He dreams of one day constructing a permanent house. 

Alex operates a retail shop and has been in business for two years, now having begun selling Coca Cola only. He also has future plans of seeing his shop become a wholesale business for bigger opportunities. Alex intends to use the loan funds to purchase sugar, jelly, soap and other domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, jelly, soap for selling in his shop.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally A. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Sally is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. Her income comes from selling personal home products and ready-to-wear products like dresses and shoes to the local community members. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & used as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Salvie

texts.en: Salvie D. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 25 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Salvie owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Salvie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Salvie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: Dilfuza D. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39 and married. She has three daughters; the two older girls are at school and the youngest one is not yet. Dilfuza breeds livestock and her husband works in Russia. Dilfuza started her activity 13 years ago with the initial investment of 3,000 soms and now, selling some sheep after fattening, she makes 5,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money to celebrate her daughter’s wedding. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase six sheep in order to increase the number of livestock she has. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase six sheep

loans.name: Youghaber

texts.en: Youghaber H. is a life-long resident of Artik village.  Artik is located in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Youghaber has five beautiful children: three daughters (10, 15 and 16 years old) and two sons (18 and 20 years old).  Due to medical conditions, Youghaber’s husband is unable to work on their small farm.  Youghaber has been engaged in raising cattle for the past four years.  In order to grow her business, she is looking for a loan.  She will use the funds to increase her livestock and purchase feed.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest farmer.  She expects the family income to grow by 20% with the additional business investment.  Youghaber will use the funds to support her children’s education, pay medical expenses for her husband and also save a bit of the funds.  Her dream is to build a house for her family.  Youghaber enjoys living in Artik.  She is fortunate to have many relatives and friends living nearby.

loans.use: To purchase calves and feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
63-year-old Josephine S. is requesting a loan through ASHI which will be used to enhance her pig raising business. She wants a larger amount of capital to be able to purchase more pigs. She started this business in 2004 in order to augment her husband’s income as a farmer. With their children’s needs, Josephine and her husband’s sporadic incomes are insufficient to be able to grow their businesses at the same time.

Starting her business with a few pigs to be raised and sold after a period of time, Josephine then became a member of ASHI where she has been able to obtain a loan, so her ability to raise more pigs has improved.  Her husband has been supporting her and has been partnering her in running the business. Out of the profit Josephine is making through her business, she has been able to support her grandchildren’s education and she hopes that her business will grow more in order to support her family’s dreams. 

Her long term goals are to have a full-fledged hog fattening business, to invest in her home, and to have a sustainable secondary farming business.

loans.use: To purchase additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Huitzililla que significa "lugar de los colibríes", esta ubicado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, en el estado de Morelos, México. Esta conformado por 5 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son **la señora Cruz P. Sánchez va a comprar con su préstamo cosméticos, labiales, sombras, perfumes etc. para surtir sus pedidos, **la señora Margarita B. G. va a comprar jabón, refrescos, sopas, aceite, azúcar, huevo para surtir su tienda, **la señora Maribel C. Sánchez  va a comprar zapatos de dama, caballero, niños y bebes para surtir sus pedidos, **la señora Luisa V. Sánchez va a comprar verdura, tomate, jitomate, chiles para empezar su negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, **la señora Felipa Sánchez Pérez va a comprar paletas de crema para iniciar su negocio de paletería. Ellas quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias que existen estos programas que ayudan para podamos seguir adelante ya que podemos trabajar en los negocios, nos ayudan a progresar y a vivir mejor.” La señora Margarita B. G. es integrante del grupo Huitzililla tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre su esposo es jornalero trabaja en el campo, ella estudio hasta el 5º. Año de primaria tiene 3 hijos 1 hombre y 2 mujeres santiago tiene 21 años trabaja en Cuautla en una zapatería, Arisbeh tiene 16 años estudia y trabaja en tienda naturista y Lorenza tiene 12 años de edad estudia, la señora Margarita tiene una tienda de abarrotes y vende producto de Jafra por catalogo y solicito su préstamo para comprar jabón, refrescos, dulces, sopas, aceite, azúcar y huevo para surtir su tienda, esta tienda se llama abarrotes peña sus suegros se la heredaron, inicio con el negocio hace 2 años la tenia su suegra pero falleció y se la dejo y ahora ella la atiende, ofrece a sus clientes que son sus vecinos refrescos, dulces, sabritas, gamesa, marinela y productos de Jafra por catalogo. La tienda esta en su casa, le ayuda su hijo Santiago los domingos a atender la tienda. Ella considera importante su negocio por que obtiene beneficios para la familia de ahí se va ayudando en los estudios de sus hijos, le gusta atender a la clientela y se siente orgullosa al tener ingresos para su familia  para alguna emergencia y no andar consiguiendo a ver quien le va a prestar, las ganancia las utiliza para gastos de su casa y para comprar mas mercancía. Ella enfrenta la competencia de 2 tiendas cerca de la suya, sus planes y esperanza son seguir en el negocio, vender más, las mejoras para sus hijos son que sigan estudiando y que estén bien de salud, esto lo piensa lograr echándole ganas a las ventas de sus productos para que crezca el negocio. A la señora Margarita le gusta el pueblo de Huitzililla por que ahí nació y ahí vive, siembran en los campos cebolla es de riego, milpa y sorgo son de temporal.
texts.en:
This group is called Huitzililla which means “place of the hummingbirds” and is located in Huitzililla in the state of Morelos, México. It has five members who are women that know each other and are neighbors. They are: Cruz P. Sánchez who will use the loan to buy cosmetics, lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, etc. to fill her pending orders. Margarita B. G., who will buy soap, soft drinks, soups, sugar, cooking oil and eggs to stock her store. Maribel C. Sánchez, who will buy shoes for ladies, men, children and infants to fill her orders. Luisa V. Sánchez, who will buy vegetables like red and green tomatoes and chilies to start her vegetable sales business. Felipa Sánchez Pérez, who will buy cream-based popsicles to start her popsicle business. They would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “Thanks to the existence of these programs that help us so that we can continue forward and work in our businesses; they help us progress and live better.” Mrs. Margarita B. G. is a member of the Huitzililla group. She is 38 years old, lives in common law union with her husband who is a field day laborer. She finished 5th grade. She has three children, a boy and two girls. Santiago is 21 and works in Cuautla in a shoe store. Arisbeth, 16, is in school and works in a natural products store. Lorenza, 12, is in school. Margarita has a grocery store and also sells Jafra brand catalogue products. She asked for the loan to buy soap, soft drinks, candies, soups, cooking oil, sugar and eggs to stock her store. The store is called “Abarrotes Peña” and it was passed down to her by her in-laws. She started the business two years ago when she still had her mother-in-law. She has since passed away and left the store to her and she tends to it now. She offers her customers, who are her neighbors, beverages, candies, Sabritas (brand of snacks), Gamesa (cracker and cookie brand), Marinela (packaged pastry brand) and Jafra catalogue products. The store is in her home. Her son Santiago helps out on Sundays. She considers her store to be important because it provides benefits for her family; it has helped her provide her children’s education. She enjoys taking care of her customers and feels proud to produce family income for any emergency and not having to seek out someone to get a loan from. She uses profits for household expenses and to buy more merchandise. She faces competition from two other stores near hers. Her plans and hopes are to continue in business and to sell more. Her hopes for her children are that they continue to study and be in good health. She hopes to reach these goals by working hard at sales so that the business grows. Margarita likes the town of Huitzililla because that’s where she was born and where she lives. They plant onions in irrigated fields and corn and sorghum seasonally.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, soft drinks, soups, cooking oil, sugar.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M., 32, has been operating a grocery store in Nyalenda estate in Kisumu City for the past 11 years. She sells cereals, fruit, and vegetables, earning a profit of 27,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married to Daniel Nyangau who is a police officer. They have two children aged nine and two-and-a-half.

She has been with KADET Ltd and she is applying for a fourth loan of 50,000 KES, which she intends to use to purchase more stock of cereals, (three sacks of maize, two sacks of beans, one sack of rice, and one sack of green grams) and add more fruits of vegetables. With the anticipated profit she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future she desires to expand her business, get a good stall in the town centre, and open a wholesale shop. She wishes to send  her children to good schools.

loans.use: purchasing cereals, fruits, & vegetables

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita vive en anticretico en la zona de Alto San Pedro de La ciudad de La Paz; esta casada, los hijos ya son mayores de edad. Ella trabaja como profesora en un instituto enseñando cocina y repostería y en su tiempos libres ella confecciona poleras, con su hijo mayor y así consigue un ingreso extra.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina de coser, que le facilitará mucho la confección de poleras.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. She is married and she has grown children. She works as a teacher in a college and she teaches cooking and pastry. In her spare time she makes t-shirts with her eldest son as an additional source of income. 

The loan she requests will be used to purchase a sewing machine which will facilitate making t-shirts.

She is a client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and she has been on time with her payments, allowing her to access another loan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cruz Donald

texts.es: Cruz Donald tiene 56 años, el es un hombre casado y junto a su pareja tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad económica es una librería, pues no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Inicio porque él no tenía un trabajo estable y necesitaba proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario, por lo que empezó por esfuerzo propio. Es por este motivo que solicita el crédito para la compra de tijera, borradores, hojas y lapiceros.
texts.en: Cruz Donald is 56 years old.  He is a married man and together with his partner he has 5 grown-up children.  His business is a bookstore.  This is not the first time that he has requested a loan.  His previous loans have been a great help to his business.  He started his business with his own effort because he didn't have a stable job and he needed to provide his family with their daily food.  He is requesting a loan to buy scissors, erasers, paper and pens.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lesimon Ole

texts.en:
Lesimon Ole M. is 32 years old. He is married to Nataana Ene Butu, and he is a father of five school-going children. Lesimon is a tomato farmer in the Narok area, and he has been doing this for the last eight years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use on his twenty acres of tomatoes to buy the fertilizers and chemicals he needs. He is also planning to buy young sheep for fattening and later will sell them at a profit. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to acquire more land for farming to increase his production and educate his children.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more tomatoes for commercial purposes and also build a house for renting. He describes himself as a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers. He is also planning to buy young sheep for fattening and selling them later.

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir M. is a married, 54-year-old man. He lives in the village of Sarkhanli in the region of Imishli. Sabir has two sons and one daughter. He started his cattle-breeding business in 2004 with the help of his wife. 

This is the first loan Sabir received from Aqroinvest and KİVA. He plans to use this loan of 2000 AZN to purchase one cow and build a stable for the three cows he now owns. He sells dairy and meat produced in his cattle-breeding business in the Imishli bazaar. This is his only source of income. 

Sabir is a hard-working and honest man. After repaying this loan Sabir plans to expand his business by taking out another loan and buying eight more cows.

loans.use: to buy one cow and to build a stable

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten S. and her husband have an olive wood workshop producing all-wood handicrafts such as crosses, statues, necklaces, etc. Faten has one daughter and three sons who are all school students. Faten and her husband work in the workshop together. Faten took out a loan to purchase work tools and to pay for printing business cards. As Christmas is around the corner, the workshop's clients are demanding more products, as well as the tourists who come to buy Christmas wooden ornaments and souvenirs. Faten has had five loans before this one from FATEN and has always committed to repayments. Faten's picture was taken in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase olive wood and business cards

loans.name: Basguloy

texts.ru: Абирова Басгулой проживает в районе Восеъ. Ей 44 года. Вдова, имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается дома. К ней приходят девушки, чтобы научиться шить платья. У нее имеются ученики. Сейчас она нуждается в получении кредита. Кредит берет для покупки новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Basguloy A., 44,  lives in Vose. She is widowed with 3 children. Basguloy has high school education. For the past ten years she has been in the business of sewing national dresses. She works from home, where young women visit her in order to learn the trade. Basguloy is applying for a loan so that she can buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk H., 50, is married and resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. H. is a farmer and sells palm sugar, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. H. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more palm sugar to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. H. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more palm sugar to resell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo U. lives in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last three years, he has made a living by growing vegetables and earns about 1,500 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Danilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 10,000 PHP, to bU. fertilizer.  He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to expand his farm. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a small farm

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo F. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 49 years old. Danilo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 29 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Totu

texts.en:
Totu T., age 32, has been a farmer for eight years. His farm is in a fertile area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming. He and his wife have two children. He learned about KADET Ltd through a marketing campaign offered by Kadet staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, and he intends to use the funds to prepare his wheat farm and purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming in order to increase his wheat production and earn enough to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer, to own a bigger piece of land, and to build a plot. Totu is an energetic man who knows he can do more if supported financially through this loan.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm and to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa E. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 62 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Generosa owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Generosa has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Generosa joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Victoria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a motorcycle transport service. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. previous loan was used as working capital for her business. 

Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase tires and other vehicle accessories. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her transport vehicle

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en: A. is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children -- all of whom go to school. A. borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell.  In the future, she hopes to build a rental house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 40 años, es un hombre feliz y responsable. Hace 10 años que convive con Jessica, su esposa, a la que quiere mucho y con la que tiene 2 hijos; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Santo Domingo. Desde muy joven comenzó a dedicarse a la actividad agrícola, el principal ingreso económico de su familia, de eso hace 23 años promedio. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, arveja y maíz, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que con mucho esfuerzo y con el pasar de los años adquirió. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder limpiar la maleza de entre sus sembríos; pero lo que le disgusta son las temporadas de helada que existen producto de las lluvias, ya que pierde muchos sembríos, generándole pérdidas. Por esa razón y porque Fredy es una persona muy inteligente, se dedica también a la ganadería; criando carneros, cerdos, y cuyes, los cuales enseba y revende a un buen precio, logrando así solventar las necesidades de su familia. Le va muy bien en su negocio, por ello más adelante está pensando adquirir una estancia, donde pueda cuidar mejor a sus animales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santo domingo de tapo”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de progreso que obtiene. Fredy, se preparará para la temporada de arveja, por ello con el crédito comprará 1 bolsa de semilla para empezar a sembrar en su terreno agrícola que descansó.
texts.en:
Fredy, 40 years old, is a happy and responsible man. For some 10 years he has lived with Jessica, his wife, whom he loves very much and with whom he has 2 children, cared for in his own house, located in the settlement of Santo Domingo.

Since Fredy was very young, he has dedicated himself to agricultural activity. This has been the principal economic activity in his family for some 23 years. His main  crops are potatoes, peas, and corn, which he plants on his own farmland, acquired over many years with much effort.

What Fredy likes most about his work is eliminating weeds that grow among his plantings. But what really bothers him are the cold spells that follow the rains, since he loses many plantings, generating loses. For this reason, and because Fredy is a very inteligent person, he also raises livestock, especially sheep, hogs, and guinea pigs, which he cares for and sells at a good price, covering his family's costs of living. His business is doing very well, and for the future, he is thinking of acquiring a ranch on which he can better care for his livestock.

Fredy belongs to the “Santo Domingo de Tapo” Communal Bnak, and this is his 6th loan through MFP. He feels very grateful for this opportunity to progress. Fredy is preparing for the pea season. With this loan, he will buy a sack of seeds to begin sowing on agricultural land that has been lying fallow.

loans.use: to buy a sack of pea (vetch) seeds to plant on fallow land.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Analyn is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Analyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres de groupe BENKADI 7 sont  des femmes mariées  ayant en une moyenne 30  ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. EIles  vivent avec leurs maries et leurs nombreux enfants à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo .
FANTA compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 à 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Il ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The 10 members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women, on average 30 years old, and have on average 4 children. They live with their husbands and numerous children in Memissala, about 30 km from the city of Niena in the Skiasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. These clients are on their fifth loan with microfinance institution Sor Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production and agriculture ingredients. The previous loans were satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, etc. Fanta plans to buy 1 bag of urea and 2 bags of complex grains and the rest on labor and hoeing. She envisions making on average 20,000 – 30,000 FCFA, which will be used towards her family’s daily needs. She hopes to increase her sales in order to better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: to buy agriculture ingredients and labor

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El señor Edgar es chofer y trabaja con una volqueta de su propiedad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, estuco) para la refacción de una habitación. Vive en casa de parientes ubicada en la zona de de la ciudad Villa Adela  de la ciudad de El Alto; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Edgar is a driver and he works with a dump truck that he owns.  He needs this loan to buy construction supplies (sand, cement and plaster) to refurbish a room.

Edgar lives in a house belonging to some relatives which is located in Villa Adela district, in the city of El Alto.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  This is his first loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and plaster to refurbish a room in his home

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma

500.000


La señora Norma tiene 48 años y vive con su esposo, su hijo, quien es educador los visita el fin de semana, ella  participo en el Banco Mujer de la zona denominado R.R.P.M, el cual obtuvo varios créditos en Fundación Mujer, cancelando todas sus operaciones en el período establecido, ella tenía el puesto de tesorera. De carácter organizado y mujer muy trabajadora, desea retomar su actividad en un local en su casa, con el objetivo de seguir apoyando el ingreso familiar. La actividad cuenta con un patrimonio importante, además de contar con un capital para la inversión a realizar, el crédito complementaría esta actividad. 


 En este negocio tiene 5 años de experiencia, al inicio su esposo le apoyo con un capital y una vez formado el Banco Mujer obtuvieron 2 créditos que  invirtió en mercadería pero atendiendo a su clientela casa por casa. En esta oportunidad y con el patrimonio existente desea seguir ofreciendo este servicio y retomar la atención en su propio local. En este crédito la clienta aporta 300.000 colones en la compra de mercadería además de contar con un inventario valorado en 150.000 colones.

 La clienta aparte de su actividad mantiene el ingreso de alquiler de 2 locales propiedad de la familia, al retomar su actividad se proyecta un período de acomodo de 2 meses ya que se debe dar un acondicionamiento del local (limpieza y decoración) por lo que se presenta  la proyección de ingresos. Ella va a cubrir el pago inicial de las cuotas con el alquiler, razón por la cual no se otorga un período de gracia.


Las condiciones de la actividad destacan que  cuenta con local ubicado en un residencial grande, en la entrada de Río Frío, prueba de esto es la presencia de un Almacén de importancia. Se pretende reactivar este local y mantener la atención de su clientela en las fincas aledañas a su casa, ya que para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y la experiencia de 5 años en el negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and lives with her husband.  Her son, who is a teacher, visits them on weekends.  Norma was a member of Banco Mujer in the area known as R.R.P.M and she obtained several loans from Fundación Mujer.  She repaid all her loans on time and held the post of treasurer.  Norma is an organized and very hard-working woman.  She would like to restart her business in premises which are located in her home with the aim of continuing to support her family.  Norma's business has important assets and she also has capital to invest.  Her loan will support her business activity.  

Norma has five years experience in this business.  In the beginning, her husband supported her with capital.  Once Banco Mujer was formed, she obtained two loans which she invested in merchandise but she sold her products to her customers door to door.  On this occasion, with her existing assets, she would like to continue offering her services to her customers but from her own premises.  With this loan, the client will invest 300,000 colones in buying merchandise and have inventory valued at 150,000 colones.

In addition to this business activity, the client also makes rental income from two premises belonging to her family.  When she re-starts her business, she plans to have a two-month adaptation period since she must get her premises ready (cleaning and decoration).  For this reason, she is presenting a revenue forecast.  She will cover the initial repayments of her loan with the rent she makes, which is why a grace period is not being awarded.
 
Norma has business premises located in a large residence, at the entrance to Río Frío.  There is evidence of this in the presence of a large store there.  She plans to re-open these premises and continue serving her customers who come from neighboring properties.  She has the support of her husband and five years experience in her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and open a store (she will add her loan money to a little capital that she already has along with business premises and furniture)

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien, 34, has 2 children. He lives with his children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns an income to support the family by selling fresh coconuts. Chien earns a living running a shop specializing in the repair and sale of electrical goods. He is an electrician and he repairs his customer's broken electrical goods and also sells reconditioned goods. He has been running his shop for 5 years.

Chien would like a loan to buy a range of different electrical goods to meet the demand of his customers and to attract new customers. He hopes that this loan will enable him to generate more income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for resale

loans.name: Buhumuriro Women's Group

texts.en:
28-year-old Judith is a lady with a happy-go-lucky and likeable disposition. The mother of two has other invaluable selling points with her enterprise, ambition and a sense of hard work. She has, by and large, made a lot of headway in her retail business the last three years with her ability to think outside the box and her unwavering desire to succeed. This has significantly been backed by her diligence. At her shop, she sells a myriad of commodities such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, sandals, plastics, beans, rice, etc. She operates from Kihihi in Western Uganda.
She says she took root in this business trivial round with capital from her food sales business, which she still operates though she has someone who she delegated duties to. This is the first time Judith's group is taking a loan from Pearl Micro Finance. She says her group is determined not to be a credit risk. Weekly, she says, her gross sales revenue totals up to Ugandan shillings 120,000. Judith says this Kiva loan will lend her countenance in the purchase of more retail commodities to resell. Top on her shopping list are high-favor commodities like sugar, maize flour, rice, bread, cooking oil, tomatoes, baking powder, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, maize flour, rice, bread, tomatoes, etc to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 43 years old, has practiced small-scale farming for the last three years. He sells his produce at the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alaxpacha 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALAXPACHA II” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Janneth.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicios
 
La señora Janneth indica que es el sexto año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tejidos, que viene trabajando hace ocho años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de una máquina los que compra de la distribuidora y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Alaxpacha II” is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center.  This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Janneth.  The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors in order to get ahead.  

Sra. Janneth says this is her sixth year of participating in a Communal Bank through Pro Mujer.  She joined after being invited by a friend.  Janneth currently has a business selling knitted articles and has been working for eight years.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy a machine that she will purchase from a distributor.  She will use it for making knitted articles to sell at the fairs.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible.  Janneth is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Janneth said that she enjoys everything.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Foresty Group

texts.en:
Jentrix is the facilitator for the Foresty Group in Chwele.  This group is comprised of two men and five women.  The group began working with One Acre Fund in 2010 and has continued participating since that time.  They plan on once again enrolling for the 2012 season.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Jentrix and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Jentrix says that she joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to feed her family and to have access to early input delivery. Jentrix has a large family with 12 children.  Jentrix reports that she has had a good harvest with One Acre Fund in 2011, achieving four bags on 1/2 acre.  Before One Acre Fund, Jentrix says that she was only able to harvest one bag on 1/2 acre.  

Jentrix has 12 children at home.  With profits from her harvest, she plans on paying for her children's school fees, saving for the future, buying livestock, perhaps investing in a business, and purchasing more land.  

In total, the Foresty Group expects to plant 11.25 acres of land in 2012, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 1/2 acres.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
La Victoria se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Presidenta, la Señora Rosalina. Ella contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el segundo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa. Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
Una de las miembros del grupo es la señora Limpia, ella es modista, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya un tiempo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, pues ella es una señora muy amable y con muy buen trabajo. Una de sus metas es poder tener un taller grande, donde pueda realizar todas sus costuras. Dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, ya que desea darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y otros insumos necesarios para el abastecimiento de su taller de costura. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The excellent group, La Victoria, is made up of women from Itá, The current president, Rosalina, learned about the program that the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) has from a consultant in one of the committee's weekly meetings .  Once she found out about the program, she succeeded in getting 16 women together and they are happily working as a group on their second loan cycle in the program.  All are in businesses to earn money.  They support each other to achieve the goals that they all have in common.

One of the members is Limpia.  She has been a seamstress for some time now.  She says that she has many customers since she is very friendly and does very good work.  One of her goals is to have a bigger workshop where she can do all types of sewing.  She says that what she does is for the good of her family since she wants to give them a better standard of living.

Limpia is requesting the loan to buy materials, thread, needles and other necessary items to supply her sewing workshop.  She has her hopes on the loan since it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, needles, and more

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives in the Airport community. She is married and her husband works at Firestone. They have five children between the ages of 2 and 12. For the past few years she been selling clothes in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 51 years old. She lives in the village Alambari, West Georgia. Nunu is married and lives with her family: husband – Osman, three sons (30, 26 and 23 years old), daughter in law and mother in law. The family receives social assistance from the country. They earn their living through agriculture. The family owns 1 milking cow. Nunu produces cheese and sells it locally. They also grow tangerines and maize on 5000 sq meters of land. Harvested tangerine and maize are sold on the local open market. Though all family members work hard, their total average monthly income, including the social assistance, is 605 Laris (approximately 365 USD). 

With the requested credit, Nunu will purchase hay in Kakheti Region, where the price is relatively low. She will resell the hay in her village for a higher price and earn a profit. Nunu will spend the additional profit on the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hay for resale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 64 years old, married, and has 10 children.  Juanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has done for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from a bakery and trisikad (pedicab) transport. 

Juanita is requesting a loan for 22,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more stock to sell.  Juanita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. Juanita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Los Ficus Group

texts.es:
El Grupo el ficus esta integrado por dies personas las cuales son muy alegres, trabajadoras y amables,ELa señora Laura es una de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se enceuntra casada con el señor Gilberto que tiene el oficio de carpintero,tiene 3 hijos, y solo uno de sus hijos depende de ellos. Ella comenta que desde hace unos meses decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de abarrotes porque penso en apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y ademas piensa que su negocio le ayuda mucho a salr adelante a futuro.

Ella realiza su venta de abarrotes todos lo dias desde muy temprano se pone a limpiar su tienda, en ella tiene todos su productos de abarrotes donde los acomoda en unos anaqueles y los pone en miestra para sus clientes, se encuentra muy contenta con su negocio ya que dia a dia cuenta con mas clientes.

Doña Laura necesita este credito para la compra de aceite, dulces, pan, productos enlatados, jugos, refrescos, frijoles, arroz, pan molido, cloro, jabon , detergente, veladoras y jabon de baño para posteriormente ponerlo a la venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio pueda prospera y salir adelante ya que desea su negocio sea una de las tiendas principales de abarrotes de su comunidad.
"Gracias Fundacion Realidad por el apoyo que me han dado a mi y mi familia"


Los demas integrantes de este grupo son:
Patricia- Antojitos Mexicanos
Elizabeth- Cosmeticos
Maria- Cosmeticos
Yolanda- Refrescos
Carolina-Cosmeticos
Yolanda-Carpinteria
Ana Celia- Cosmeticos
Rosa-Ropa
texts.en:
The 'El Ficus' group has ten members who are very cheerful, hard-working and kind.  Laura is one of the members of this group.  She is 33 years old and studied up to high school level.  She is married to Gilberto, who works as a carpenter, and the couple have three children.  Only one of their children is still dependent on them.  Laura tells us that she decided to start her business selling groceries a few months ago as she wanted to support her husband with their household expenses and also because she believes that her business will help her to get ahead in the future.

Laura sells her groceries every day.  She starts work very early in the morning, cleaning her store.  She keeps all her grocery products in her store.  She puts them on display on shelves for her customers.  She is very happy with her business as she gains new customers every day.

Laura needs this loan to buy oil, sweet treats, bread, canned food, juice, soft drinks, beans, rice, bread crumbs, bleach, soap, detergent, candles and bath soap to sell.

Laura hopes that, with this investment, her business will thrive and that she will make progress as she would like her business to become one of the main grocery stores in her community.

"Thank you Fundación Realidad, for the support that you have given to me and my family".

The other members of this group are:
Patricia - Mexican snacks
Elizabeth - Cosmetics
María - Cosmetics
Yolanda - Soft drinks
Carolina - Cosmetics
Yolanda - Carpentry
Ana Celia - Cosmetics
Rosa - Clothes

loans.use: to buy oil, sweet treats, bread, canned food, juice, soft drinks, beans, rice, bread crumbs, bleach, soap, detergents and candles

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El cliente es una persona muy trabajadora tiene dos oficios el de pintor donde realiza su trabajo en las construcciones y refaccion cobrando por metro cuadrado y el otro oficio de electricista y trabaja en las construcciones  y arreglos domiciliarios, siempre se sostuvo de esa manera, el es separado y su esposa e hijos se fueron de su lado, ahora el emprende solo y la cotidianidad de la vida hace que solicite un credito para la construccion de su vivienda, porque ahora vive en la casa de su sobrino y necesita salir para poder vivir independientemente. En consecuencia el credito le ayudara en gran medida para poder pagar de una forma mas holagada, de todas formas el cliente tuvo ya otros creditos en la institucion donde respondio de forma regular y en esta oportunidad, el cliente se beneficiara con con cuotas mas del alcance de su bolsillo y asi poder tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en: This client is a very hard-working person who has two jobs.  He works as a painter on building jobs and refurbishing jobs, charging by the square meter, and also works as an electrician, working on building jobs and carrying out repairs in people's homes.  He has always supported himself in this way.  He is separated as his wife and children left him.  Now he gets by on his own and is requesting a loan to build a house because right now he lives in his nephew's home and he needs to leave so that he can live independently.  This loan will help him a lot as he will be able to pay it off more comfortably.  The client has already received previous loans from the institution and repaid them regularly.  On this occasion, he will benefit from repayments which are more within his reach and, as a result, he will be able to own his own home.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, 32 years old, is married and has four children. She has operated a wholesale business dealing in soda, sugar and soap for 2 years. Rosemary is faced with the challenge of inflation, which affects her purchasing power. Her business goal is to open up another outlet and her personal goal is to have well-educated children. Rosemary wants a loan to purchase soda, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to purchase soda, sugar and soap

loans.name: Javier Adan

texts.es: El señor Javier a sus 56 años se dedica desde hace cuatro años a prestar el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares; con este negocio el señor Javier genera un empleo directo a su sobrino y puede tener más tiempo libre para dedicarse a otras actividades puesto que anteriormente el señor Javier tenia una tienda la cual era muy esclavizante. El señor Javier requiere de la compra de una lavadora para reponer una que esta en mal estado. Con lo anterior el señor Javier podrá mejorar su servicio, aumentar sus ventas y así tener una buena calidad de vida y a futuro cumplir su sueño de tener más lavadoras y atender a más clientes.
texts.en: Javier is 56 years old. For four years he has rented out washing machines to his neighbors, friends and family. With this business, Javier generates direct employment for his nephew and can have more free time to spend on other activities. Previously, Javier had a store and it was very enslaving. Javier needs to buy a washing machine to replace one that is in poor condition. Thus, Javier will be able to improve his service, increase his sales and have a good quality of life. in the future, he will be able to make his dream come true of having more washing machines and serving more customers.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and do equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 28 year old a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a pub in Yambio South Sudan for the past three years.  Nora is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beer and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beer and beans for sale

loans.name: Merced

texts.en:
Merced is from Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 66-years-old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merced cooks and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Merced has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Merced joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merced is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita de nuevo otro préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio venta de pan dulce, francés y comprar más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes, con la idea de poder mejorar cada día en sus ingresos.
Blanca esta contenta y considera que los financiamientos anteriores le han ayudado a solventar la necesidad y solventar la situación económica que tenían antes.
texts.en:
Blanca is asking for a new loan to invest in her business selling sweet bread and French bread.  She will buy a wider variety to offer her customers with the goal of increasing her income on a daily basis.

Blanca is satisfied and believes that her previous loans have helped her cover her needs and resolve her past financial situation.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread and French bread

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a full of dreams that will not lose his hopes because he believes he can achieve his dream. He says that only when you can dream it, you can do it.
Ricardo is 37 years old, lucky married to a loving housewife and blessed with four children. Ricardo engages in planting and harvesting of rice for almost 17 years. His earnings from the business depend on climates. His earning is minimal when his crop is affected by the typhoon and disease. 
Ricardo wants to gain higher income from his crops. He is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for good production. He hopes to achieve his dreams through the loan he request.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for good production.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en: Zakayo is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, she will become a millionaire. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
P. Nen is married and lives with her husband and young baby in Phnom Penh suburbs, around 20 kilometers from the center of the city.

She decided to borrow $1,000 from CREDIT to help her husband in his business. He is running a small shop in the city and makes windows and doors out of materials such as steel, iron and glass. As he started only three years ago, his shop is still small but the business is profitable and he wants to expand. With $1000 he will purchase tools and raw materials to increase the quality and the volume of his production.

This business is already breeding $10 per day and P. Nen is also running her small business: she has got a sewing machine at home and makes clothes to be sold in Phnom Penh. She learnt these skills by helping her friends and now she can make around 50,000 Riel ($12.5) per week.

P. Nen wants to continue doing this activity, because she can look after her baby while her husband is busy outside.

loans.use: purchase tools and raw materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START A JUICE BAR BUSINESS

loans.name: Qalib

texts.en: Qalib lives and works in the Novju village in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan with his wife and four children. He is 55 years old. He started raising sheep and cattle over 20 years ago. With a few setbacks here and there, he has grown his business. Qalib requests a loan to purchase sheep and feed to further provide for and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and feed

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
N. T. Loc is 27 and his wife Doan thi T. Loan is 21.
Loc works as a day laborer. They have a son who was born in 2006. They have 150 green dragon bushes and some land to plant rice, but they don't make much profit because of insect damage. Their average income is US$15 per person per month. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their green dragon garden.

loans.use: raising green dragon bushes

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela is 43 and hails from a family of six with deep roots in Minero. Her husband works as a driver for "La Chane" Unagro. Together they are raising five children. Four are in school and the oldest daughter, 19, will soon attend a state university. In the meantime she helps her mother in their well-know restaurant. At the moment they rent space in a good location and run a bar, restaurant and billiard hall. Angela has been running the restaurant for a long time. Before that, she sold food she cooked at home. She strives to offer her customers food, drink and entertainment under the same roof. Thanks to her hard work the restaurant has grown and now she needs capital to buy chairs, tables and a freezer. She has an excellent track record with microfinance, having taken out nine previous loans all of which she repaid promptly.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Angela tiene 43 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por 6 personas, mismas que radican en Minero desde hace bastante tiempo atrás. El esposo de Angela trabaja como transportista dependiente de "La Chane" Unagro, juntos velan por la educación y salud de sus 5 hijos, cuatro de los cuales asisten actualmente al colegio, y la Hija mayor que tiene 19 años de edad se encuentra en tramites para entrar a la Universidad estatal, mientras ayuda a su mamá en el restaurante. Actualmente alquila uno de los locales más conocidos de Minero, donde cuenta con una buena ubicación, en este lugar ella ofrece servicios de Bar-Restaurante atendiendo a sus clientes con comida, bebida y juegos de billar. Ella tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio ya que trabaja en el mismo desde hace un tiempo atras, comenzó vendiendo comida en su domicilio particular. Angela hace frente a la competencia del sector al ampliar los servicios que ofrece en su Bar-Restaurante, es decir en un mismo lugar los clientes pueden satisfacer sus necesidades de comida y de entretenimiento. Es gracias a su esfuerzo que el restaurante llegó a crecer, por lo que ahora requiere de capital para poder invertir en la compra de mesas, sillas, un freezer, etc. Angela tiene excelentes antecedentes crediticios, ya que tuvo 9 operaciones de microcrédito anteriores a la presente solicitud y todas las pago oportunamente.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a restaurant.

loans.name: Avelino Fabiao

texts.pt:
Avelino lives with his partner and two young children. He joined the credit program in 2006. Previous loans have helped him improve his business of selling clothes and household appliances. He will use his loan to increase his inventory and, if the business continues to be profitable, plans to build a brick house and save for the education of his children.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Avelino e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos ainda pequenos. Entrou para o Programa em 2006. Ele quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de mais electrodomesticos e mais roupa para a venda.O negoci esta a corre-lhe bem. Ele pensa com os lucros construir uma casa de alvenarias para a sua familia. e guardar dinheiro para a educacao dos seus filhos.

loans.use: Avelino will use his loan to buy more clothing and household appliances for his retail business.

loans.name: Het

texts.en:
Mr. K. Het was married in 1988 and has five children, three sons and two daughters. He has been in the business of buying and reselling cows since 2002. He buys cows from his commune and other communes for reselling in other provinces far from his home. His wife is in the business of selling grocery items at home. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh. He has not finished primary school and his wife has never attended school.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is asking a loan in the amount of $1,000. He will use this loan to purchase three more cows for feeding and reselling in other provinces. After borrowing money from Maxima previously, his living has gotten better because he has more funds for expanding his business.

loans.use: Buying and reselling cows.

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
Nubia is a lady that for more than 10 years has dedicated her life to sell soda, juices, water, bakery threats, etc. She started with a capital of C$200.00, that was given to her by her husband.

She began selling as a street vendor in Leon but nowadays she is located on the market in the Terminal. She has a good client base, this is why every day before sunrise Nubia is up and ready to go.

She has a spot with a zinc ceiling, she managed to get this ceiling with a lot of hard work and the income her business generated. She fights hard, so she can provide good education and healthy lives for her two sons.

Ceprodel has helped her financially for about a year and a half. She has received eleven loans, which she has paid back completely. These loans helped her grow her business and improve her quality of life at home.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Nubia es una dama que por mas de 10 años se ha dedicado a la venta de gaseosas, jugos, agua, reposterías, etc. Inició con un capital de C$200.00 producto de un aporte que le brindó su esposo para poner su propio negocio.

Inicia vendiendo ambulante por las calles de León y actualmente se encuentra instalada en el mercado de la Terminal en donde tiene buena clientela por lo que día a día antes de que salga el sol, la señora Nubia ya está lista para la venta de los refrescos.

Tiene un puesto fijo con techo de zinc, dicha mejora la realizo con mucho sacrificio de sus utilidades que le genera su actividad económica. Tiene dos hijos los cuales lucha para brindarles todo su apoyo en el desarrollo de sus estudios, salud y educación.

Ceprodel le ha apoyado financieramente desde hace año y medio con once créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma en donde el impacto que han tenido es en la mejora de sus ventas y su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase Inventory

loans.name: Tharn

texts.en: Mrs. Tharn S., 26, is married with two schooling children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works selling vegetables to the people in her area, making on average around $2 each day of profit. Her husband works buying and selling wood and charcoal, making about $7 each day in revenue. Mrs. Tharn S. hopes to use this loan to purchase cows to breed for additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase cows to breed for additional profits.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is a single hairdresser with one child. She is requesting $275 to purchase hairdressing products so she can meet the demand of her customers.

Theresa is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing products to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is single woman with two children, 6 months and 5 years old. Zabibu sells alcohol; she started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6p m at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$200.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more items for her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi P. is 41 years old and runs a business making and selling Khmer style noodles from her home. She can make around 1.50 US$ per day through this business. Her husband, Teang Tha, has been a construction foreman since the year 2000. In this management position, he earns 5 US$ per day overseeing small scale construction projects throughout Siem Reap.

They have four children who are enrolled in school and help their parents run businesses. As Yi P. already works in the food industry, she would like to branch out into rice farming as well. She wants to purchase a piece of farmland to grow both rice and vegetables on. She hopes to eliminate her family’s food costs by providing for them herself and being able to make a profit with what is left over. Subsistence farming of this kind is common in Cambodia. Rice prices have dramatically increased in recent months, making it difficult for poorer Khmer’s not farming to afford this basic food staple.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Lai Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Lai Thi N., 41 years old, joined the fund in 2005. She lives with her husband and 6 children in Hung Trung, Hung N.. Five out of six of her children are still in school. In the first round of funding she borrowed 200USD to raise pigs, by the year’s end she took in 120 USD. Although she was able to put the loan to good use, Ms. N. realized that raising pigs does not make enough money to pay for her children’s schooling; her husband still has to work as a bricklayer to bring more income. In addition to 2000 USD of capital that she raised herself, Ms. N. plans to borrow 950USD to buy decoration equipment and flower gates to serve weddings. She makes the weekly payments from investments in a wedding hall and her husband’s sidejob. According to today’s market prices, Ms. N. expects to make in the range of 10-30 USD per wedding.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lài, 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Chị sống cùng chồng và 6 người con tại Hưng Trung, Hưng Nguyên. 5 trong số 6 con của chị còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 200USD để chăn nuôi lợn, kết thúc năm chị lãi 120USD. Tuy vốn vay sử dụng có hiệu quả nhưng chị Lài thấy chỉ nuôi lợn thì không đủ tiền đóng học phí cho con, chồng chị vẫn phải đi làm thợ nê để có thêm thu nhập. Cộng với 2000USD vốn tự có, chị Lài dự định vay 950USD để sắm trang thiết bị và rạp cưới phục vụ đám cưới. Nguồn trả tuần chị lấy từ đầu tư rạp và nghề phụ của chồng. Theo như giá cả hiện nay thì cứ mỗi đám cưới chị Lài thu lãi vài chục USD.

loans.use: Buy wedding equipment, decorations, flower gates

loans.name: Mahkambek

texts.ru:
Mahkamber Z. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 59 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a higher education. He is now retired, so he raises animals. He buys young bull calves at the local market, and raises them for 45 days. Then he sells them on the market for a more profitable price. Animal husbandry allows him to support his large family. His oldest sons help him. At this time he would like to buy 2 calves to raise, so he decided to take out a loan. He will pay back the loan over a period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Зубайдуллоев Махкамбек житель города Вахдат. Возраст 59 лет , женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее. В данное время Махкамбек находится на пенсии. Поэтому занимается животноводством. Он скупает на местном рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их в течении 45 дней.Затем реализует их на рынке по более выгодной ему цене.Животноводство позволяет ему содержать свою большую семью.Помогают ему его старшие сыновья. В данное время клиент хочет купить 2 бычков для откормки.Поэтому он решил взять кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of two bull calves

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana’s life is clearly an example of surmounting obstacles, who started out working as a humble laborer at a livestock stable. During those eight years, she saved her money with the goal of one day having her own stable of animals at her house so she could still care for her two small children. For a little over a year now, she achieved her dream and feels extremely satisfied. Now, she must purchase more cows to build her stable. As a result of her cattle activities, she is able to sell the milk they produce which is why she is meticulous in caring for her animals. In addition to her livestock, she also plants potatoes, corn, beans and peas. The loan she is requesting is to rent a tractor so she can prepare her lands for her crops, and also to buy balanced feed for her cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La vida de Liliana es un claro ejemplo de superación, ella empezó a trabajar humildemente siendo peón en un establo ganadero durante varios años, ahorró durante todos esos años con la meta de tener su propio establo de animales en su casa para no descuidar el cuidado de sus dos pequeños hijos. Hace más de un año pudo lograr este sueño de que se siente muy satisfecha, ahora debe adquirir más vacas para tener un gran establo ganadero. A consecuencia, vende la leche que sus vacas producen, por ello Liliana es muy minuciosa su cuidado; además de esto, también siembra papa, maíz, habas y arveja. El préstamo que solicita es para el alquiler de un tractor para la preparación de su tierra y comprar alimento balanceado para sus vacas.

loans.use: Purchase nutritional feed for her cattle and rental of a tractor to use in preparing her farmlands for planting crops.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter has art in his blood. Together with his brothers, he has worked for 8 years doing children’s shows. In addition, he sings and plays the organ in an orchestra. Likewise, he performs at parties. He always loves the work, having sometimes 4 events per week.

The loans that he has received have been used to repair his computer, which is essential to his work.

Walter would like to have contracts at the national level and in this way become better known.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Walter lleva el arte en la sangre. Junto con sus hermanos, trabaja desde hace 8 años haciendo shows infantiles. También canta y toca el órgano en una orquesta musical. Asimismo, es animador de fiestas. Siempre goza de trabajo, a la semana tiene hasta 4 eventos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para reparar su computadora que es herramienta de su trabajo.

A Walter le gustaría tener contratos a nivel nacional y así hacerse más conocido.

loans.use: To repair his computer, which is an essential tool for his work.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum V., 46, is a widowed farmer who lives with four of her children. Living in Siem Reap province, she typically makes about US$4 each per day and two of her children make about US$2.50 each day as broom makers. Pum has requested a loan of US$250 to purchase fertilizers to put on her farm. Farming is a hard way to support the family, as the weather conditions are difficult and she uses a lot of energy, but earns little. In the future, she plans to set up a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Saada's Group

texts.en: Saada has been keeping livestock in Dodoma, Tanzania for 10 years.  Now, she wants to take out a loan to try to diversify her business and begin selling charcoal.  She is currently able to earn approximately $45 each month.  With her new business, she is hoping to increase her profit and pay her children's school fees.  Saada is 50 years old, married, and has 10 children.  In addition to her 10 children, she cares for 7 dependents.  Saada will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza and Violeth.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
