A hair dresser since 1998 in Kormantse near Cape Coast, Millicent T. was educated through junior high school. Now divorced with four dependents, she is responsible for paying her children's school fees and the utility bills. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of hair products to meet the demand of her numerous clients. Millicent hopes to use the new profits accruing from the loan to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of hair products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Bet

texts.en: Mrs. Bet K., 61, lives in Khlai Village in Kampong Chham Province, Cambodia. She owns 3 hectares on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In addition to this plantation, she sells tires in the local market. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it. She is requesting a loan to buy tires to re-sell to her customers. She hopes to improve her living conditions with the increased profits.

loans.use: Buy tires to re-sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. is 26 years old. She is single but a mother with one kid. Currently, the kid is in school. She has been sewing for three years now. She is a specialist in female wears. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses and funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work Ernestina has three apprentices to whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with quality education. She is a member of the community group called ‘Sompa’ meaning Good servant Trust Group. She was so happy when she was visited at her business site and she was offered  free business advice on management.

loans.use: Ernestina wants to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Finesse (composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent différentes activités commerciales mais la plus dominante est la vente du bois de chauffe puis la vente de  savon de fabrication locale et de l’huile alimentaire. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les femmes de ce groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement  remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 sacs de 100 morceaux de savons traditionnels. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso auprès de grossistes. Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans le quartier et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
All the members of the group Finesse are married women who average 30 years of age and one child. They live in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do different commerce-related work, but predominating is the sale of firewood and then locally-made soap and cooking oil.

To satisfy their burgeoning customer base, the women of this group have been collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year now and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy one truck-load of firewood, four 20-liter drums of cooking oil, and three 100-piece sacks of traditional soaps. Supplies are gotten either in Bamako (capital of Mali) or locally in Sikasso from wholesalers. These goods are sold retail for cash in the marketplaces of Sikasso, in the district, and at residences, to customers composed of women and a few men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer de 34 años, muy alegre y conversadora, vive con sus pequeños hijos en su propia casa y es conciente de que tiene que trabajar duro para mejorar su futuro. Tiene un triciclo donde transporta sus productos, tiene puesto en su barrio donde vende sus productos andinos (Papa, quinua, habas, etc.), es la única que tiene un negocio así por los alrededores, por lo cual tiene muchos clientes y vende casi toda su mercadería. Ella espera tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda vender más cosas, incluyendo sus productos andinos, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que es muy alegre y siempre les saca una sonrisa. Lleva 20 años en este negocio y sabe que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cosechar los productos que vende, ya que los trae desde la chacra que tiene en las afueras de Juliaca. Es el quinto préstamo de Hilda en MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y siempre está haciendo reír al restó de las socias. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en sus campos de cultivo, para aumentar la producción, y a su vez acrecentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Hilda is 34 years old and a very happy, chatty woman. She lives with her small children in her own home and understands that she has to work hard to improve her future. She has a tricycle cart to transport her products and has a stand in her neighborhood where she sells Andean crops (potatoes, quinua (a local Indian crop), beans, etc.). She is the only one who sells these products in the neighborhood so she has many customers and is able to sell almost all her goods. She hopes to have a store in the future where she can sell other products, including her current goods. Her favorite part of her work is being able to talk to her customers since she is a very happy person and can always make them smile. She has worked in this business for 20 years and knows that the most difficult part is harvesting the crops that she sells, since she has to bring them all the way from her farmland on the outskirts of Juliaca. This is her 5th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she has always been punctual with her payments and she hopes to be now as well. She is the happiest member of her village bank and is always making the other members laugh. She will use the money to invest in her farmland to increase her production and, in that way, grow her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her agricultural production to grow her sales

loans.name: Trob

texts.en: Trob M., 50, lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$4 every day. Besides this activity, she also sells ice cream in her village. This couple has five children and all of them are farmers. Trob M. would like to request a loan to purchase ingredients and materials to make more ice cream to sell; they will use the rest of the loan to build a new house.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and build a new house.

loans.name: Raudel

texts.es: El señor Raudel es pensionado y solamente vive con su esposa la señora María Esther, ellos tienen un matrimonio estable y muy unido, les han inculcado a sus hijos a ser personas responsables. Tienen su casita cómoda por que le han estado haciendo mejoras poco a poco con sus ahorros, pero les esta haciendo falta impermeabilizar y pintar su hogar, y este es por lo que están tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Raudel is retired and he receives a pension. He lives with his wife, Maria Esther. They have a stable marriage and raised their children to be intelligent and responsible. They have been fixing their home little by little with their savings. At this point, they need to make their home waterproof and also paint their home. This is why they are asking for a loan.

(Translated by Thatcher of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof the roof of their home

loans.name: Chinedu

texts.en: Chinedu is 29 years old and he is single without a child. He is a tailor and he also sells tailoring materials. He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila A. has worked as a trader selling onions in bags and treated dinking water for five years, in Siwdo in Cape Coast.  She is married with four children and has received an education through junior high school.  Her husband also works as a trader.  Laila is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and for buying their books.  Her loan will be used to buy more drinking water for selling, and she hopes to use the new profits to reinvest.

loans.use: Buy more dinking water for selling.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati Y. is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. Her son and three daughters are in junior high or primary school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Fati's husband is a farmer, while Fati is a trader in second-hand textiles – womenswear. She procures bales of textiles from Dormaa, and hawks to sell in her community as well as trekking to other towns to sell. Fati has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy second-hand textiles

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Mrs. Lenie C. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since September 2002. She's 46 years old, married and blessed with four children who are enrolled in elementary school. She owns and operates her specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in their barangay. She has been in this business for more than two years. And now, she's requesting her 11th cycle loan in the amount of PHP 10,500.00 for the purpose of additional capital for her business. Through the loan they requested from the Coop, they could earn a profit, which is a great help for them, especially for their daily needs. Some they will use as savings to the Cooperative.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.ru: Кенчаев Убайдулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 36 лет. Женат. имеет 4 детей. Убайдулло более 15 лет занимается торговлей, он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует вещами второй необходимости. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Ubaidullo K. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. Ubaidullo has been involved in sales for over 15 years. He has a retail store at the market, where he sells “second necessity” goods. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Marcelina es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Marcelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donD. venD. cereales variados, productos que compra en las ferias y también le traen a su puesto.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. queso, garbanzo y cebada.
Los sueños D. Marcelina son que su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

She is a 60-year-old married mother with 5 children. She runs a stand at the Grau Market in which she sells a variety of grains. She buys these products at other markets, and people sell them to her at her stand as well.

Macelina needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing cheese, garbanzo beans, and barley.

Marcelina dreams of seeing her son obtain a degree and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, garbanzo beans, and barley

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
Santos Paula M. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas elaboradas por ella misma y ubicada en el departamento de León donde a diario ofrece las deliciosas tortillas las que son vendidas a sus clientes.

Ella requiere de la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz, la cal y la leña y para esto ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y así seguir vendiendo sus deliciosas tortillas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Santos Paula M. is a very hard-working lady who sells tortillas that she makes. Her business is located in the department of León, where she sells the delicious tortillas daily to her customers. She needs to buy basic materials such as corn, lime, and firewood; therefore she has sought the help of Ceprodel to obtain this loan and continue selling her delicious tortillas in her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa B. is a 70-year-old widow who lives in Maricaban, Pasay City. She lost her husband this summer and now lives with her only child. Luisa owns a general store located just in front of her house. She also has a burger stand. She has been in these businesses for three years and earns P10,000 per month. Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2001, Luisa has received a lot of blessings. CCT loans have helped her grow her businesses allowing her to meet her basic family needs. She now plans to expand her business by purchasing a new burger grill and has applied for a P18,000 loan to buy the grill. Luisa dreams of owning a big grocery store in the future. She hopes to live a longer life so she can continue serving God and her community. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy a new burger grill

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a son who currently attends school. Agnes is a hardworking woman who lives with her son in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Agnes runs a snack bar in her community. She sells all kinds of soft drinks and pastries in a shop by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Kumasi, a nearby city. Agnes has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy minerals and pastries in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy minerals and pastries

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es: Dina Elizabeth R. P. reside en Jayaque en el departamento de La Libertad. Dina de 30 años de edad se encuentra casada con Rafael quien trabaja como albañil, Dina posee una tienda ubicada donde vende productos de consumo, pero ahora Dina solicita de este crédito por que desea surtir su negocio al cual le hacen falta gran variedad de productos que los clientes de Dina solicitan, con este crédito Dina incrementara sus ventas mejorando sus ingresos económicos también.

loans.use: Sutir su negocio

loans.name: El Gorrion Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Gorrión " esta representado por la señora Adela María y conformada por 12 miembros que en su mayoría son socias  muy trabajadoras y están en el tercer ciclo demostrando siempre ganas de trabajar, entusiasmo y responsabilidad  con expectativas de lograr mas ingresos P. mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hogares. Las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo conociéndose en sus actividades comerciales y siendo vecinas del barrio. Las socias desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como la venta de pan, tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida y venta de cosméticos;  sus actividades atienden en su propio domicilio y otros son ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario. El destino del crédito es P. surtir sus tiendas,  y comprar insumos en mayor cantidad, las promotoras de cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas P. generar mejores ingresos. Sus expectativas es  tener más ingresos y ser mas independientes económicamente, en cuanto a sus experiencias crediticias algunas solicitaron crédito en otras instituciones pero saben como administrar bien todos sus ingresos y gastos como lo han demostrado en anteriores financiamientos.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Aisheitu

texts.en:
Aisheitu is 27 years old and a mother with three children. Two of her kids are in school.

To support her household, Aisheitu sells cereals like local rice to her loyal customers in the community market. She says the selling of this product is very lucrative and she has been in business for two years now.

Aisheitu takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially their education. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like rice

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La señora María Rosario es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 64 años, es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es un obrero jubilado, María se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace nueve años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de gaseosas para vender en su casa, ahora María requiere de un préstamo de 3000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar mercadería como gaseosas, golosinas y también comprará  zapatos para vender en su casa. La meta de María es  tener una tienda de todo tipo de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Rosario is hard-working and active member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 64 years old, the mother of 4 adult children and her husband is a retired worker. María sells drinks and candy, an activity she does in her home. She has been a part of the communal bank “Carmen Cabrejos” for nine years. The first loan she obtained was for 300 soles which she used to buy soft drinks to sell in her house, now she is requesting a loan of 3000 soles. She will use this loan to buy merchandise like soft drinks, candy and also she will buy shoes to sell in her house. María’s goal is to have a store that sells all types of products for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, candy, and also to buy shoes

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a young Palestinian woman who is married with two children.

Fatema’s husband used to work in Israel but after the closure they decided to open their own business. Two years ago they started this sewing workshop and currently they have five sewing machines. They both work in the workshop. They obtain cut cloth which they sew, in addition to making special designs upon request.

Fatema requested 2,000 USD from FATEN to buy some cloth and to buy a new sewing machine. They hope that after the loan they will hire a new employee to help them in the workshop.

Fatemah and her husband appear in the photo at their workshop.

loans.use: To purchase some cloth and to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Rorn K. lives in Neal village in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ung Sary, is a duck breeder. Since his poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks for breeding. Thus, Mrs. Rorn K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie G., age 39, owns a small parcel of farmland. She has two children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old. She wanted to support her children's education until college, which is why she is working so hard to save money for the future. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can increase her harvest and generate enough income to support her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Deysi Mariana

texts.es:
Deysi Cárdenas de 20 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo tiene luz como servicio básico, es soltera.

La familia de Deysi siempre se ha dedicado ha vender pescados, ella comenzó con ellos a vender y después se independizó con un pequeño capital que ahorro.

Ahora ella comprar el pescado en la Caraguay de Guayaquil para venderlo en la esquina de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 14h00 vendiendo varios tipos de pescados y camarones, uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es al salir a comprar los pescados en la madrugada.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados y camarones para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender los mariscos.
texts.en:
Deysi Cárdenas, 20, is single and lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of sugar cane stalks and its only utility is electricity. Daysi's family has always worked as fishmongers. She began to sell with them and later became independent using a small amount of savings she had. Now, she buys the fish in Guayaquil's Caraguay market and sells it on the corner where she lives. She works from 6am until 2pm selling various kinds of fish and shrimp. One of the inconveniences she faces is having to go out at dawn to buy her fish. She will use the funding to buy fish and shrimp to enlarge her stock. In the future, she would like to have a locale from which to sell her seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: To make a living, Nilda A. operates a family member's retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. Nilda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Nilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maribel's Group

texts.en:
Maribel M. is from the town of Namnama Jones. She is 42 years old. Maribel is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Maribel M.'s group.

Maribel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with a 4 year old child. He lives in Kamenka. Ruslan owns an auto accessories store in his hometown. His little vending place is located right in downtown Kamenka, which makes it a popular stop for car owners. He sells tires, acoustic systems, and car parts. Ruslan started this business 11 years ago. Presently, he has about 150,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. His turnover capital is about 30,000-40,000 Grivnyas. Net profit amounts to 5,000-6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Ruslan is hoping to invest this loan of 18,150 Grivnyas in the purchase of summer rubber tires that always sell well in spring and summer. He believes a diversified assortment of merchandise will help meet clients’ demands. Ruslan has proved to be a responsible borrower, having repaid all previous loans without any late payments. One of his long term plans is to start a second venture and open a grocery store some day.

loans.use: To purchase summer rubber tires.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil A. is a 52-year-old married man from Jenin. He lives with his wife and four children, two of whom have entered school.

Jamil has been working in a grocery store since 2006. He hopes that, through this loan, he will be able to pay his debts, buy groceries for his store, and improve the economic status of his family.

loans.use: To pay debts and purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Ana Belki U. C. quien se dedica  aproximadamente hace más de ocho años a la venta de cosa de horno. Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de esta este tradicional bocadillo.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha Lorena M. G. quien vende cosa de horno, ornado hecho a base de maíz y Carla Patricia A. desde niña se dedica a producir y vende dulces tradicionales como arroz de leche, atolillo, pilloquinto y cosa de horno.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Ana Belki U. C., who has been selling baked goods for more than eight years. She will use her loan to buy traditional snacks. The other group members are Martha Lorena M. G., who sells baked goods made of corn, and Carla Patricia A., who has been producing and selling sweets since she was a young girl. Her products include rice pudding, corn custard, rum cake, and other baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne S. is a small-business owner. He lives in Vingunguti, Dar es Salaam.

Jumanne runs a business selling animals (goats and sheep) to customers at Vingunguti animal market. He purchases the animals from the wholesale and retail animal suppliers. Vingunguti animal market is the center for animal sales in Dar es Salaam.

Jumanne meets his family’s daily needs from his business income. His business plan is to become a wholesale animal supplier as his business income grows.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell

loans.name: Salima Nakafeero

texts.en: Salima is widowed with six children and four of her children go to school.  Salima owns a poultry farm consisting of 300 chickens. She resides in Kawempe Division, one of Kampala city suburbs. She has been in this business for many years. She wants to use this loan to buy morebags of chicken feeds. Besides this poultry business, she also fries samosas and she owns rental rooms.  Salima sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale. She buys chicken feeds from Mengo Kisenyi markets and uses public transport to and from shopping. Her major customers are nearby shops and people from Kalerwe.  Salima works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big and own 1,000 chickens.  She joined MCDT because they don’t ask for collateral before giving you a loan. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SERIGNE FALLOU est créé depuis 03 ans, il est composé de 07 femmes issues toutes de la même localité et âgées en moyenne de 50 ans. Elles ont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. Elles ont toutes été 5 fois de crédit, excepté Khady D. et Mayane G. qui viennent d’intégrer le groupe car elles ont adhéré au Banc Villageois au début de ce cycle et viennent de recevoir leur premier crédit. L’activité principale du groupe de solidarité, à l’image des autres femmes du Banc Villageois  est le petit commerce de céréales locales, d’huile d’arachide, de glace et de produits halieutique. Et la présence du marché hebdomadaire dans le village contribue beaucoup à la réussite des initiatives économiques des femmes et de la localité en général.

Madame Laba G., la présidente du Groupe de Solidarité, à droite de la photo en tenue blanche avec des fleurettes vertes est âgée de 55 ans enfants en charge. Elle est détentrice d’une boutique à domicile, une boutique qui est fonctionnelle depuis 10 ans. Elle y vend divers produits comme du riz, du sucre, de l’huile, des biscuits, de l’aliment de bétail etc. l’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de mieux participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The Serigne Fallou loan group was created three years ago and is comprised of 7 women who all come from the same area and are on average 50 years of age. They are married and each has at least three children. Most have made 5 loans, with the exception of Khady D. and Mayane G. who have recently joined the group and were formally with the Village Bank. They will be making their first loan. As with many of the women in the Village Bank, the main business of the group is the local sale of cereal grains, peanut oil, ice and fish products. The presence of a weekly market in the village has greatly aided the small businesses these local women and the area in general. Mrs Laba G., the president of the loan group is 55 years old and is raising children. She is on the right of the photo, wearing a white robe with green flowers. She has maintained a shop out of her house for the past 10 years and sells various products such as rice,sugar, oil, biscuits, and feed for animals. She would like to use the loan to strengthen her business and earn greater profits which will enable her to meet her family and personal needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote the businesses of this loan group

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home and to help pay household expenses for a sick relative

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador A.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 58 years old and has been married to his wife, Veronica, for 30 years now. They are from the town of Sta. Josefa. Dominador has been in his business for over 22 years. Dominador joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Dominador has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dominador is requesting a new loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his fifth loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. In addition to credit for its clients, CEVI also provides savings, insurance and training through regular cluster group meetings. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz, 48 years old, is the wife of A. H. and they live in Shalimar, a district of Lahore famous for fresh seasonal fruits. People can get the fresh fruits from here without going anywhere else. Shahnaz's husband has been involved in a business selling clothes for the last fifteen years, running a clothing shop in the market. Changes are rapidly happening in the fashion industry so he has to stay aware of new fabrics and designs. Shahnaz also assists him by selling clothes in her community. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for the second time for her husband. He will use the loan to buy clothes in bulk and expand his business. In Shahnaz's first loan period, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Badenya Ton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de dix  femmes, les membres du  groupe Badenya Ton 2 sont  mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Farabougou dans la commune rurale de Tesserela dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver de l’arachide, du mil et du sésame.
Madame Tata  Toka  C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25kg de semence d’arachide, recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage dans ses champs. 
Elle se ravitaille en semence à la foire de Gouassola et en main d’œuvre avec les hommes pour les activités de labour et de désherbage avec l’association des femmes du village. 
Elle compte récolter sur une superficie de 3,3 hectares: 6 sacs de mil, 17 sacs d’arachide et 2 sacs de sésame. Toute la production de mil et une partie de l’arachide est auto consommée tandis que le reste de l’arachide et le sésame sont vendus à la foire de Ségou à une clientèle mixte. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer en condiments et en soins de santé des enfants. 
Madame Tata  Toka  C. a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans sa famille et même dans le village.
texts.en:
The Badenya Ton 2 group is made up of 10 married women, most of whom live in large traditional families. They have an average age of 37 and an average of 4 children per woman. They live in the village of Farabougou in the rural commune of Tesserela in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through marriage, kinship, and neighborly ties. In order to increase the size of their crops, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first seasonal loan. The group members will grow peanuts, millet, and sesame. Mrs. Tata Toka C. plans on using the loan to buy 25 kg of peanut seeds, and to pay workers to work the fields. She buys seeds at the Gouassola market and she gets workers for the fields through association with the women in the village. In an area of 3.3 hectares, she plans on producing: 6 sacks of millet, 17 sacks of peanuts, and 2 sacks of sesame. All of the millet and a part of the peanuts will be consumed by the group, while the rest of the peanuts and the sesame will be sold at the Ségou market to a mixed client base. The profits will be used to buy condiments and pay for the children's medical needs. Mrs. Tata Toka C.'s goal is for her family, and even village, to become self-sufficient with regards to food.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and pay workers

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg J. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Bavuu, is a bus driver and goes between neighboring sub-provinces. Her three sons all attend universities in Ulaanbaatar. They have been living at their current address for 21 years. She usually spends her business earnings on daily household consumption and the tuition fees of her three sons. 

Battsetseg started her meat trading business in 1999 and since then her working capital has increased 10 times compared with her start-up business. Later on, she plans to operate a cow farm. She hopes to buy real estate for her children in Ulaanbaatar. She is a hardworking and honest person. She saves money for her three children's tuition fees and then she will start her new farming business.

 Battsetseg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more meat and supplies so that she may increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona N. lives in the Kisasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.     Rhona has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rhona sells from home, wholesale.    Rhona has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy firewood.    She also generates additional income through brick laying. 

The main business challenge(s) for Rhona include transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding the business.   Rhona lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is 35 years old, married to a carpenter and has 6 children. Her children range from 4 to 18 years old and are all at school. For 15 years, she has been selling timber beds and cupboards.

Her loan will be used to increase her business by buying more timber to make beds and cupboards. She hopes to make a profit to help pay for her children's school fees and to have some savings. Her business is well-known because she has good timber and makes good products. Her desire is to have her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella G. is from the village of Barangay Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business buying and selling fruit in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reine Blanche S.

texts.fr: H. Reine Blanche S. est née le 07 Septembre 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Reine Blanche vit depuis vingt huit ans à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à ADONON Théodore un enseignant, Reine Blanche est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Reine Blanche vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Reine Blanche a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Reine Blanche vend divers produits (produits de soins et de beauté, piles, stylos, papiers d’emballage, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Reine Blanche vend du yaourt. Reine Blanche achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Reine Blanche sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et donc son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en: Reine Blanche S. H. was born on September 7, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Reine Blanche has been living for 28 years in Agbalilame, in the community of Sémè-Poddji. Married to Théodore Adonon, a teacher, Reine Blanche is the mother of three; some of her children who to school. Reine Blanch lives together with her husband and children. The spouses take care of the family needs jointly. Riene Blanche stopped her studies after secondary level. For about a dozen years, Reine Blanche has been selling smiscellaneous  items (personal care and beauty products, batteries, ballpoint pens, wrapping paper etc). As a secondary activity, she also sells yougurt. Reine Blanch stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. This is the third time that Reine Blanche is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business, increasing her customer base and thus her profits.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous products (tooth paste, lotions, hair straighteners,  other personal care products, batteries, etc.)

loans.name: Heroina Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Heroína, ella tiene 27 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 1 año y cuatro meses, su marido tiene una panadería.

Este negocio es familiar tienen una pequeña panadería,  trabajan todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 20h00, ellos  se levantan muy temprano a hornear el pan luego lo venden  en su casa o a domicilio ya que el esposo entrega a domicilio en su motocicleta en la cual recorre la ciudad entregando y vendiendo su producto, esto lo realiza en las mañanas y también en las tardes. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que llevan en este negocio ya 8 años ya que antes su marido trabajaba en una panadería en Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar harina y otros ingredientes para la preparación del  pan. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es tener una gran panadería.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, "Virgen De Lourdes," meets every fortnight in the city of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Heroína who is 27 years old and maintains a common law relationship, with which she has a 1 year and four months old son.  Her husband has a bakery.

The family business is a small bakery, where they work every day from 5:00 AM to 8:00 PM.  They rise early to bake the bread and then sell it at home or as home delivery.  Her husband goes on his motorcycle through the city delivering and selling the products in the mornings and afternoons.  Our friend Heroína tells us that they have been in this business for 8 years since before her husband worked in a bakery in Portoviejo.

This loan is to buy flour and other ingredients to make bread.  She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes the ease of obtaining loans.  Her dream is to have a great bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, eggs, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 48 años de edad,casada  y tiene 3 hijos ; La socia  se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas en su casa , luego lo distribuye a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado donde es recepcionado por una de sus amigas , a la vez la socia trabaja en un colegio nacional en la provincia de Acomayo como docente.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como maíz,verduras entre  otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the “Hatun Soncco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Margarita is 48 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens in her home.  She then sells them in the town of Puerto Maldonado where she is put up by one of her friends.  Margarita also works in a school in Acomayo province as a teacher.

Margarita is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for her business such as corn and vegetables.

She is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business such as corn and vegetables

loans.name: Judith Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariza; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa importada, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a las diferentes instituciones y al público en general, por navidad ella venderá diferentes ropas americanas como pantalones, camisas, polos y chompas, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Judith is a member of the Communal Bank “Liderando Las Palmeras” (Leading the Palms) which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old and single. Judith divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling imported clothing. She sells as an independent merchant and offers her products to different institutions and to the general public. For Christmas she will sell different types of American clothing such as trousers, shirts, polo shirts, and sweaters. She has a store where she sells clothing and is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in bulk.

Judith is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. sells secondhand clothing and yam at Takoradi. She is married, has one child, and her husband is a driver. She has been in this business for seven years, and uses her income to help her husband in the general upkeep of their home.

Yaa plans to use this loan to buy more yam to resell, with the hope of expanding her business.  If she makes additional profit as a result, she says she will reinvest it back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more yam to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 57, is a farmer from Nyamira in western Kenya. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 15 and 35 years old. She has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now. Her main products are milk and vegetables, which she sells locally.

Joyce has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Kiva's partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take her children to better schools. She faces the challenges of diseases and lack of animal feed, especially during the dry season. However, she would like to expand her dairy farming in the future and be the major milk supplier to the local market.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon is 39 years old and lives with her mother, husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer districts of the city. Her older daughter attends primary school and her younger daughter is 3 years old and stays at home with Otgon's mother. 
 
Otgon supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has regular help from her husband who usually goes to Ereen City in China, where he buys the clothes and brings them back. 

In 1996, when she began her business, she sold her handmade suits at Denjiin Thousand, the first largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Before this, she was a seamstress for a local sewing factory. 

Now, her business has grown and her working capital is five million MNT. Otgon sells clothes imported from Ereen as well as her handmade clothes in her two stalls at Narantuul. In the winter, she sews coats to sell and purchases shirts to sell from Ereen. With this loan, she will purchase materials for her handmade coats and a wider variety of clothing from Ereen. 

Her goal is to grow her business with this loan and be able to buy her own sewing factory in order to expand her country’s employment.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her handmade coats and a wider variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman who lives in Madridejos, Cebu, Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Bernadito, who is 65 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have nine children who are 25 to 43 years old. 

Maria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 9 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her last loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,500 PHP, improving her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase additional stock for her general store.  She hopes the additional income will help her continue to save up for house repair. Maria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to increase her stock of items to sell.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun L., 31, resides with his family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. L. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day. His wife is a chef, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin C. owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in his community. He is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Benjamin has been in his business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Benjamin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his third loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chyrell

texts.en: Chyrell is a married woman who lives in the island of Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ronald, who is 32 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have four children who are between 1 and 15 years old. Chyrell joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chyrell has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy groceries to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Chyrell is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Cypes

texts.en:
Cypes is 46 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. For the past eight years, she has run a food vending and catering business in the Philippines. Cypes is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients, utensils, and equipment for her catering business. 

In the future, Cypes would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, untensils, and equipment for catering business

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: Geneviève est née en 1985 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Ezéchiel. Geneviève est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé et à la charge du couple. Geneviève et sa famille vivent à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Geneviève mène comme activité la vente de friperies de différentes sortes ; ce qui l'aide à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Geneviève achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les revend de façon ambulante. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Geneviève sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Geneviève a bien effectué le remboursement des deux premiers crédits obtenus. Son ambition est de renforcer davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en: Geneviève was born in 1985 in Benin and is married to a man named Ezéchiel. She is the mother of one child, who attends school and is in the couple's care. Geneviève and her family live in Ekpè in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Geneviève runs a business selling second-hand items of various kinds; this helps her provide for herself and her child. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and re-sells them door-to-door. With the goal of strengthening her business and satisfying her customers, Geneviève is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). She repaid her two previous loans properly. Her ambition is to further strengthen her business in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand goods (clothing, shoes, bags)

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carmen  de 27 años de edad; es una madre de familia que vive con su esposo y  su  2 menores hijos, en  casa de sus padres, cuenta con todos los servicios (agua, luz y desagüe) ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande a tan solo 1 hora de distancia de la provincia de Piura y a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chcilayo. Tambogrande se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

Carmen se dedica  a la venta de golosinas  y bebidas (gaseosa, agua y frugos)desde hace 2 años, en el paradero de carros que van a la ciudad de Piura.  Por ser un sitio muy concurrido por las  pobladores, las  ventas han aumentado, permitiéndole a Carmen tener mayores ingresos para llevar a su hogar.

A solicitado un préstamo Carmen a Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para  comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería (bebidas y golosinas) para implementar su pequeño negocio y así pueda brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida,con los ingresos que obtenga con sus ventas.

Carmen es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea que sus hijos tengan mayores oportunidades de mejorar en la vida y contar más adelante con un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Carmen, 27, is a mother living with her husband and two minor children in her parents’ house which has all utilities (water, electricity and sewage) located in Tambogrande a mere hour from Piura Province and three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Tambogrande is characterized by being a zone with much agricultural and livestock raising activity.

Carmen has sold snacks and beverages like soft drinks, water and Frugos (brand of fruit juice) for the last two years at the launching site for taxis going to the city of Piura.  Because it’s a very heavily visited place, sales have increased allowing Carmen to earn higher household income.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new sol loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise (beverages and snacks) to stock her small business and thus provide her family with a better standard of living with the income she gets from her sales.

Carmen is known in the area for being a hard working woman who very much wants her children to have better opportunities to improve their lives and for her to have a larger business later on.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and snacks for her small business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 35 years old and married with five children in school. Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Julieta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées qui ont   une moyenne  29  ans, en moyenne  4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Karangasso, un situé à environ 35 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide etc et dont les ventes constituent une activité rentable dans la zone.
CHATA a pour culture principale l’arachide, elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 sacs durée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 à 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women with an average age of 29 and an average of 4 children, and they live in traditional families in Karangasso, a place about 35 km from the town of Niena in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They are on their fifth Country Loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy means of productions and farm inputs. Their previous loans were all repaid in full.
The group grows  corn, rice, and peanuts, the sale of which is profitable in this area.
Chata's main crop is peanuts, she plans on using the loan to buy 4 sacks of urea, 2 sacks of complex cereal, and the rest will be used for labor costs and hoeing. The group hopes to make an average profit of 45,000 to 50,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay their families' daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Amaraa

texts.en:
Amaraa, age 49 and the mother of three children, lives with her husband and the youngest son in a small house in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest two sons live separately but her youngest son, who graduated college this year, lives with his parents. Amaraa has been operating a butcher shop for over 10 years. 

She runs her stall at local outdoor market called “Kharkhorin” with help from her husband. She has a large number of customers, including public-service establishments, who buy flesh meat every day. Although the income is considerably high, usually 95 percent is expected as an expense. She supported her oldest sons to start their lives with the profit she made (small house, furniture, electric goods, etc.).

Amaraa is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to order and purchase more flesh meat before Naadam, the biggest Mongolian national holiday. She is a bright and experienced woman who supports children as well as being willing to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more flesh meat products for the upcoming holiday.

loans.name: Judith Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Judith es directora de ventas de la marca muy conocida de cosméticos por catalogo, esta en su segundo ciclo por lo tanto es una clienta antigua de buena actitud, realizada la  visita domiciliaria se verifico que tiene muchos pedidos y por tal motivo presenta una variedad de productos, la señora  es separada tiene dos niñas las cuales ella sola las mantiene ya que el padre viajo al Brasil y no les envía dinero para sus estudios, es una persona joven trabajadora con ganas de superación, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos por mayor que se encuentren en promoción, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Judith is sales director for a very well known brand of catalogue cosmetics.  She’s in her second cycle which means she’s a longstanding client with good attitude.  At the home visit that took place it was verified that she has many pending orders and she displays quite a variety of products.

She is separated and has two little girls that she supports by herself since their father moved to Brazil and doesn’t send any money for their education.

She is a young, hard working person with a strong drive to get ahead.  She will use the loan money to buy cosmetics that are on special promotion at wholesale.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne, aged 34, is married to Rashid who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children, aged five and seven years. She runs a boutique, which is her main business.  She also does catering alongside. The business has been in operation for four years.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the funds to stock her boutique and buy catering utensils. Carolyne hopes to start importing clothes from other countries and to improve her catering skills in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is 53 years old and widowed. She lives in Bakay-Ata village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has seven grown children. Gulnar worked as a cashier at the local state farm, and is described as a benevolent, responsible and very hardworking woman.

In 1995, Gulnar began to develop her business of breeding livestock and bought cattle using her initial capital of 10,000 KGS. Also, Gulnar began to cultivate land with potatoes, beans and perennial herbs. The children help her in these activities and take part in the family business. 

Gulnar intends to use this loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase ten sacks of mineral fertilizer. With the revenues, she plans further development of her business and in future, purchase a house for her son.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Badamragchaa

texts.en:
Badamragchaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her husband works as a supervisor at local company and her three-year-old son attends a local kindergarten. 

Badamragchaa supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. She sells wide range of children's clothing imported from Beijing and Ereen, the border city of China. With the business profits she made since 2005, she managed to buy a small plot of land in 2008. 

Her aim for this year is to build a new small house on the land where her family can enjoy better living conditions. 

Badamaa is requesting a 1,500,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to import more children's clothing for the upcoming season. She says, "I love to see kids feeling overjoyed when they buy new clothes". 

She is planning to start the building project this August and is working hard to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to import more children’s clothing for the upcoming season

loans.name: Yonis Marel

texts.es: Yonis Marel tiene 34 años edad, es agricultor en pequeña escala de Yuca y Malanga, es casado, tiene tres hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de La Concepcion en el municipio de Patuca. Inició el cultivo de Yuca y Malanga con un poquito de dinero que se ganó trabajando como jornalero, y logró cultivar media manzana de tierra y esta le dio buen resultado, así que dejó de trabajar como jornalero para dedicarse a tiempo completo al cultivo. Su horario de trabajo comienza a las 6:00 am y culmina al mediodia y de vez en cuando sus hijos le ayudan con tareas que no son muy pesadas porque aun son pequeños y su esposa tambien lo hace pero se encarga mas de los quehaceres del hogar. Su ventaja es que los productos que cultiva son parte de la dieta alimenticia diaria y por eso son faciles de comercializar, su desventaja es que no cuenta con el suficiente dinero para incrementar el area de cultivo. El prestamo que Yonis solicita lo necesita para comprar urea, melaza, fungicidas y tambien para el pago de mano de obra por preparacion de la tierra a cultivar. Su meta es tecnificar su cultivo para asi convertirse en un gran productor y poder darle a su familia una mejor condicion de vida y que sus hijos sigan asistiendo a la escuela para que se hagan profesionales. Don Yonis tiene tres ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente, y eso le ha permitido obtener mas prestamos de mayores montos.
texts.en:
Yonis Marel is 34 years old.  He is a small-scale farmer of cassava and malanga (a native tuber).  He is married and has three children.  He lives together with his family in the community of La Concepcion, in the town of Patuca.  He started out growing cassava and malanga with a little money that he earned working as a laborer.  He managed to sow half a 'manzana' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of land and he obtained good results so he left his work as a laborer and started working full time on his farming.  His work day starts at 6.00am and ends at midday.  From time to time his children help him with some light tasks as they are still young.  His wife also does this but she mainly does the household chores.

Yonis' advantage is that the crops that he grows are part of people's daily diet and so they are easy to sell.  His disadvantage is that he doesn't have enough money to increase his growing area.  Yonis needs this loan to buy urea, molasses and fungicides, and also to pay laborers to prepare his land for sowing.  His goal is to apply technology to his farming so that he can become a big producer, provide his family with better living conditions and keep his children in school so that they can become professionals.

Yonis has been working with FAMA for three loan cycles and he has repaid his loans punctually.  This has allowed him to obtain subsequent loans of increasing size.

loans.use: to buy fungicides, fertilizers and molasses, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Konana

texts.en:
Konana has been operating a "boda boda" motorbike for the past three years. He is married with two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. He applied for his first loan to expand his "boda boda" business. 

He hopes to make a profit and dreams that in the near future he will buy a vehicle which can do better than a motorbike. He is a hardworking man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to expand his "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 38 years old, married and has three children. She sells office equipments such as toners, printing papers and photocopy machines. In the same business premises, she offers services such as printing and photocopying.  Lillian employs three people who run her business in her absence and to assist her in the business.  

Lillian has improved her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  With 20,000 Kenya shillings she will buy toners.

loans.use: To buy toners for her printing and photocopying busness

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Зиёда  4 года занимается откормом скота. В приусадебном участке она  откармливает  4 голов скота. Молоко, которое дает ее коровы, она продает на базаре и этим приносит дополнительную прибыль в семейный  бюджет. Зиёда замужем , у нее один ребенок. Она занимается этим бизнесом самостоятельно и просит вашей помощи в получении кредита на сумму 4000 сомони. Она заранее благодарна вам за помощь.
texts.en: Ziyoda has been involved in fattening up livestock for 4 years.  She feeds four heads of livestock in her house yard.  Ziyoda sells milk from her cows at the market and, thus, brings in additional income to her family budget.  Ziyoda is married and has one child.  She runs this business independently and asks for your help in obtaining a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy fodder for livestock

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is single and blessed with six children. For the last five years she has been selling charcoal to earn a living. She also does farming to earn extra income.  

In the next 5 years she wants to become the supplier of charcoal in her region. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 36 years old. She plants vegetables to sell with her husband, earning $6 per day. They have two children; one is studying and the other is working and earns $2.66 per day.

Every month, Lay has to spend $58 on food, $8 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds to plant. She hopes that she can make good a profit from her vegetable plantation this year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia vive en una localidad muy bonita, ella es casada con el señor sarain y  con quien procreo  tres hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella solcito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra  de  refrescos  y luego venderlo  al mayoreo en esta actividad viene  trabajando  hace cinco  años  y le va bien ya que con ellos ha visto un buen resultado para sus ingresos.

     Quien lo  motivo a esta actividad fue su familia   para sí apoyara su esposo con los  ingreso de la  casa  y la educación de su  hijos y no les falte lo más necesario.
 
   Lo  que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir mejorando día con día  su calidad de vida para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro  y logren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aurelia lives in a very nice community. She is married with Sarain and they have three children economically dependent on them.

She requested a loan to buy soft drinks to then sell them at a wholesale price. She has been engaging in this activity for five years, and she is happy whit it as this has been good for her income.

Her family is the reason she engages in this activity: she wants to help her husband with the household earnings to contribute to the education of their children and to see their basic necessities are always taken care of.

Her biggest desire is that though her activity she can day by day improve her standard of living, so that her children can have a better future and succeed in getting on in life.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Saveun

texts.en:
Saveun (in the photo) is 50 years old and her husband, Chuk is 51 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and three daughters. Three of them are married, one is a weaver, one is a construction worker and another attends grade 8.

Saveun and her husband are farmers. They grow rice, potato and sugar cane in the village where they live. Saveun is asking for a loan of $600 to assist in her farming business by buying seeds. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farm, and weaving materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen produces and trades in furniture.  Armen has been in this business for the past four years, through which he has managed to gain a large number of cilents from different parts of the city.  Due to the quality of his work Armen receives many orders and now he can't get enough boards to make the furniture.  This loan will help Armen to purchase the necessary boards and build the ordered furniture.  Armen will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.  Armen lives together with his wife and mother.

loans.use: to pay for boards to make furniture.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
Santos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en la   Caserío CP-3 del Distrito de Tambogrande, correspondiente a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
