Santos vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la venta de pescado, actividad por la cual lo conocen en la zona, por la calidad  de sus productos y la buena atención a sus clientes.  Él recorre toda su zona donde tiene clientela conocida. Las personas lo estiman y admiran por su empuje y su sentido de superación a su corta edad.  Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres y a la vez financia sus gastos personales.

Santos desea comprar más pescado para incrementar sus ventas diarias y así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Santos is 22 years old. He is single and does not have children.  He lives with his parents in the CP-3 area, in the district of Tambogrande, Piura region, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of Lambayeque state.  Santos lives in a rural area and only has electrical service.

Santos sells fish and is known in the area for the quality of his products and his good customer service.  He has customers throughout the entire area.  People like him and admire him for his efforts and desire to get ahead at such a young age.  He uses the income from this work to help his parents and cover his personal expenses.

Santos wants to buy more fish to increase his daily sales, thus growing his business and ultimately improving his quality of life.  For this purpose he has requested a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: ro purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Raza

texts.en:
Raza is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Raza is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice, and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. Her eldest son works while another of her four sons is studying in the 3rd grade. Her elder daughter sews clothes for her neighborhood clients and stays at home.

Allah Rakhi is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and works very hard to provide comfort to her family. Her husband sells cooking oil and chilies. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who will buy chilies and cooking oil in bulk quantities that will allow him to sell in larger quantities and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years, and Allah Rakhi is confident that an investment will help him to make his business more profitable.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: to buy chilies and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio tiene 31 años es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la cónyuge y los hijos de 4 y 8 años. Vive en el Recinto Caimito en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Juan Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Desde hace cinco  años, también a la criar gallinas chanchos pavos. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, semillas, ures  para la siembra del maíz, para comprar la comida apropiada para sus animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. Su sueño  es poder tener estabilidad económica, y poder comprarse una casa  para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is 31 years old, and is married with two children.  He lives with his wife and children, aged 4 and 8, in the Caimito district in the Ventanas canton.

The communal bank "LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES" is located in the Caimito 1 district, which is part of Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Juan Antonio works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  For the last five years, he has also raised chickens, pigs and turkeys.  He purchases his supplies in Ventanas, and makes his sales in the market in that same location.

The requested loan is for the purchase of supplies, fertilizers, seeds, and urea for growing corn, and for purchasing appropriate feed for his livestock.

The loan will help him to increase his income for the well-being of his family.  His dream is to be able to have financial stability, and to be able to purchase a house for his family.

In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, seeds and urea for growing corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her husband's truck repairs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 51 year old married woman and a mother of three dependents from Ormoc City, Leyte.  She has been engaged in a hog raising business for 15 years now. This is the source of her income.  Josephine is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, feed and supplements. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her hog raising business thus augmenting her income and profit. The income will be used for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is young woman from Kabale in Southwestern Uganga. She is a single mother of one child and is the sole support for herself and the child. She was never able to be educated in her village and she longed for a better life. So she left the village and moved to Kampala hoping to get an education and a good job.

Then her younger sister had to come and live with her and she had to give up on her own education. Instead, she has put all her efforts into keeping her sister and her child in school. This was very difficult since she had no steady income. Then she found Life in Africa where she now works in the Invisible Children bracelet project. The life has much improved but she knows she must do more to achieve all her goals.

Her plan is to open a business dealing with millet which is in high demand since it is a nutritious food source and is one of the staples of the Ugandan diet. She has already found a building to rent. She will employ one person to work the shop while she continues with her work at Life in Africa. She believes that the added income will make life much easier and will insure that her sister and child are able to finish school. For this project she is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000/= and she will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below is her Budget:

Millet grain 20 bags @30,000/= 600,000/= Saucepans 2 units @10,000/= 20,000/= Transport 36,000/= Rent 70,000/=(5 months advance) Containers 2 units @30,000/= 60,000/= Cups 12 units @1,200/= 14,400/=

Total 800,400/= Judith will pay the loan back in 12 months at the rate of 80,000/= per months WE Team to benefit: Education

 WE Team to benefit: Adult Education

loans.use: Start up a millet store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en:
Tuoi is 54 years old and her husband 59 years old. They have two daughters and a son. Their ages are 20, 18, 15. Only the youngest daughter continues at school. The women's activities are to sell groceries. Tuoi’s husband and son are farmers. They have land for growing rice, which is 5000 square meters.

Though they have the capacity, they don't have enough capital to increase the variety of goods for the grocery store and improve their rice productivity by using fertilizer. Their income is $7 per person/month. They want to receive a loan for $75 in order to enabL. their activities. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To increase a variety of goods for the grocery store; buy fertilizer.

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 25 years old, and her husband is 30 years old. They have 1 child, 7 months old. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam, where he works as a cyclodriver in Vinh city. Because his income is not enough, she provides extra income by raising pigs and ducks and growing rice. The pig farm is at her parents' house at the moment and they want to build their own, that's why they need a loan. At the moment she has two pigs, but once the farmyard is created she wants to have 5 or 6 pigs.

loans.use: To start a pig farm

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia has a grocery business or neighborhood store in her home. She also offers rooms for rent. Her family is maD. up of herself and her husband, who collaborates with her in both businesses. The couple's children are grown now and no longer live with their parents.

Florencia's neighborhood store is one of the oldest of the area; she has 26 years of experience in the store. She has competition, since there are similar stores in the neighborhood, but she has two advantages: her location and how long she has been in business. She has a very good client following.

The loan will be used to purchase cement, wood and other construction materials needed to finish rooms that will be rented to third parties.

This is Florencia's sixth loan. She has shown herself to be a very serious and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Florencia tiene un negocio D. abarrotes o tienda D. barrio en su domicilio, paralelamente ofrece cuartos en alquiler. Su familia está compuesta por ella y su esposo quién le colabora en ambos negocios, los hijos D. esta pareja son mayores y ya no viven con ellos.

La tienda D. barrio D. Florencia es una D. las mas antiguas D. su zona ya que cuenta con mas D. 26 años D. experiencia. La competencia del negocio es media debido a la cantidad D. negocios similares en el barrio, pero lo que le favorece a Florencia es la antiguedad y ubicación del negocio, ella cuenta con muy buena clientela.

El crédito es para la adquisición D. cemento, madera y otros materiales D. construcción que necesita para concluir unos cuartos que tienen el objeto D. ser alquilados a terceras personas. La presente solicitud es la sexta D. Florencia, tiempo en el cuál demostró ser una persona muy seria y responsable.

loans.use: Finish rooms to be rented

loans.name: Nora Idalia

texts.es:
Nora is a married woman and her husband works as a chauffer. They have a child. The main motivation to start her business was the need for income to help her husband with the household expenses. Since her husband's job is variable and undependable that made things worse, so she started first selling shoes through catalogues until she had formed a clientele and little by little grew and set up shelves in her house to display the merchandise she was promoting. Now she is also very enthusiastically selling cosmetics, so she can increase her market and sales for both products.

Nora is requesting a loan for US$925 to cover pending orders and buy more merchandise to offer her clients. She offers to pay back the loan in 6 months. She is thankful for your support in helping her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers.

Nora es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer, tienen un hijo y el principal motivo para emprender su negocio fue la necesidad de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y como el empleo de su esposo es eventual eso empeoraba su situación, entonces ella empezó vendiendo primero zapatos por catálogo hasta crear una cartera de clientes y poco a poco con su crecimiento puso un estante en su casa para colocar y mostrar las promociones que tenía y ahora vende cosméticos, en los que esta poniéndole muchas ganas para poder incrementar su mercado y tener las ventas de sus dos productos.

Nora esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para cubrir pedidos pendientes, surtirse de más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho tu apoyo para ayudarla a salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchanidise for her business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: I am a mother of ten, six boys and four girls. I live with my family in a small town, Arifwala, Pakistan. I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes to order. My husband drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi). He bought his rickshaw by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution based in Pakistan. He repaid the loan installments on time leaving him with decent profits. Now my son has also learned to drive and I want to buy him a rickshaw as well. This way he will help us to manage our household expenses. I request a loan of US$350 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
The purpose of Janet M.’s loan is to purchase more products (increasing her stock), buy building materials, and pay for her children to go to boarding school. She has a market stall where she sells refrigerators, clothes, matooke (cooked, mashed bananas), and charcoal.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Rohni

texts.en: Rohni, 31, is the mother of 2 children whose husband, R., does not work anymore. So to provide for her family needs she sells crispy chips, snacks, beverages, etc. at her food stall in front of her house, earning $3 a day. She is requesting a loan of $75 to buy more goods for her stall and to earn more income. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Gracias por su apoyo para comprar un equipo y herramienta nueva. Hoy estoy solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía para la peluquería y acondicionarla mejor el local para esta temporada de calor y para que los clientes estén más cómodos al esperar su turno. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls Para la comprar mercancía y acondicionar el local.

Thank you for your support to purchase equipment and new tools.  Today I am seeking a loan to buy merchandise for the barbershop and better air-condition the shop for the heat this season and so that clients are more comfortable while waiting their turn.  I am seeking a loan of $1200 to buy merchandise and better air-condition the location.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and better air-condition the location.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a forty-year old mother of six children.  Three of them are still in school and three have finished their schooling. 

Comfort wakes at every morning at 5:15 am to prepare her assorted pastries.  She sells the pastries at the nearby Ahodwo roundabout.  In addition to increasing her inventory with this loan, Comfort hopes to begin to save more money to help her children with schooling.

Comfort is part of the trust group Emmanuel.    The trust group uses peer pressure as a form of social collateral to ensure that each member of the group pays their fair share.  

Comfort is pictured in the orange blouse.   Next to her is Annastasia, her Sinapi loan officer.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, and sugar for her pastries

loans.name: Saudat

texts.en:
Saudat is 37 years old. She is divorced and is responsible for taking care of her 3 children, ages 16, 12 and 10. Saudat owns a small food store, which she started in 2006. She works at her shop every day between 7am and 2pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250.

Saudat has applied for this loan so that she can buy more food items to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell in a small shop

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia started selling snacks and beverages at a small wood and metal shop to help her family financially. In time, she started getting customers who insisted that she expand her selection of goods and open a general store. Little by little, she started offering dairy products, soft drinks, cold cuts, and other goods. Her business grew when she invested in it and also because of her faithful customers, who know that Sofía needs their support.

Sofía currently needs a loan of $200.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and paint her store. She hopes that this will be possible with Kiva’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofia, inicio el negocio en la venta de refrescos y frituras en un local pequeño de madera y laminas, para ayudar económicamente en su hogar. Con el tiempo se fue haciendo de clientes, que le insistían que surtiera mercancía para que tuviera una tienda de abarrotes, entonces poco a poco fue surtiendo lácteos, refrescos, carnes frías y todo para tener bien surtida la tienda. Su negocio fue creciendo con la inversión de créditos y gracias a sus clientes que no la han abandonado y que saben que Sofía necesita de su apoyo.

Ahora Sofía necesita de un prestamo por US $200 que pagara en 5 meses, para comprar mercancía y para pintar el local de su tienda, tiene la esperanza en el apoyo de Kiva esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Milton José

texts.es:
Milton Hernandez is from the county of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has one young son and his dream is to see him get professional success. For this to happen, and as any responsible father would, he has started to rebuild their house and thereby improve the family's living conditions as the house was in a bad state.

It is important to add that since he started this reconstruction he has been faced with many economic problems, but he has managed to overcome them due to the credit that Ceprodel had given him for building materials. He once again needs the support of this credit and hopes that this need will be met, as this is how he will continue to rebuild their house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Milton Hernandez es un caballero del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es padre de un hijo pequeño cuyos sueños son que llegue a convertirse en un gran profesional de éxito. Para esto, como todo padre responsable ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su pequeños e inició a reconstruir su vivienda por haberse encontrado en mal estado.

Es importante destacar que desde que inició con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ha atravesado problemáticas económicas pero las ha logrado superar gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido obtener los créditos para la compra de los materiales de reconstrucción. Una vez más solicita el apoyo crediticio esperando que su petición será contestada y así continuará con la labor de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To buy construction materials/Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Andrea, Victoria, And Silvia Group

texts.en:
Andrea, Victoria and Silvia are members of the Lirio Village Bank.

Andrea is a married, forty-year-old mother of eight children. Andrea travels to different regional fairs to buy cereal, small animals, cheese, etc. to sell in the Nery García Market. In addition, Andrea sells fruit and soda in front of her home.

Meanwhile, Victoria is a married, thirty-eight-year-old woman. Victoria engages in artisan embroidery of fabrics such as scarfs, tapestries, etc,, which she sells in the Santa Clara Market.

Silvia is a married, thirty-year-old mother of two children. Siliva travels to different regional fairs to purchase cereal, cheese, meats, etc. to sell in her neighborhood market and door-to-door.

Andrea, Victoria, and Silvia need separate loans of 400 soles each, to invest in beans, corn, thread, dye, meat, and cheese so they can further expand their businesses.

Andrea, Victoria and Sylvia´s dreams are to have their own homes, to have their own working capital, to repatch their house roofs, and to see that their children study hard.

loans.use: Andrea, Victoria, and Silvia need separate loans of 400 soles each to invest in beans, corn, thread, dye, meat, and cheese so they can further expand their business.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi baji is the wife of M. and the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 16 years. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, having 6 years' experience. Her younger son and daughter are in kindergarten. Allah Rakhi baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy wood to make furniture and help her husband expand his business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy bicycles for her bicycles shop. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy a cart for her husband to use selling soft drinks. Bushran baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband's furniture business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Neema Mhilane from Mwanza. Married with two children aged 18 and 25, Neema has been selling chickens since 2006.  Working at the business for nine hours a day, seven days per week, she currently earns about $200 a month. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to buy more chickens, and in the future  plans to buy even more.  Neema thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Jurakul

texts.en: Jurakul grows onions, tomatoes and other gourds. With his borrowed money, he wants to pay for labour and to buy bags for keeping onions. This way, he can sell them later for a higher price and make good money to live on, as well as to help his son to marry.

loans.use: To purchase bags for onions and to pay for transportation and labour

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Women's Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is the leader of the Zibula Atudde women’s group in Lugazi. She has been in the group as an active member for ten years. She is grateful for the group as it has helped her so much with her business.

Joyce is married with five children and also helps to care for ten dependents, both young and old. She has a tailoring business in which she he makes clothes for women, men, and children. She sells the clothing herself on her business premises.

Using her loans, Joyce has always been able to buy sewing material as well as ready-made clothes to sell. She now needs a loan to help buy more material for tailoring jobs (though some of her clients bring her their own material).

loans.use: To buy more clothing material for tailoring.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi, married, has 3 children. He was born in 1959. 10 years ago he started this business. He lives in Khachmaz town. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy fruits from the villages for sale in town.

loans.use: To buy fruits from the villages for sale in town

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Y. has been selling vegetables in the local market of Babiani in the Western Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 22-year-old woman and still single. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs such as beans, onions, peppers, carrots, green pepper and salad leaves on the top of a table in the market.

Mary does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality merchandise to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance. She is pleading for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. is sixty years old. She is widowed but has given birth to five children: four boys and a girl. Currently, Ama says two of her children have completed senior high school, while the rest are still in primary school. Ama says she also takes care of her late sister's five children. She lives with her family in a rented house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is both a farming and commercial community.

Ama, therefore, works very hard to take care of the family. She sells fresh yams in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. Ama has been in business for five years. She also distributes the yam to some food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and thus increase her profit margin. It is her dream to give all her children and late sister’s children formal education.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor José Alfredo M. tiene ya mas de 6 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas preparadas como es tacos, burritos, quesadillas y hamburguesas, este es un negocio familiar, sus tres hijos que ya son mayores cada uno tiene su negocio.
     Él esta iniciando un nuevo local que estará ubicado en la carretea de Nuevo Laredo pero le está haciendo falta terminarlo, en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder terminarlo y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder terminar su nuevo local con el cual de dará empleo a dos personas para que lo atiendan.
texts.en:
José Alfredo M. has more than six years experience dedicating himself to selling prepared meals such as tacos, burritos, quesadillas and hamburgers. It is a family business. His three children, all grown up, help him with the business. He is opening up a new store that will be located along the Nuevo Laredo highway, but he is having trouble completing it because at the moment he doesn't have the necessary funds and he doesn't want to take money away from his business. For this reason he is requesting a loan so he will be able to finish his new store and hire two employees to tend to it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete construction of store

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Chaom Chau Commune in Phnom Penh City. The group leader, Mrs. C., is 51 years old and the mother of six children; four of them are single and the other two are married. She presently makes a daily income of $5 per day from selling groceries out of her home. To help support the family's needs, her husband is a domestic construction foreman. C.'s investment is going smoothly and she has gained more income due to skilled communication in the village. To earn additional income, she is applying for a loan to increase stocks of groceries.

The other two borrowers are: S., who sells a few groceries from the family home and is looking for a loan to increase her business capital; and H., who is a widower father of three children. He works as an assistant to a village consultant and requests a loan to purchase furniture to decorate his house.

loans.use: To increase stock of groceries

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five members. Its leader, T., 38, is a mother of two children; one is a garment worker and another one is a student.

T. has planted vegetables on a plot of land she derived from her parents, for more than two years. She is a responsible neighbor and everyone admires her work and her struggle. She sells in the early morning and late afternoon. Recently she wanted to make another income. T. is applying for the loan to buy soft drinks to sell.

Another member is Sareth, 33, who works in the garment factory. She is taking a loan to buy soft drinks for her child to sell.

S., 35, who owns a shop selling disks, is looking for a loan to buy grocery products for her husband to sell.

Y., 60, sells vegetables and is looking for a loan to invest in her business.

M., 60, sells traditional noodles and is taking a loan to buy fruit to sell in the evening time.

They all live in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: Buy supplies to sell to make a profit.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
The small stone pigpen located in Siem Reap Province is used by Mrs. S. for raising pigs to earn a living. In her pig-raising business, she sells the mature pigs twice a year, four months after she begins raising them.

She is applying for a $300 loan to be used to buy additional piglets and to build one more stall for breeding pigs. S. is a widowed mother who has three children who are in school and still live in the family home.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and to build one more stall for breeding pigs

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Agustina es casada tiene 48 años  tres hijos16, 11 y 9 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Agustina tenia una ferretería ella distribuía materiales para ferretería a varios locales  pero se enfermo de la columna por cargar las cosas, dejaba a crédito a quince días y a  un mes y tuvo que cambiar de giro puso un restaurante le va mejor, cada día hay entrada de dinero. 
Agustina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de mesas, sillas, menajes de cocina para su restaurante.
Desde que esta en Finca puede invertir mas, su economía ha mejorado, aprendió ahorrar aprendió  a ser responsable con los prestamos    
Agustina tiene un sueño que es poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the Sol de Alegría communal bank. She is married, 48 years old and has three children, 16, 11 and 9, who are in the public schools. Agustina had a hardware business and distributed hardware supplies to various shops, but she hurt her back from carrying so much and gave out credit at 15 days and 1 month, so she had to change her line of business. She started up a restaurant, which is going better for her, and there is money coming in every day. Agustina needs a loan for 2,400 soles to buy tables, chairs and kitchenware for her restaurant. Since she has been with Finca she now invests more, her finances have improved, and she has learned to save and to be responsible with her loans. Agustin´s dream is to start up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, kitchenware for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар и его мама занимаются предпринимательством. Диловару 26 лет, имеет 1 ребенка. Каждый день с утра они выходят на рынок и раскладывают товар для продажи. За товаром ездит мама Диловара, а он в это время продает его. По выходным дням когда очень много покупателей жена Диловара также выходит на рынок и помогает в торговле. Для расширения своего бизнеса Диловар решил обратиться на КИВА и получить здесь займ. Собирается приобрести новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Dilovar is 26 years old, married and has a child. Together with his mother, Dilovar is involved in an entrepreneurship. Every morning, they come out to a market and set out goods for sale. While Dilovar’s mother travels to obtain the goods, he sells at the market. On weekends, when customer traffic is especially high, Dilovar’s wife also goes to the market and helps with the sales. Dilovar decided to request a loan from Kiva in order to expand his business. He plans to purchase a new assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy L. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Lucy owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling fruit products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lucy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to increase her fruit vending business. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr: Sadio T. est une jeune femme de 23 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient un restaurant et veut ce prêt pour renforcer son capital. Son objectif est l’amélioration des conditions  de vie et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sadio T. is a young woman of 23, married and the mother of 3 children. She runs a restaurant and wants this loan to bolster her working capital. Her goal is the improvement of living conditions and the health of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: running a food service serving breakfast

loans.name: Belking Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: José Agustín M. Bermúdez, Mauda Patricia M. Bermúdez e Iselita del Rosario Jalinas Bermúdez

Llegaron a tener crédito con Adim porque una cliente les habló del tipo de crédito que recibían, donde confiaban en la honorabilidad de los clientes.

Este grupo es originario de la comarca La Montañita, son personas conocidas por sus actividades económicas.:
Don José Agustín es un joven soltero que se dedica a la venta de frutas en el M. municipal, compra las frutas en la comarca y las vende muy temprano, esto para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, tiene a cargo a su mamá , ofrece frutas de la temporada que son las más baratas, él sueña con mejorar su vivienda.

Doña Mauda Patricia es  la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer madre de dos niños de edad escolar,se dedica al destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales, esta actividad la hace en su casa para dar atención a los niños y hacer los oficios del hogar. Sueña dar estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a quedar bien a la institución que confía en ella.

Doña Iselita es una joven mujer, soltera y sin hijos, de ella dependen sus padres en todos sus gastos, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el M. de Masaya.
Ella sueña con poder proporcionar siempre a sus padres lo que necesiten y mejorar su vivienda. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Estos señores abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores y así garantizan la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
In the photo from left to right: José Agustín M. Bermúdez, Mauda Patricia M. Bermúdez and Iselita del Rosario Jalinas Bermúdez.

These individuals have come to ask for a loan with ADIM because a customer told them about the type of credit they receive, where they trust the integrity of its borrowers.

This group is from the region of La Montañita and are known for their economic activities:

Don José Agustín is a single youth that sells fruits in the municipal market. He buys fruits in the region and sells them very early in order to help his family with household expenses and to take care of his mother. He sells seasonal fruits at the cheapest prices and his dream is to improve his housing.

Mauda Patricia is the coordinator of the group and is a young mother of two school-age children. She makes pork fillings for tamales, which she does at home in order to take care of her kids and do house chores. She dreams of sending her children to study and improving her housing. She is very happy to work with ADIM because she has never had the opportunity to receive loans and is going to make a good impression to this institution that has trusted her.

Iselita is a young single woman without children but with parents who depend on her for all of their expenses. She sells vegetables and fruits at the Masaya market. She dreams of always being able to provide for her parents what they need and to improve her home. She has had her business for many years.

These individuals will pay back every Monday, which is the best day to pay, because after the weekend the sales are the best and so in this fashion they will pay their loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fruits products for their local stores

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida tiene 28 años, de bonito carácter y muy llevadero con todos, vive con el padre de sus 2  hijos, Yasmín de 7 y Estaban de 3 años de edad, por el momento habitan en la casa de sus suegros. Desde muy jovencita se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de arvejas y papas, porque siempre le han resultado muy rentables y más aun, porque trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo, siente que estas actividades la llenan de mucho vigor en su vida cotidiana. Asimismo hace 3 años decidió criar ovejas con la finalidad de obtener ganancias adicionales, para ello, se inició con un par de corderitos y la cantidad se fue incrementando. Ahora que pasaron los años, esta actividad le está generando muy buenos ingresos, porque los vende (vivos) a un precio de entre 100 y 120 soles, dependiendo del tamaño y el peso. Por ello, en horas de la tarde se dedica a pastear a sus animales, pero cuando tiene que trabajar en sus chacras, deja a cada cordero sujeto a una estaca, de modo que avance con su jornada. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante los anteriores ciclos demostró pagar puntualmente, por lo que ganó la confianza y respeto del resto de los integrantes de su banco comunal, donde la nombraron como tesorera y ella muy alegremente juro cumplir dicha responsabilidad. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de animales y otra cantidad para adquirir 10 sacos de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Nerida is 28 years old and she has a good disposition and is tolerant of everything. She lives with the father of her two children, seven-year-old Yasmin and three-year-old Estaban. They live in the house of her in-laws for the time being. Since she was a little girl, she has worked at planting and growing peas and potatoes because they have always been very profitable. But even more, because she works with the support of her husband, she feels that these activities provide her with a lot of energy in her daily life. At the same time, she decided three years ago to raise sheep with the objective of obtaining additional profits. So she began with a couple of little lambs and then the quantity increased. With the passage of years this activity is providing her with very good earnings because she sells them at a price of between 100 to 120 Sols on the hoof, depending on the size and weight. To do this, she puts them out to pasture during the afternoon, but when she has to work in her fields she leaves each lamb tethered to a stake in such a way that it advances as it grazes. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. During the previous cycles, she has been punctual in her payments and so has won the confidence and respect of the other members of her communal bank, where she has been appointed treasurer and she has happily sworn to fulfill this responsibility. She is planning on investing the money which she is requesting in the purchase of animals as well as in acquiring 10 bags of chemical fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dakila

texts.en:
Dakila is 39-years old and a resident of Barangay Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Marcos who works as a farmer and a part-time construction worker. They have four children who are all studying. She hopes that they will be able to afford to send them to school until college.

Dakila sells vegetables and raw bananas in their village. She goes around the village to sell them. She started this business in order to help her husband provide for their children. She would like a loan of PHP 5,000 in order for her business to grow. She is hoping to become more productive in her business in order to attain her dream of providing an education for her children because, according to her, it is the only thing they can give them to assist them when they become independent.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital for vegetable selling business

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en: Gordon is forty – eight years old. He is married and has given birth to six children, all in school. He works hard to be able to provide for the family. Gordon lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a trader. He runs a provision store. He has his store by the street in his community. Gordon buys his goods from Kumasi. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of provision in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice is 41 years old he is married with four children. Currently all his children are in school. He is a chemical seller and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs etc. in his neighborhood. He has added the sale of agro-chemicals products that are used in a farm inputs to his goods but it is separated from the consumable drugs to prevent danger on human health and the environment.

He has been in business for three years now and he is among the people who supply pharmaceutical products in the community. He wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to raise good income to take care of his family especially his children education. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es: Valentín es un joven trabajador de maquiladora ya desde hace 12 años en el cual obtuvo una casa de interés social. Por un tiempo la tuvo rentada e instaló portón con malla,  ahora el quiere poner portón metálico para mejor protección de su vivienda y artículos personales que el ha obtenido con el tiempo. Ahora las personas que le rentaban desocuparon la casa y el para que no se encontrara sola la habito nuevamente, ya se han visto casos donde se han robado el cableado, ventanas y puertas por lo que las casas quedad completamente destruidas. El pensando en cuidar  su patrimonio desea ponerle el portón para mayor seguridad.

loans.use: Instalar portón metalico

loans.name: Ajaratu

texts.en:
Ajaratu is a 52-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of six children. Three are currently in school and the rest are working.

Ajaratu is a food vendor and serves food like waakye. Waakye is prepared from local rice mixed with beans. Many Ghanaians enjoy it as it has local taste and is a standard. She has been in food production for 35 years now in taking care of the family.

Ajaratu says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and rice to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her children’s educational needs. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making waakye

loans.name: Roberto Elías

texts.es: Roberto Elías S. R. reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Roberto tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Roberto de 15 años de edad y Rebeca de 11 años de edad, ambos niños estudiantes. Roberto posee una gran experiencia en los negocios, ya que desde muy joven empezó trabajando en ello, como comerciante de ropa, pero ahora él ha tenido la oportunidad de instalar su propio negocio gracias a la ayuda de créditos otorgados donde él ha sido muy puntual, en esta ocación el solo desea surtir su negocio que en los últimos meses se ha visto que ha aumentado la demanda y por ello que con la ayuda de préstamo el podrá surtir su inventario y seguir creciendo,  que te lo agradecerá el  y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Elías S. R., 42, lives in the Santa Tecla municipality of the La Libertad department. He lives with his wife and two sons: Robert, 15, and Rebeca, 11. Both children are in school. Roberto has a lot of experience as a merchant, since he started working in clothing sales from a very early age. Now, he has been able to set up his own store thanks to the credits granted. He has always been very punctual with repayments. Now, he just wants to restock his store because in the last few months demand has increased and, with the help of the loan, he will be able to stock inventory and continue to grow. For this he, and his entire family, will be very grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel T., her husband Johnel and their 3 young children live in Brgy. Biao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. Ritchel is 29 years old and her 3 children are between 3 to 9 years old. Ritchel’s fondest hope is for her children to finish college and have good jobs or livelihoods when they grow up.

Ritchel realized early on that if they only relied on one source of income, she would probably not be able to fulfill her dreams for her children. She knew that she had the necessary skills to run a general store but she did not have the capital to even start one. When a friend informed her about how NWTF could help her, she immediately joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005.

Determined to make her new business a success, Ritchel worked hard to provide her customers with the items that they needed, and in the 4 years that she has been running the store, her monthly income has periodically increased.

Now she earns about 24,000 PHP per month from her business activities which includes selling specialty products to her neighbors. Her income from her business activities has enabled her to have their house fixed.

Because she wants to pay her loans off in the shortest possible time, she has always borrowed on short terms. She used her previous loan of 19,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. Maintaining her good credit performance, she paid off that loan within its loan term, and this has enabled her to borrow a bigger loan for the next cycle. 

She is now borrowing 20,000 PHP for her 9th loan cycle so that she can sustain the inventory levels of her general store.

In the accompanying picture, Ritchel is at the back of her general store, which is attached to her house, with empty bottles waiting for the delivery van to pick up and replenish.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: Martha Rosa A. de 29 años de edad, reside en Olocuilta en el departamento de La Paz, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero y sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.  Martha como toda mujer responsable quien trabaja muy duro para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que también anhela brindarles una mejor vida a sus pequeños hijos, posee una venta de frutas y verduras, en la cual día con día trabaja arduamente por vender más por el bienestar de sus hijos. Martha solícita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas, sobre todo uvas y manzanas las cuales se venden mucho en esta época navideña, así mismo surtirlo con verduras y especias. Ella desea aprovechar este fin de año para poder obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera permitirle a sus hijos poder tener un fin de año lleno de mucha ilusión y alegría.
texts.en:
Martha Rosa A. is 29 years old and lives in Oocuilta, a neighborhood of La Paz. She lives together with her husband who works as a carpenter and has two young children who are going to school. Martha is a very responsible woman who works hard to so she can help her husband with household expenses. She longs to bring a better life to her young children. She owns a stand where she sells fruit and vegetables in which she works day in day out arduously to sell more for the well being of her children.

Martha is requesting a loan so she can buy more fruit, like grapes and apples which are selling well in the Christmas season. As well, she is supplying vegetables and spices. She wishes to make the most of the end of the year so she can obtain the highest profits. In this way, she can help give her children a holiday season filled with hope and happiness.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

location.town: Olocuilta en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Andrea Margarita

texts.es: Andrea Margarita J. D. L. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo. Ella posee una venta D. lácteos como queso y crema. Andrea tiene 8 años D. poseer su negocio, sus vecinos la reconocen como una mujer muy dedicada, responsable y amable, lo cual le permite a ella que las personas la prefieran a la hora D. comprar lácteos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra mayor cantidad D. queso y crema, así mismo Andrea desea poder ampliar su negocio, comprando aceite, granos básicos y cosméticos, todo esto lo hace con el fin D. poder obtener mayores ganancias y así mismo tener una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea Margarita Jimenez D. Lopez is 37 years old, she lives in the municipality of Ilopango in El Salvador. She lives together with her husband and their son. She has a dairy store, selling cheese and cream. Andrea has been running her business for the past 8 years, and she is known as a very dedicated, responsible and amicable person, the reason why people prefer her business for their dairy products. She is requseting a loan to purchase larger quantities of cheeses and creams. She would also like to expand her business and start providing cooking oil, basic grains, and cosmetics. She is doing everything so that she will improve her revenues and to have a better life for her family and for herself.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora MARISOL, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, (16, 13, 4) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la administración de su combi, ella es empresaria tiene en la ruta de Cusco Cabildo una línea de combis que prestan el servicio de transporte a los ciudadanos, ella está en este negocio desde hace 7 años y le va muy bien, ahora ella socita el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de sus trasportes, deberá comprar algunos repuestos entre otros.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women). She is originally from Cuzco. Marisol is 32 years old, married, and has three children (aged 16, 13 and 4). Marisol alternates her domestic duties with running a fleet of minibuses that help transport local people around the city. Marisol has been running this business for 7 years and it is going very well. She needs a loan to help with maintenance of the vehicles and to buy some spare parts, amongst other things. Marisol is very grateful and happy for the opportunity to expand her business and is committed to the stipulations of the loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her transportation business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth went into business as a rice farmer in 2003. She is 30 years old, married and has two children, the older of which is six. When not working on the farm, she supplements her income by selling health and beauty products. She is committed to save as much money as possible to cover the cost of educating and caring for her children. She has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.en: Luisa P.'s main source of income comes from making and selling dried fish in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. Luisa has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Luisa is the leader of a 13 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Calasina

texts.en:
Calasina A. comes from Musoma village in the Nambale Busia District. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with eight children. She is a farmer who plants and sells cereals in the nearby market in Buhayo Central. She sometimes buys supplies in Nambale. She started this business in 2007.

Calasina has been supporting her husband who doesn’t have a stable job to enable him to sustain their big family. She would like to expand her farming activities by increasing her stock, and she also wants to build a storage structure for her produce. To do this, she needs resources. She is requesting a loan worth 10,000 KES to implement her plans.

loans.use: To increase stock and build a storage structure

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She works with clothing merchandise, selling it in the central mall of her hometown. Nataliya sells men’s and women’s jackets and suits. She has been in this business for eight years. Presently, Nataliya has about 30,000 Grivnyas of monthly income. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 4,200 Grivnya to purchase additional clothing inventory for further retail sale in her little store. She is hoping to buy new, trendy clothing that sells well among numerous mall customers. Nataliya can be characterized as a solvent borrower capable of current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour, beans and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda L. is from the village of D'Ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Brenda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling scrap metal, bottles, and other used products. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Brenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Brenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Folunke

texts.en: Folunke B. sells groceries. She has been in this business for long. She is happy in her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 48 years old, married with a child. Folunke’s husband is a carpenter and he also supports their home. She is a LAPO client. Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more groceries to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en:
Annonciatha is the 58-year-old married mother of six children who are between the ages of 10 and 28, some of them in school.

Annonciatha owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products such as juice, cosmetics products, water, and so on. She has been engaged in her business for over three years. Her small shop is open from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except Sunday.

Annonciatha is now requesting her loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for her shop. These additional products will allow her to attract more customers which will help her to earn more profits. With these profits she expects to save money for the future of her family. Particularly, her children who are in school will get their school fees paid more easily.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her shop to expand her business

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi vive en anticrético (es una forma legal de alquilar una habitación, departamento o casa, por un tiempo pre determinado y por un monto de dinero que se estipula en el contrato y que se paga por adelantado y es devuelto al final del contrato) en la zona alto San Pedro, es soltera y vive sola.
Daysi trabaja de cajera en una casa de cambios durante 5 años, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar el anticretico de su vivienda.  
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Daysi lives in an “anticrético” rental unit (a legal method in Bolivia for renting a room, apartment, or house in which an amount of money stipulated in the contract is paid in advance and returned at the end of the contract period). Her home is in the District of Alto San Pedro. Daysi is single and lives alone.

She has worked as a cashier at a currency exchange house for the past five years in order to support herself. The loan she is requesting will be used to extend the “anticrético” rental agreement on her home. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating and is qualified to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend the “anticrético” rental agreement on her home

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana tiene 34 años  de edad es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 12 años y 2 años de edad, ella cuenta con casa propia de material noble recientemente construida. Su casa esta ubicado en el AA.HH  Sta Ysabel del Distrito de Parcona. Ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa como recorredora, se dedica a este negocio hace 2 años , se inicio con capital propio. Ella cuenta con muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder seguir contruyendo su casa para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Liliana is 34 years old; she lives with her common law husband and two children, ages 12 and 2. She has her own home, recently constructed from good quality materials, located in the AA.HH. Santa Ysabel in the Parcona District. She has been selling clothing door-to-door for two years, a business that she began with her own capital. She has many dreams and goals; one of these is to be able to continue construction on her house to give her children a better quality of life. She will use the funds from this loan to invest in work capital for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in work capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria S., a widow at 70 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She maintains a simple life, having no other opportunities in life except for business as she only possesses an elementary diploma. She struggles hard with her business and makes sure that it is successful and stable.

Gloria operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells green and ripe mangoes, melons, watermelons and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her product inventory are different species of bananas. Apples, pears and lychees are fruits that are offered a few times a year. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Gloria dreams to save up enough for her future retirement.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Joey

texts.en: Joey G. runs a general store selling both food and daily use products in his community. He is 44 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Bagong Sikat, Alicia, Isabela. Joey has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Joey joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Joey is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be his fourth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, N. Mahmud worked diligently in his fertilizer and pesticide-selling venture. He made enough income to improve his home and save for his children’s education expenses. As he was diligently selling fertilizer, his land has not been prepared. Mahmud has immediately taken the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He needs funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Mahmud is optimistic his venture will be successful and all his efforts will improve his family’s welfare.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Magamaga Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: I. Cristopher has been partial to hard work ever since he began his retail shop business 10 years ago in Magamaga-Jinja. Cristopher, who belongs to the Magamaga Development Group, is 40 years old and happily married with 6 kids who all attend school, thanks in part to his dedication in paying for their education. He started this business after he dropped out of school. In a week, he makes profits that add up to 100,000 shillings and with this loan he is looking at buying more retail goods for his shop. He is looking at buying more bags of sugar, bars of soap, rice, maize flour and plastics for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of sugar, bars of soap, rice, maize flour and plastics for resale

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one child. She owns a small business selling thread and other supplies for knitting and sewing. Irina started this business 4 years ago when she was left without a source of income. Today, her profit is about 6,000 Grivnas a month.

Irina would like to borrow 8,000 Grivnas to purchase more stock. She hopes that a large assortment of goods will attract even more clients and increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Njawa

texts.en:
Najwa is a mother of one son and three daughters, married and living in Hebron. Her husband owns a small store where he sells home basics and accessories. 

Najwa helps her husband working in the store. Najwa and her husband wanted to increase the profits of the store, therefore they came to FATEN and took a $2000 loan to purchase more goods.

Najwa took a previous loan from FATEN and was a very good borrower. Najwa appears in the picture here in FATEN’s office.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: N. Viviane

texts.fr: A. N. Viviane est née le 10 Juin 1972 à Calavi. Mariée à ANANI Bertin, Viviane est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Viviane vit avec sa famille depuis neuf ans à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Viviane n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Viviane vend des mèches et des produits de beauté à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Viviane achète ses produits. Viviane exerce cette activité depuis sept ans, et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits, qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Viviane se fait de plus en plus nombreuse et Viviane désire augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de mieux les satisfaire et par ricochet d’accroître son revenu. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
N. Viviane A. was born on June 10, 1972 in Calavi. Married to Bertin Anani, Viviane is the mother of five children, some of whom are in school. Viviane has lived with her family for nine years in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. The couple jointly pay the family's various expenses.

Viviane has never been to school. To meet her needs, Viviane sells hair extensions and beauty products from her home. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. 

Viviane has been in this business for seven years and has already received two loans, both of which were fully repaid. Viviane's customers are more and more numerous, and she would like to increase her working capital in order to better satisfy them and thus increase her income. This is why she is seeking a third loan.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and beauty supplies

loans.name: Silvia Johanna

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

Silvia es una joven señora, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene una niña de 1 año y cuatro meses, el marido es taxista y estudia leyes en la Universidad San Gregorio de Portoviejo. Ella estudia ciencias de la educación en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí. Para ella este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatillas, y bisutería. Además de esto también trabaja en un cibert (internet y cafetería), desde las 8am hasta las 14h00  de lunes a viernes, después de esa hora ella se dedica a sus ventas y los sabados y domingos todo el día. Además en su lugar de trabajo también realiza sus ventas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y ciertos productos se los envían desde España.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil y así traer más mercadería en especial pantalones de damas ya que le ha encargado varios de estos. Sus sueños son tener su titulo en ciencias de la educación y poder incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Rio de Oro' community bank meet every fortnight in La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Silvia is a young woman of 24.  She is married and has a 16 month-old daughter from her marriage.  Her husband is a taxi driver who is studying law at the Universidad San Gregorio de Portoviejo.  Silvia is studying education sciences at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.  This is Silvia's second loan cycle in her community bank.  She likes her community bank because of the seriousness of all the bank members.

Silvia sells clothes, shoes and costume jewelry.  She also works in an Internet café from 8.00am to 2.00pm from Monday to Friday.  From 2.00pm she makes her sales.  She also sells all day Saturday and Sunday and in her work place.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every fortnight.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and she receives some of her products from Spain.

She will use this loan to travel to Guayaquil and bring back more merchandise, especially ladies' pants since she has orders these.  Her dreams are to graduate from her education sciences degree at university and to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes, especially ladies' pants, shoes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over twelve years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling green vegetables and potatoes. In addition she has rental houses which contributes to her other source of income. Rehema faces a major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand and establish other rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to renovate a rental house and purchase cement and plaster. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To renovate a rental house and purchase cement and  plaster.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa Del Carmen, por lo que su actividad es una pulpería y venta de verduras, hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos. Siempre le ha gustado buscar la forma de mejorar su condición de vida pues tenía 3 hijos de los cuales tenía que brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de frutas, verduras y para la pulpería. Se siente muy contenta por obtener esta forma de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Luisa Del Carmen runs a neighborhood store and fruit stand; she has owned these businesses for over 5 years. This is not her first time requesting a loan. She has always enjoyed finding was to improve her quality of life, as she had 3 children to put through school. The motive for her loan request is to purchase fruits and vegetables, and for her neighborhood store. She is very happy to have access to this venue to improve her income.

loans.use: Work Capital (to purchase fruits and vegetables, and for her neighborhood store).

loans.name: Yaako Efua

texts.en:
Yaako Efua E. is divorced, has five dependents, and is responsible for the well-being of her home. She sells drinks and foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, and yam at Takoradi.  She has been doing this for three years.

Yaako plans to use the proceeds of this loan to purchase more foodstuffs for resale.  If she is able to generate new profits as a result of expanding her business, Yaako intends to use the additional income to pay for her dependents' education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Yaako is pictured with cassava in a basket.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase more food stuffs for resale

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  He operates a cafe in a rented space at the local market in his town. He opened his cafe in 2008 after moving from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After years of successful operation, his monthly net profit has increased to a level of 200,000 and 250,000 MNT. He hired one assistant worker who receives monthly salary of 100,000 MNT.For the future, he hopes to have hhis own restaurant. Munhbat is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of beef for his cafe.
