loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of beef

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha U. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Juditha is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Juditha owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers like pork adobo, caldereta, afritada, isdang paksiw & stewed fish in the local community. Juditha has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juditha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juditha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Juditha is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients to provide meals. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Juditha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to provide meals

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
"Remedios M. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Mantija, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a used clothing business.  Remedios joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Remedios has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000.00, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000.00 which she intends to use to buy more supplies of used clothes to sell so that she could continue to save up for future savings and expansion of her business. Remedios is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.”

loans.use: purchase more supplies of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 2. She and her husband are both farmers. They help each other keep their rice farm productive. Genevive also manages their sari-sari (variety) store. She sells soft drinks, cookies, and other products. Genevive does her part to support her family. She hopes to improve their house, too.

Genevive joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Genevive has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Genevive is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice, age 40, sells maize grains to earn a living. She is a widow with four children, all of whom go to school. Joice is requesting this loan to stock more maize grains to offer for sale. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits she expects to be gained from this loan.

loans.use: to stock more maize grains to offer for sale

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is divorced. She has two grown children: a son, Leonid, and a daughter, Victoria. 

She is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. Tina sells menswear in the central marketplace of her home town. Her son is actively helping her run the clothing venture. She always tries to keep up with fashion trends and re-stocks her inventory on a regular basis. Tina has been in the trade for ten years. Her monthly net profit amounts to about 7,000 UAH. 

Tina can be characterized as a loyal and consistent partner and a reliable borrower. This time, Tina is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase spring jackets. Tina is hoping to continue expanding her business and providing for her family. Tina’s business goal is to start a second location by the fall of this year.

loans.use: to purchase spring jackets

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very supportive lady. Her husband’s name is Q. M. and he operates a grocery shop in the community market. Through his shop, he sells daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar, spices etc. He is very good in his dealings with the clients and offers them different grocery items at very reasonable rates. He has another business of construction supplies which also earns him a reasonable income and helps him in the expenses of running his home. 

Nasreen is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household works. She is the mother of 5 children: four of the children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to expand his grocery business. Through the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk that will help him in earning better profits. He is new in his business. He started it only two years ago. 

Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to grow his business further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proven herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 
She is a resident of Mian channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 14 years.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is from the village of Ninoy Aquino, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old and married, with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn makes and sells chicken and pork barbecue. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as meat and spices. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as meat and spices

loans.name: Verónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

Aquí conocimos a Verónica, tiene 29 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella es una mujer muy preparada que con mucho esfuerzo logro terminar su carrera universitaria, es Ing. Comercial y pone en práctica lo aprendido en su negocio. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por  5 años y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda en los negocios tanto para ella como para sus compañeras.

Ella se dedica al comercio, compra y venta de adornos y cerámicas, tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta que  lo que más vende son los centros de mesa y adornos para el hogar.  Lleva 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien, ya que con su trabajo pudo terminar sus estudios. Sus productos los compra a artesanos de la zona, ya que estos son ellos mejores de toda la provincia.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un negocio en otra ciudad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Para el Futuro de la Mujer (For The Future of Women) communal bank meets in La Pila in the canton of Montecristi.  This place is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture, and as a place where a wide variety of handcrafts, made by its inhabitants following traditional customs, can be found.

Here we meet Verónica, 29 years old.  She is single and lives in her parents' house.  She is a very well-prepared woman who with great effort succeeded in finishing college.  She has a business degree, and in her business she puts in practice what she learned.  She has been in the communal bank for 5 years, and she likes it because the loans are of great help both to her business and to those of her fellow members.

She buys and sells decorations and ceramics.  She has a shop in her house in which she sells all kinds of handcrafts.  She works every day from 8am to 5pm.  She tells us that her best sellers are table centerpieces and decorations for the home.  She has been doing this work for 6 years, and it has gone very well for her, since with her work, she could finish her studies.  She buys her products from local artisans, since they are the best in the whole province.  

This loan is for the purchase of more handcrafts of all kinds to supply her business.

Her dream is to have a business in another city.

loans.use: to purchase handcrafts such as table centerpieces, decorations for the home, etc.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rachel works hard to support her family. She has a perfumes and cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling soft-drinks. Rachel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy perfumes, lotions and soft-drinks to sell to customers.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotion and soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jose Ermis

texts.es:
José se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, es soltero vive con sus padres, él aprendió el trabajo  agrícola por su padre, lo realiza desde hace 10 años, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y frijol y a si obtener mejores resultados, dándole un cuido adecuado.
Su aspiración es ayudarle a sus padres en los gastos  de la casa y obtener la cosecha para poder vender una parte.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He is single and lives with his parents.  He learned how to farm from his father and has been in the business for ten years.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

José is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers to grow his corn and bean crops and obtain better results by caring for his crops properly.

José's aspiration is to help his parents with their household expenses and to have a good harvest and be able to sell part of it.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela, de 23 años, es una joven muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. La vida de Pamela no fue muy sencilla, desde muy pequeña siempre se preocupo por ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Actualmente ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, siendo ofrecidas de forma ambulante, y adquiere la cantidad de prendas de  acuerdo a los pedidos que le hagan sus clientes. Entre las prendas que ofrece están las casacas, chompas, pantalones, polos entre otros accesorios novedosos.  Lleva 2 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, ahora anhela aumentar su stock y tener más prendas de vestir para vender, lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, aun así esta dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Asimismo cumplirá con sus cuotas, como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene.
texts.en:
Pamela is 23 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home.  What she wants more than anything is to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.

Pamela's life wasn't very straightforward.  She has always been concerned, since she was very young, about helping with the household expenses.  She currently has a business selling clothes as an itinerant street vendor.  She acquires a certain quantity of clothes in accordance with the orders that her customers make with her.  Among the garments she offers are jackets, sweaters, pants, tops and other new accessories.  She has been in this business for two years and what she most enjoys is chatting to her customers.  She would now like to increase her stock and have more items of clothes to sell.  What Pamela least enjoys about her work is having to walk all day long in search of customers.  However, she is prepared to make sacrifices in order to achieve her goals.

This will be Pamela's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to be receive your support.  She will make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  Pamela is a very well-liked and well-respected member of her community bank.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes to increase the quantity of merchandise she has available.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Margarita Consuelo

texts.es:
Margarita de 56 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es maestro albañil y tienen hijos. Se dedica la venta de comida y productos de bellezas.

Empezó hace un tiempo atrás porque le gusta el comercio antes no tenia trabajo estable que decidió vende almuerzos por su sector y a la vez vende productos de bellezas comesticos. Labora diariamente en las mañana preparando los almuerzos y en las tarde se dedica a promocionar sus productos. Con la ayuda del prestamo0 quiere comprar materiales para su negocio y productos Yanbal para su respectivas ventas. En un futuro quieres poner un restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
56-year old Margarita liveslives in an urban area in the Orquídeas section of Guayaquil. (Las Orquídeas means "The Orchids", so called because it originally had many orchid flowers). Her husband is a master bricklayer. They have children. Margarita sells food and beauty products.

She started her business some time ago because she enjoys selling. Before that she didn’t have a regular job. She decided to sell lunches in her neighbourhood and at the same time beauty products and cosmetics. 

Margarita works every morning preparing the lunches, and in the afternoons she sells the other items. With the loan money she wishes to buy more merchandise and Yanbal beauty products. In the future she would like to open a restaurant in her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume, lotions, cement blocks, and cement

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 44-year-old business lady and single mother of four children, ages 19, 17, 13 and 11 years old. She has been a tailor for the past 11 years with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings which she uses to meet her children’s needs.

Jemimah is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine and some materials to add to her stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and expand the business. Her hopes and dreams are to become a design maker, purchase a piece of land and build rental houses, which will help her improve the standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Alejandro Daniel

texts.es: El joven Alejandro, es una persona que trabaja en una maquiladora de nuestra localidad, tiene una ferretería en la vivienda de su mama, y el por las tardes y fines de semana la atiende, su distinguida esposa también trabaja en una maquiladora, para tener una mejor calidad de vida, ellos acaban de tener una bebe por lo que  están muy  contentos de que les diéramos la confianza y la oportunidad de poder servirle  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado por la  institución por  que de esta  manera  podrá  hacer  su sueño realidad  el cual  es hacer  crecer  su  negocio realizando   la  compra  de  mercancía.
texts.en: Alejandro is a young man who works in a cross-border assembly plant in our town.  He also has a hardware store in his mom's home and he works there in the afternoons and on weekends.  His wife also works in a cross-border assembly plant in order to provide them with a better quality of life.  They have just had a baby and so they are very happy that we have placed our trust in them and given them this opportunity.  They are grateful for the support our institution has given them to help them achieve their goal of growing their business by purchasing merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his hardware store

loans.name: Djèkafo  3 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de dix  membres, les femmes du groupe Djèkafo 3 de Sirakorobougou sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et habitent le village de Sirakorobougou dans la commune rurale de Tissala dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. Dans l’ensemble les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Dadi (Assise en 2ème position à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un sac d’urée, 25 kg de semences d’arachide, un litre d’herbicide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de sarclage et de récolte dans ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Tissala. Le sarclage et la récolte sont l’œuvre des hommes du village. Elle compte récolter sur une superficie de 2 hectares: 5 sacs de mil, 20 sacs d’arachide, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. La moitié de toutes ces spéculations cultivées est destinée à la vente et le reste à la consommation familiale. Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer et à l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of group Djèkafo 3, which is composed of ten members, are in their majority married in large traditional families. They are on average 36 years old with three kids and live in the village of Sirakorobougou in the rural township of Tissala, Segou region (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their their husbands, neighbors and families.
In order to increase the size of their plots, they contacted Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first agricultural loan cycle. The group members are primarily going to grow groundnuts, millet and black-eyed peas.
Mrs. Dadi (sitting second from the left in the picture) intends to use her loan to buy one bag of urea fertilizer, 25 kilos groundnut seeds, one liter herbicide, and to recruit laborers to plow and weed in her fields. She gets her agricultural intrants from the fair in Tissala. Plowing and weeding is the work of the village's men. On her 5 acres of land, she counts on harvesting five bags of millet, twenty bags of groundnuts, two bags of black-eyed peas and their greens. Half of all the cultivated product is intended for sale, with the other half for family consumption. The profit is used to provide for the household's small expenses and for the children's support.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and to hire laborers.

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, este lugar es de clima frió, propicio para la agricultura y para la ganadería por sus grandes llanuras. Mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera, vive con un sobrino y su mamá, nuestra socia es el sustento de su casa la misma que es propiedad de su madre.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, periódicos y revistas, esta actividad realiza hace 25 años de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta que termine de vender su producto.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en el arreglo de sus mostradores y en la compra de billetes de lotería, periódicos y revistas.
 
Su meta es  tener un negocio en su casa como una tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Loma de La Cruz” (Hill of the Cross). She lives in the parish of Tarqui, where the climate is cold. This area is suitable for agriculture and raising livestock because of the large open plains. Most of the people work in the city and have been able to maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 57 years old, single, and lives with her nephew and her mother. She is the breadwinner in her household. The house in which she lives is owned by her mother.

María sells lottery tickets, newspapers, and magazines. She has been this business for 25 years and works Sunday to Sunday from 6am until she finishes selling her products.

María has been with the Communal Bank for seven years. This new loan will be invested in repairs of her display cabinets and the purchase of lottery tickets, newspapers, and magazines.

Her goal is to open a business in her home, such as a store.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets, newspapers, and magazines, and to repair some of her display cabinets.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, married to Margaret and blessed with three children. He has worked in the second-hand clothes business for the last three years. He makes a monthly profit of 24,500 KES.
This is Daniel's third loan. With the anticipated profit, he plans to open a boutique in Kitengela. In the near future, he would like to import clothes from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bai Aline

texts.fr: Avec 3 enfants à charge, Aline vit en location dans une banlieue à l'Ouest de Cotonou. Elle est couturière de formation, à cette activité elle a associé la vente de pagnes et des habits qu'elle confectionne pour mettre en vente afin de mieux faire face à sa part des charges du ménage. Avec la bonne situation géographique de son de son atelier et la finesse de sa couture, elle arrive à fidéliser et à drainer de nouveaux clients. Son 1er crédit soldé, Aline obtient un renouvellement afin de approvisionner en matériels nécessaires à la confection des boubou brodés qu'elle vend. Grâce à ce prêt et au revenu complémentaire qu’elle en tirera, elle pourra améliorer le confort de sa famille.
texts.en:
Raising three children, Aline lives in a suburban location west of Cotonou. She is a trained seamstress and she also sells African print cloth and garments that she sews up for sale so that she can do her share in supporting the household. 

With the good geographic location of her workshop and the quality of her sewing, she manages to attract new customers and make them into repeat clients. Aline has repaid her first loan and is now receiving another so that she can buy the necessary materials to make the embroidered "boubous" (loose West African dress worn by men and women) that she sells. Thanks to this loan, and the added income she will garner from it, she will be able to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy 30 lengths of African print cloth and 10 cartons of embroidery thread.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Moses has been working hard to manage his general store, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food to sell in his shop and will help Moses to generate greater profits and provide for his family. Moses hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a very big business. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in his shop,

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old and is married with six children, between the ages of 8 and 28.  Marie owns a business selling second hand clothing. This is her seventh successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day except on Saturday. 

Marie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to improve her second hand clothing business. This loan will allow her to purchase a variety of clothes for resale. With any profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business, as well as for her family.  She hopes to buy a house in future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 45, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a widow and mother of five children; three are studying, and the eldest is working while the youngest is still at home. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Elvira, who believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Elvira operates a food and barbeque stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals on evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands (food items) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvira dreams for her children to find a stable job after finishing college and also for her business to grow more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 47 años, es una mujer alegre y amable con deseos de superación. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos en su casa que es propia. La actividad que realiza, consiste en la compra y venta de granos como el maíz , para lo cual se levanta muy temprano y se dirige a los campos de los mismos productores, en donde compra a precios más cómodo estos productos. Luego son almacenados en su casa, que posteriormente pasa por un proceso de molido para ofrecerlo al público. Tiene 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad, tiempo que le ha servido para ser conocida en el rubro. Lo que le gusta de éste trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le ha valido para pagar sus gastos, y mantener a su familia. Este sería el crédito número doce con MFP, comenta que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo de la institución, ya que en todo este tiempo que viene trabajando ha logrado crecer su negocio y quiere poder seguir contando con esta ayuda. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la ampliación de su local para poder almacenar mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en: Eva is 47 years old and is a very happy and kind person with wishes to get ahead in life. She lives with her partner and two children in her own home. She works selling and buying grains like corn, and gets up very early, goes to fields and buys her items at the best price. The grains are later stored in her home and are passed through the grind to be sold. Eva has worked in this field for 15 years and it has made her well known by her peers. What Eva enjoys about her work is being able to have an income that allows her to pay her expenses and support her family. This will be her twelfth loan with MFP and says that she is very grateful for the support given to her by the institution since she has been able to make her business grow and wants to continue to be able to count with their help. With the loan, she will expand her stand to store a greater quantity of products.

loans.use: expand her stand to have more space to store her grains.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn (in the photo) is hired to wash dishes during ceremonies, weddings and other occasions. Her husband, Chea is a chef and does fishing when he is free. They have been married since 1995 and have four children who are attending school. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thoeurn is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is engaged in agriculture. She cultivates potatos, corn, beens and keeps cattle. Karine lives together with her husband, who helps her with the business. Karine plans to increase the number of cattle and expand her farm. With the requested loan Karine plans to purchase calves and sheep. This loan will help Karine to make her dream come true and establish a big farm in the future. This will play an important role in the community's agricultural development.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Uini

texts.en:
Uini is 36 years of age, married, and has 4 children.  She owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand it.

In 2011, Uini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Uini's 1st loan with SPBD.



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en: Hamad who is 39 years old, is a father of four sons and one daughter. He is a worker with a decent salary. Hamad wants to complete finishing his house such as: installing tiles, installing windows and doors, painting etc. so he can live in healthy and comfortable house conditions. Hamad hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay. When Hamad gets the loan, he will be able to pay for all the expenses needed to finish his house. Taking this loan will enable Hamad to live with his family in better living conditions. Hamad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for finishing the house

loans.name: Marat

texts.ru: Марату 51 год, вдовец, воспитывает двух детей. Марат работает водителем в местной компании и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается  животноводством. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Марата, начатое с суммы 16,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодняшний день приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Марат обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. В планах Марата- вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – купить дом для старшего сына.
texts.en: Marat is a 51-year-old widower with two children.  He works as a driver in a local company.  Cattle breeding is an additional source of income for Marat and his family.  Marat's persistence and firmness helped him to expand his business, start-up costs for which totaled KGS 16,000. As of today, he gets KGS 10,000/month from the sale of meat and dairy products.  In order to further increase the cattle numbers, Marat sought help from Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan in the amount of KGS 130,000.  Marat will use the money from the loan to buy bull-calves for fattening and reselling.  He is planning to invest the income from the loan into the cattle raising.  In the future, Marat is also planning to buy a house for his eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth, 31, is married and resides with her mother, her husband, three children, and a sister in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, she and her husband are also involved in growing rice. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Puth is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, she would generate extra income for her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children in higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Diony De Jesus

texts.es:
Diony es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia un mayor bienestar y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Diony se encuentra casada y es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales se encuentran en su época de estudio. Diony, debido a que su esposo genera muy pocos ingresos con su trabajo de lavar carros, se vio en la obligación de contribuir económicamente para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Diony tiene una venta de comida y snack donde ofrece a sus clientes productos como fríjoles, arroz, lentejas, gaseosas entre otros, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Debido a que su negocio se encuentra en una invasión, Diony tiene su negocio terminado en tablas y cartón, y su piso es de tierra. Es por esto que Diony busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio para hacerlo más atractivo para sus clientes y poder aumentar su clientela. 
Diony espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, además de que de esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Diony sueña con tener un gran negocio que le permita sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles un estudio de calidad, además, en un futuro, ofrecerles el acceso a una educación universitaria.

loans.use: Realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio para hacerlo más atractivo para sus clientes y poder aumentar su clientela.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 41-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children through college. She has been running a bar business for the last four years after using her own savings. She faces hardships like customers not paying on time; however, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming. Rose needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jeninah

texts.en:
Jeninah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past eight years, she has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells cow peas, beans, and yellow bananas. 

To help expand her business, Jeninah has requested a loan of 3.000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more peas, beans, and other items for sale, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Jeninah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business more. 

Jeninah Deninah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jeninah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more peas, beans, and other items for sale

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a 52-year-old married woman from Ormoc City in the province of Leyte. She has a son aged fourteen years old.  Anecita operates a small grocery store locally known as “Sari-sari” store.  She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for six  years. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar. She will also use her loan to pay the maintenance and repair of her passenger jeepney that her husband drive for an income.  In the future, Anecita would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures and at the same time to provide quality education to her son.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is married with three children. He lives in Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He sells vegetables and fruits near his residence. He buys fresh produce of fruits and vegetables from nearby villages for resale at a small profit. The business has been his main source of livelihood for the past ten years. The business has not grown because he has to make a balance between business and family needs. The proposed loan will assist Leonard to expand his business by adding new products. The amount needed to expand his business is US$ 950. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his child who is expected to start secondary education. The business provides a source of employment for his wife too.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Geovanis

texts.en:
Geovanis sells sandals. She began her business by learning how to make sandals from her father, who is an artisan. At first, she only sold to family members. Now, she offers her product in neighboring provinces and to friends in the area. She will use the loan to invest in a variety of shoes and sandals for men and women. By buying in bulk, she will get a better price, and therefore earn a better profit. Geovanis believes her business will grow by offering a larger selection of styles to her clients.

Geovanis is 46 years old, married and has one daughter. She hopes that this loan will help her save to build a house and give her daughter a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Geovanis tiene ventas de sandalias. Geavanis empezó su negocio aprendiendo a elaborar las sandalias con las enseñanzas de su padre que es artesano. Al principio solo ofrecía su producto a familiares. Ahora ofrece su producto a provincias y amistades del sector. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de modelos de zapatos y sandalias tanto para damas como para caballeros a precio de mayorista y así que sus ingresos sean mayores. Geovanis tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con la variedad de modelos que ofrecerá a su clientela. Geovanis tiene 46 años es unida, tiene una hija. Ella tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darle una mejor educación a su hija.

loans.use: Invest in men and women's shoe apparel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean V. is 39 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband (picture here because because V. is unavailable) and a nephew in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells a variety of desserts near a primary school and typically makes on average $3/day, while her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and contributes financially his daily wage to the household every day. One of her children is a construction worker, two are students, and another one is too young to attend school. Yean V. is currently requesting a loan of $500 to purchase her nephew a motorcycle so that he can help increase her family's saving by operating a motor-taxi. In a future, if she saves enough money, she would like to own a stand at a market selling a variety of fruits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her nephew to operate a business.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu B. J. is forty-five years old, married with six children.  Amadu established his business with start-up capital borrowed from a friend with a high interest rate.  He could not realize the benefit as he was working to repay the high interest.  Amadu could send only two of his children to school.  With his previous loan from SMT, his business expanded and he was able to send two more of his children to school.  He is optimistic that he will educate all of his children if he gets more loan funds to expand his business.

loans.use: Expansion of grocery store stock

loans.name: Lavaniu

texts.en:
Lavaniu is a young, single mother from the village of Elise Fou. She runs her own small elei printing business that provides her with a source of income for her family.

This will be her third loan from SPBD, which will further assist her with her business as she needs the income to support her two children and to help with family commitments. Lavaniu supplies her products to a few outlets in town and also has a market stall at her village. She is grateful for the assistance from SPBD for bringing her thus far.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business and for her home improvement.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Mrs. Soam R., 28, lives with her husband and three young kids in Batambong province, Cambodia. To help with her family’s expenses, she works selling grocery products at her home, earning on average around $6/day. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, making about $3 per day. Mrs. Soam R. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to fulfill her client demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to fulfill her client demands.

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Ritah A. has a retail store. With a loan, Rita wants to buy a fridge, a weighing scale, and pay school fees for her children. Additionally, she wants to build her own store where she will also live. Finally, Rita raises chickens and wants to use some of the loan to put up another poultry house.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Kawaala Cb(B) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven monhts. Rehema sells charcoal for a living. With the extra business profits, she intends to increase on her stock and buy more sacks of charcoal. Joyce is a poultry farmer while Sharifah has a cosmetic shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Mrs. Irene belongs to The Pearls of Pucallpa Comunal Bank, located at 546 Saenz Pena Avenue, district of Calleria, state of Ucayali. Irene is 50 years old and is the mother of 4 children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of sodas. Nowadays, with a lot of strength in this endeavor, Irene has been able to start a store. Together with her children she tends to the store and her husband also helps when he has time. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay in 5 months, she will invest in products such as rice, sugar, milk, preservatives, etc, and in this manner she will be able to better supply her store. Irene is in the stage of her life that she feels most secure, she has been able to consolidate a business that is the economic sustenance of her family and working with Manuela Ramos is a great help to working women.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irene pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en la Av. Sáenz Peña N° 546, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Irene tiene 50 años y es madre de 4 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad, con mucho esfuerzo y empeño, Irene logra poner una bodega. Junto con sus hijos atiende la bodega y su esposo también la apoya cuando hay tiempo. Con préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, conservas, etc, y de esa manera poder surtir más su bodega. Irene está en una etapa de su vida que se siente más segura, logró consolidar un negocio que es sustento económico de su familia y manifiesta que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una ayuda mas para las mujeres trabajadoras.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (rice, sugar, milk, perservatives, etc.)

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonia Q. owns his own home in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Marcelina Quiroga.

Antonio Q. is a retired public administer, and his wife is a home-maker. With previous loans these two were able to complete a wall around their home.

The currently requested loan will be used to construct a retaining wall to support their property given that it is near a very steep road with a pronounced drop off. This will be the fourth time that Antonio and his wife have requested a loan. A socioeconomic analysis approves this loan. Antonio has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Antonio Q. vive en vivienda propia con su esposa, la señora Marcelina Quiroga en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Antonio es jubilado de la administración publica, en tanto que su esposa realiza labores de casa. Con anteriores créditos realizaron la construcción el muro perimetral de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención estructural que le dará estabilidad a su propiedad que se encuentra una calle que tiene mucha inclinación, o sea que tiene una pendiente muy pronunciada. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y pueden acceder a un nuevo crédito. Antonio es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Construction of a retaining wall due to the fact that they live on a very steep street.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is 44 years old, and she is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She sells smoked fish, canned tomatoes, plain rice, beans, and spices in her village.

Akssua is seeking a loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of beans, cartons of fish to smoke, and some spices to expand her business and to avoid the constantly rising prices of her products. In turn, she is hopeful that the loan proceeds will enable her to increase her sales and thereby allow her to generate sufficient income so that she may register for the National Health Insurance Scheme.

She is a member of the group called “Sunkwa” (meaning, "think of Life"). Group members agree in principle to guarantee each other as a form of social collateral to insure that they repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and to avoid increasing product prices by purchasing various food products (e.g., cartons of fish, bags of rice, bags of beans, etc.) in bulk

loans.name: Khayala

texts.en:
Khayala H. is single. She is a 26-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town who has settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. 
Khayala has raised sheep and has been in this business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $975 to buy 15 lambs to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 lambs

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: NawA. A. J. is 45 years old. She lives in a village close to the town of Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. NawA. takes care of her family, as her brother was killed in the war in July, 2006. NawA. owns a small jewelry and lingerie shop, and uses the income to support her family. She would like a loan of $300 to purchase additionA. items to expand her inventory and number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for retail.

loans.name: Martha Ofelia

texts.es:
Martha has 3 children who are 22, 15, and 9 years old respectively. They help in her business. She started her business because she didn't have another job and needed to be able to help her children succeed and give them schooling. She began 8 years ago with the sale of sodas and fries in her home; gradually, she added merchandise until she had a general store.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to continue with her sales and expand her business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha tiene 3 hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años, quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Inició su negocio porque en ese momento no contaba con un trabajo y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudio. Comenzó hace 8 años con la venta de sodas y frituras en su casa, y poco a poco fue surtiendo mercancia hasta que logro tener su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia para continuar con las ventas y poder agrandar su negocio

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years.  She has no children.  Her husband is a driver by profession with 8 years of experience.  Seema baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  She made an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) business from that loan.  Now she is applying for a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Najma baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  Salma baji wants a loan to buy materials (cooking oil, lentils, rice) for her food business.  Parveen baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell.  Niamat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Mark S. has taken out the loan to improve her business. She is a farmer in the Prey Melong Cheng Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. S. is 28 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is still too young. Her husband, Mr. Maing Pork, is a fisherman who can make $1.50 per day, which is too little income to support his family. (He is on the left in the photo.)

It is the rainy season now and Mrs. S. wants to cultivate rice on the plantation. Unfortunately, she cannot do this because she does not have enough animals to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow to add to the old one and use them as draft animals. She would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizers to support her rice field later.

loans.use: To buy another cow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: Doña Zoila tiene 45 años de edad,  habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Venezuela, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene que luchar diariamente para poder salir adelante con su familia. Ella tiene un kiosco que está ubicado en un colegio, en donde vende golosinas, comida, refrescos, gaseosas y otros productos. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de productos como gaseosas y materia prima para elaborar sus comidas ya que por la ubicación del kiosco tiene que estarlo abasteciendo con bastante frecuencia. Los planes futuros para su negocio es poder extender su atención a otros colegios cercanos a su vecindario. Pero la meta primordial de Ziola es poder contar con buena salud para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y sobre todo darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Zoila is 45 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Anexo Villa in Venezuela. She has 2 kids who are 15 and 18 years old, she is a single mother and has to fight each day to be able to move forward with her family. She has a kiosk in a high school where she sells sweets, food, soft drinks and fizzy drinks and other products. The loan she's asked for is to buy fizzy drinks and ingredients to make food as she has to stock the kiosk often because of its position. Her future plans for her business are to be able to extend her business to other high schools in the neighborhood. However Zoila's main aim is to count on good health so that she can help her kids to move on and most of all give them a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks and meat/Compra de gasesoas y carnes

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 39 años, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, Diana de 18, Maribel de 14 y Clara de 9. Es una trabajadora madre que desde hace 5 años, ha incursionado en el negocio de la artesanía para apoyar a los gastos del hogar. Faustina elabora los muy conocidos “deditos”, especie de pequeños títeres con figuras de animales elaborados a base de lana, que se colocan en los dedos, para venderlos a los turistas. Estos pequeños tejidos son muy solicitados por los turistas, haciendo que las ventas sean buenas, lo difícil es el tener que terminar grandes cantidades para su venta, pero la práctica ha hecho que Faustina elabore estos en menor tiempo, logrando así mejorar sus ingresos. Faustina se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará lana de diversos colores para realizar nuevos modelos de deditos.
texts.en:
Faustina is 39 years old, and lives with her partner and three children: Diana, 18 years old, Maribel, 14, and Clara, who is 9. She has been a working mother for five years, carrying out the business of handmade crafts in order to help with the household expenses. Faustina makes the well-known “deditos”, a type of small finger puppets that are usually in the form of an animal and made from a yarn base. These small knitted items are very much in demand by tourists, causing her sales to grow. What is difficult is being able to finish a large quantity of these items, but practice has helped her be able to knit them in less time making her earnings grow. Faustina is in her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very timely with her payments. With the funds requested, she will buy different colored yarns to make her new styles of deditos.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn of different colors.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim M., 37, is married and lives with her 3 children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has been earning income teaching children at a local school, making about US$3 per day, while her husband, a policeman, has been making about US$5 per day. The couple is also being supported by two of their children who work as car drivers for private companies.
Aside from being a teacher, Thim M. also makes income by selling gas and other necessities. At present, she needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to increase her business inventory and purchase more gas for sale.

loans.use: Increase of inventory and purchase of gas for sale

loans.name: Isabel Josefina

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Isabel es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Isabel vende medicina natural por catálogos, también cosméticos por catalogo, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Isabel es profesora del nivel primario.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Isabel son tener una tienda de medicina natural y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a partner of Inti Communal Banc ("Inti" means "sun" in Quechua, a language spoken before the Spanish conquest. Quechua survived only throughout the Andes, but recently Peru has begun to revive the language.). Isabel is forty-three years old and married. She has two children. Isabel sells cosmetics and natural medicine by catalog. She sells her products to friends and acquaintances, on credit. In addition to selling cosmetics and natural medicine, Isabel also teaches primary school. Isabel needs a loan of S/. 1,000 ($325) in order to purchase natural medicines. Isabel dreams of having a cosmetics and natural medicine store.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing natural medicines.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: Yanira tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, en casa de su madre. Ella es una madre trabajadora, que para darle un mejor futuro a su hijo vende cueros de oveja, negocio que aprendió de su madre, lleva ya 5 años en este trabajo, el cual le arroja buenos ingresos, y piensa seguir prosperando y haciendo crecer su negocio, tiene muchas dificultades adquiriendo los cueros, pero es feliz cuando puede ayudar económicamente a su familia y evitar que les falte algo en la casa. Estando ya, en su cuarto préstamo, Yanira espera que este dinero le ayude a progresar en su negocio y pueda así mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cueros y tendrá más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yanira is 29 years old, lives with her partner and small child, and runs her home. She is a hard-working mother who sells sheep leather, business which she learned from her mother. She's been working on this for 5 years. She hopes to continue the business and continue her good earnings..

She has a lot of difficulties acquiring the sheep leather but when she does she is happy because she can financially help her family. This way she is able to provide to her household. She is currently on her 4th loan.

Yanira hopes that this money helps her progress in her business and at the same time improve her family's life. With the requested loan she will purchase more leather, that way she'll have more merchandise to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of sheep leather

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a los tejidos desde hace 3 años, su decisión por tener un trabajo independiente fue lo que la impulsó a tener un negocio propio, antes trabajaba de manera dependiente como empleada doméstica y la dueña de la casa donde trabajaba le enseñó a tejer todos los puntos, fue un aprendizaje que hoy le sirve para producir en grandes cantidades chalinas y gorros, así como bolsos y carteras. Cada 2 semanas termina de tejer lo que va a vender y luego viaja a los asientos mineros para comercializar sus prendas, a parte de ello también se dedica a la venta de animales los fines de semana, por esto guarda sus animales en casa de sus suegros. Marlene quiere superarse y está pensando en abrir una tienda grande donde pueda comercializar todo tipo de productos entre ellos sus tejidos y a la vez ofrecer el servicio de locutorio porque ha notado que en la zona donde vive  existe esa necesidad. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, además le gusta trabajar en el banco comunal que actualmente integra porque aprendió a ahorrar y a trabajar en equipo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de lana en grandes cantidades para abastecerse y aumentar su producción ya que por estas épocas del año las ventas tienden a mejorar. El precio de una bolsa grande esta valorizada entre 20 y 40 soles dependiendo de la calidad, comprara todo lo que le alcance el dinero.
texts.en:
Marlene is 34, lives with her husband and three children in a rental home. She has done knitting work for three years, her decision to work independently is what pushed her to start her own business; she used to work as a domestic employee where the owner of the house taught her to knit all the types of stitches, it was a learning experience that now allows her to produce in great quantities shawls, caps, as well as bags and wallets. Every two weeks she finishes knitting what she is going to sell and then travels to mining areas to sell her pieces, she also sells animals on weekends, which are kept at her in-law’s house. Marlene wants to get ahead and is thinking of opening a big store where she can sell all sorts of products including her knitting pieces and at the same time offer phone calls service because she has noted in the area where she lives there is a need for this service. This is the second time that she gets a loan through MFP; she also likes to work with the community bank that she is currently part off because she learned to save money and work with a team. The money requested is to be invested in the purchase of large quantities of wool to have supplies and boost production because during this time of year sales tend to increase. The price of a large bag is estimated between 20 and 40 soles depending on the quality, she will buy as much as she can with the money.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi (toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Gongebougou un des villages de la sous préfecture de Loulouni, cercle de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).

Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de couscous , de beurre de karité et de noix de karité. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe,  tous les précédents ont été  correctement remboursés. 

Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 4 sacs de 100 kg de sorgho pour en faire du couscous afin de le revendre et 2 sacs de 100 kg de noix de karité pour les revendre ou en faire du beurre de karité pour le revendre. Elles   s’approvisionnent à Gongebougou et  dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Dallen, Nimbougou et Loulouni les jours de foire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes  au comptant en détail et à crédit.

Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent être grossistes et avoir une charrette et un âne pour leur déplacement dans les différents marchés qu’elles fréquentent.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi group (all married) have an average age of 52 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional families in Gongebougou, one of the villages of the Sous-prefecture of Loulouni, Kadiolo circle, third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They have various businesses, among others selling couscous, karité (shea) butter and karité nuts. They have worked with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years now and are on their fourth group loan, all preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy 4 sacks of 100 kg of sorghum to use to make couscous which they will then sell, and 2 sacks of 100 kg of karité nuts to sell or to use in making karité (shea) butter to sell. They do their buying in Gongebougou and surrounding areas. The merchandise is sold at the market in Dallen, Nimbougou and Loulouni on market fair days to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or on credit.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 10,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and another part will be reinvested in their businesses. Their ambition is to be wholesalers and to have a donkey and cart to use as transport when going to the various markets where they sell their wares.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of karité nuts and cereals (sorghum for couscous)

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдучалил подал заявку на следующий кредит, для увеличения скота. Сейчас у него шесть коров и , которые дают жирное молоко. Его жена доит и продаёт в своём посёлке.
Абдучалил сам классный электрик, поэтому он без проблем погашает свои кредиты. На деньги  следующего, займа он хочет закупить больше корма для коров, а также и две коровы. Он благодарен KIVA за финансирование.
texts.en:
Abdujalil requested his next loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. Currently, he owns six dairy cows that supply rich milk. His wife milks the cows and sells the milk in their village. Abdujalil is an excellent electrician, and this is why he has no problems repaying his loans. With the money from this loan, he wants to purchase two additional cows and more feed for the cows. He is grateful to Kiva for the financing opportunities.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Y. Azamat is a 26 year old, is married and has a child. Azamat owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by it.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase his stock. Azamat is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Susana tiene 44 años tres hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Susana empezó hace diecisiete años atrás con una carreta salía a ofrecer a los vecinos de San Jun a sus servicios de  confección de cortinas por un año, después alquilo en el mercado un puesto  de confecciones de cortinas, es allí donde entra a Finca, actualmente tiene una tienda de confección de cortinas, forros para muebles.  
Susana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de telas para cortinas, rieles, alfombra. 
Desde que está en Finca empezó un nuevo negocio compro motos-taxi, para dar servicio, aprendió la perseverancia en los negocios, para llegar a su meta. 
El sueño de Susana poder dedicarse a dirigir su negocio administrándolo, y tener personal a su cargo.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the communal bank "Fuerza y Poder." She is 44 years old and has 3 children who are 15, 10, and 6 years old. They all study in the state school. Seventeen years ago, Susana began selling curtains to her neighbors in San Jun by cart. She did this for a year and then rented a place in the market where she could sell her curtains. It is there that she got involved with Finca. Nowadays she has a shop where she sells curtains and furniture covers. Susana needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase material for curtains, rails, and carpets. Since she has been with Finca, she has started up a new business of buying motorcycles that are used as taxis. She has learned to persevere in business and reach her goals. Susana’s dream is to be able to spend her time directing and managing her business and having employees.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Susana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de telas para cortinas, rieles, alfombra.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz - Group 2

texts.en:
Rosa Y. is the group leader of these five entrepreneurs. She has four children, ages 5, 9, 10, and 17. Despite the fact that Rosa did not complete elementary school, her business skills are remarkable. She maintains three trades: vending fried food, selling clothing, and running her small "colmado" (convenience store).

Rosa will use her loan to buy the most commonly needed products for her store: rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, herbs, and spices. Most people in her community buy small amounts of provisions daily because they do not have refrigerators to store food: in other words, they buy whatever they will cook the same day. Rosa wants to continue to cater to her current demand as well as to draw new customers to her store.

Rosa, as a smart businesswoman, thinks big. In the future, she'd like to own her own warehouse, and be a supplier to small stores like the one she runs today. She thinks this will allow her to provide much better for her family and to extend her business to other communities.

On behalf of this group of entrepreneurs, thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: To purchase saleable merchandise

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ерова Ибодат в возрасте 42 года, проживает в районе Гиссара. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Сама клиентка  имеет свою столовую на центральном рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 7 лет. Ей также в этом помогают ее дети. Ибодат просит кредит, чтобы закупить продукты питания для столовой.
texts.en:
Ibodat E. is 42 years, married and has 3 children. She lives in the Gissar district. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Our client owns a café at the central market. She has been involved in this business for over 7 years. Her children also help her with the business. Ibodat is requesting this loan in order to purchase food products for the café.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric K. is thirty-one years old. He is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Eric is a trader and works to be able to provide for his family. He trades in linoleum and woolen carpet, selling his goods at the market square. He has been in business for over six years and wants a loan to expand his business. He aspires to sponsor all his children in school to the higher levels.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria P. lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old, married, and has 4 adult-aged children. Victoria has made a living from farming for over 39 years. The main source of income comes from the harvest of her rice fields. Victoria sells to local community members and earns approximately 7,000.

In 2007, Victoria joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 which she used to purchase fertilizer for her rice fields. 

Victoria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 which she will use to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and to pay the labor for planting rice. This loan will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is fifty-three years old and married to Agustin B., who works as farmer. Their family lives happily in the rural community of Parabba Peńablanca, Cagayan. They are blessed with seven children, six of whom are married and the last is attending college in Manila. Josefa said that her family’s current situation is happy, even though they are not all living together. 

Josefa wants to borrow PHP25,000 from Kiva lenders to improve and develop her general store business. She believes that she and her husband need to work hard and patiently endure every challenge that may occur so they will able to give their youngest child their full support. Aside from that they are really striving to make a better life for themselves.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
