Elvie is 35 years old. She is married to Dominador and they are blessed with three children. She has a hog raising business and this is her way of helping her husband in providing for the needs of their family. They are living in the small village at Sitio Anguapan, Tumauini, Isabela. Elvie hopes to continue sending all their three children to school until they finish college. 

She wants to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000.00. She will use the loan to purchase feed for the growth of her hogs.  She is also planning to venture into fresh meat vending. She used to sell pork meat in kilos in their village. Sometimes, Elvie sold the product on a cash basis but most of the time, her customers would pay after a week. She is hoping for her dreams to come true to be able to support also the needs of her three children who are currently studying hard, aiming to uplift their standard of living someday.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Roida is a member of the Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18,15 and 10 years old.

Roida has owned a vegetable business fro 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Roida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to pay school fees, get more food for family and expand her business.

Anastanzia is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her fruits business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda T. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 49 years old. Daylinda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Daylinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Daylinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Daylinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth B. is from the village of Lodiong Tambulig,Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Ruth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store selling daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and save as a reserve for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née le 01 Juin 1959 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à ZINLOZIN Blaise, un transformateur de sodabi (boisson alcoolisée locale) et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Emilienne vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Porto-Novo. Emilienne supporte ensemble avec son mari les charges de la famille. Emilienne a arrêté les classes au cours primaire, et depuis une quinzaine d'année, elle vend de l'igname frit et des beignets de haricot à la devanture de sa maison. Emilienne achète ses produits au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Emilienne sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Emilienne A. was born on June 1, 1959 in Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Emilienne is married to Blaise Zinlozin, a sodabi brewer (a popular alcoholic drink). She is the mother of four children, all are attending school. Emilienne has lived in Porto-Novo for the past twenty years. Emilienne, together with her husband, supports the family. Emilienne stopped attending school in the primary grades, and for the past fifteen years she has been selling fried sweet potatoes and bean donuts in front of her home. Emilienne purchases her products in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She is long-time member of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she has already benefited from two past loans, which have been repaid. Emilienne requests a third loan from Alide to increase her capital funds and to meet the clients’ demands.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and sweet potatoes, drums of cooking oil and a load of wood.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio M. L. reside en Tecoluca en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Manuel de 45 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, de 23, 20, 16 y 10 años de edad. Manuel se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, negocio que hace desde su casa con quince años de experiencia, el no solo vende los granos básicos sino también los cosecha, es por eso que sus clientes son fieles, ya que reconocen de la buena calidad de arroz y frijoles que don Manuel saca de sus cultivos, el solicita de un crédito para poder comprar mayor cantidad de semillas, abono y fertilizantes;  y así poder logar una cosecha mas grande la siguiente temporada.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio M. L. lives in Lecoluca in the Department of Ahuachapán. Manual is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and their four children, who are 23, 20, 16, and 10 years old. Manual works selling basic grains, a business that he does from his home with 15 years of experience. He doesn’t only sell grains, but he also harvests them, and this is why his clients are loyal, since they recognize the good quality of the rice and beans that Don Manuel gets from his farm. He is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy a larger quantity of seeds and fertilizers; and in this way he will be able to get a bigger harvest next season.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for Manuel's farm

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is 42 years old and married with 3 children. His wife sells medicines in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He is a commercial motorcyclist. He has been in this business for a year.  He hopes to own a transport company in the future.  He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase one motorcycle. He works long hours to ensure that he is able to meet the basic needs of his family. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa T. is from the village of Primicias, Mapandan, Pangasinan. She is 44 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Elisa owns and operates a business running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Elisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zadran Group

texts.en:
This is the Zadran group, which is made up of five members. They have requested a group loan of 70,000 Afghani. Shah Peki is the group leader.

Shah Peki, Ashat Ropia and Naz Bar all would like to use the loan for their tailoring business. These three members have a tailoring business where they sew Afghani national clothes in a nice way. They are all happy about their business and with the loan they would like to purchase new electric sewing machines which will help them work in a better way.

Qand Agha would like to take out a loan for his cart in which he sells second-hand clothes for children, and Bashir A. wants to take out a loan for the business of selling clothes in his shop. They all would like to expand their businesses and solve their problems as well. They all thank the Kiva lender a lot.

loans.use: Purchasing needed materials

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La señora Inés tiene 47 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería y venta de cosméticos, el cual ha vendido durante dieciocho años, casada y con tres hijos que procreo dos estudian y uno trabaja,  ella trabajaba en una empresa de Nicalit y con su liquidación fue que puso la pequeña venta. En estos meses las ventas han sido baja por eso desea aumentar la variedad de productos como: carne, pollo, lácteos, gaseosas, verdura, frutas y cosméticos. Para poder elevar las ventas y poder atraer la clientela con el objetivo de poder ver mejores ganancias. A futuro desea remodelar su casa ya que le falta poner el piso ya que aun es de tierra y no le ha alcanzado para hacer las mejoras.  Este es su onceavo crédito y esta sastifecha por que ha logrado, mantener su pequeño negocio. También desea apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan lograr terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Inés is 47 years old and has a small local store. Also, she sells cosmetics, which she has done for 18 years. She is married with three children, two of whom study and one who works. She used to work for a company called Nicalit, but after she was let go, she set up her business. In recent months, her sales have lowered. Therefore, she wishes to increase her variety of products, such as: beef, chicken, dairy products, soda, vegetables, fruits, and cosmetics. In this way she will be able to attract a greater clientele and elevate her sales and earnings. In the future, she hopes to remodel her house, since it has an earthen floor, and she has not been able to afford the improvements. This is her eleventh credit, and she is satisfied because she has managed to maintain her small business. She also wishes to support her children, so that they can finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef, chicken, dairy products, soda, vegetables, and cosmetics to increase sales

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has children who go to school. She is 54 years old and married. The oldest among her nine children is now 36 years old and does not live at home anymore. Rosita has been involved in rice farming since the 1990s. She has maintained the farm because it provides income for her family. She is also a member of CEVI. Her first loans were used to fund her farm, and, according to her, this was really helpful as it helped her farm to be productive. She is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. As in the past, this loan will be used to purchase farm supplies lacking from Rosita's farm. She will be able to buy quality seeds and fertilizer with this amount.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito P. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 52 years old. Pedrito is married and has 3 school-aged children. Pedrito owns & operates a manufacturing business, making and selling Nipa (a type of palm) products to local businesses and community members. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pedrito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pedrito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sherwin's Group

texts.en:
Sherwin B. is from the village of La Suerte, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Sherwin is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sherwin is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Sherwin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens and ducks for sale. Sherwin is just starting this business.

In 2010, Sherwin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherwin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the first loan taken out by Sherwin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding poultry

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 32 years old. He has been running a welding business for six years. He also practices commercial farming together with his wife.  He was previously employed in a manufacturing company.  He hopes to expand his business and to improve his standard of living.  He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a welding machine and materials such as welding rods. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and welding rods

loans.name: Nuulu

texts.en:
B. Nuulu is a resident of the Gayaza zone of Baale. She is a businesswoman with five children, three of whom are in school. She operates a retail business where she sells such items as rice, soap, sugar, chicken feed, and animal feed. She has been in her business for over five years. 

B. Nuulu plans to use her loan to purchase more of these items for sale. She wants to boost her business by purchasing products in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase products in bulk for retail sale

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa C. is a 65-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store, cafeteria and fishing business. She lives in Barangay Catali, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband, Loreto, who is 69 years old and helps her in running her business.  They have 12 adult children who are between 22-44 years old and raising their own families.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, cafeteria and fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $480.

Adelfa is now borrowing 18,500 PHP so that she can expand her general store, cafeteria and fishing business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Adelfa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Kemishego Women Development, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
N. Ketty is a teacher and has been running her side-business for over fifteen years, selling produce like maize, sorghum, millet, beans and groundnuts (peanuts) as her additional source of income. Her business prospers due to the fact that maize flour, used to prepare food, is in high favor with many Ugandans.

In Nyamunuka, Ntungamo, this 40-year-old married mother of five children is referred to as an early riser, “rising with the lark”. She is a stickler for hard work and, as such, her children are all basking in the glow of her enterprising nature.

This business brings Ketty monthly profits of 300,000 Ugandan shillings. She is looking at a scenario where her business will expand with pomp. The only way she sees this materializing is when she gets a loan to buy more produce for her business.

loans.use: To purchasing more groceries to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Harriet is a tailor in Bwaise, one of the city suburbs. Harriet has been in this business for over 15 years. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials from Kiyembe, one of the busiest places in Kampala city where clothing materials are sold.  She uses public transport to and from shopping and goes shopping once a week. Besides this tailoring business, she also sells second hand clothes at the very shop where she does her tailoring.  Her customers are mainly women and school girls.  She works six days a week. She rents her business premises at 30,000/= per month.  Her business challenge included transportation of clothing materials from Kiyembe to her shop in Bwaise.  She aspires to own a plot of land.  Harriet joined MCDT because it was giving out timely loans with low interest rates.  Harriet resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she stays with seven people. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for both residence and business, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a fence and repair windows and doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Elena F., a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roger F., who works as security personnel, and is the mother of a high-school-aged child. By the grace of God, Elena has managed to support her child’s schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Elena, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Ma. Elena operates a variety store. She also rents out a few rooms for transients and students. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for buying one sachet of shampoo, one egg or 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil. Juanita earns by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling in piece rate. Elena’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of $4.50 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Elena dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy quantities of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 36 years old. Maria is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Maria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the second loan taken out by Maria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Lweza Integrated Group-Kampala

texts.en:
Sometimes you have to go out of your way to ensure you make profitable use of your time when running a business. Lots of sacrifices have to be made as any successful business person will testify. For the last 6 years, 34 year old married mother of 4, N. Sarah has done her utmost with many odds stacked against her, to secure her place in the competitive retail business genre in Lweza-Kampala.  Sarah used to be a farmer; she still is though she has now gotten more inclined towards retailing. She credits her husband with giving her the pep talk to begin this business. 

On a monthly basis, she makes 300,000 shillings. She envisages her profits increasing by making additional purchases of goods in high favor with most of her old and new customers. With this loan, Sarah says she wants to buy more bags of sugar, plastics, rice and soft drinks for her shop. She says she will make more profits for her business with this high volume of goods.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of sugar, plastics, rice and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a que una de las integrantes se informó del programa por una amiga que integra otro grupo y decidió invitar a sus vecinas y amigas a formar un nuevo comité.  De esta forma se inicia el comité Oñondivepa el cual se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformada por mujeres que inviertes en distintas actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan.
La señora Ramona C. es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como carnes,  panificados, carbón, carne, condimentos, harina, aceite, entre otros, para el incremento de su negocio.
Ella prepara diariamente los comestibles y sale ella o sus hijos para venderlos, recorren los lugares concurridos por la gente como plazas, mercados  o buces y así vender rápidamente todo lo que preparan.
De esta forma ella obtiene ingreso diariamente para su familia y se siente muy satisfecha con lo que ha obtenido hasta ahora.
texts.en:
This committee was created thanks to one of its members' finding out about the program from a friend who was part of another group and decided to invite her friends and neighbors to form a new committee. And so the Oñodivepa Committee was created, now in its ninth loan cycle with the Committee of Enterprising Women of Fundación Paraguaya. It's made up of women who invest in a variety of activities depending on their skills. One member, Ramona C., sells food products and has invested her money in supplies, including meats, baked goods, charcoal, seasonings, flour, oil, etc., to grow her business. Every day she prepares food, which either she or her children go out to sell. They frequent populated places like squares, markets, or bus stops, where they quickly sell their product. This is how Ramona gets her daily income for her family, and she feels very satisfied with what she has gotten thus far.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, meats, oil, seasonings, flour, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Abd Al Rahman

texts.en:
Abd A. Rahman is a 52-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and three children. Abd A. Rahman works in multiple jobs depending on the village’s needs. His major business is blacksmithing. He's still working at this trade, but to provide a good living for his family, he has had to search for more than one source of income. During the summer, he sells water in Chtoura and the neighboring villages because unfortunately Lebanon is always in need of water during this season. In the winter, Abd A. Rahman sells firewood to villagers so that they might stay warm.

Abd A. Rahman is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy tools necessary to his work. He hopes to expand and develop his work in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools necessary to his work

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a single mother with one child and takes care of three more dependents. She is 42 years old and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Margret operates a computer training center and a driving school and has been in these business activities for the last three years. Having started with a lot of difficulties, she says she is now doing well with no major hardships. She says she hopes to see her business grow to greater heights.

Margret intends to use the loan to purchase computers for her computer learning center.

loans.use: To purchasing computers for her computer learning center

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma G., a married woman who lives in Purok 6, Daan Lungsod, Toledo City, Cebu, earns her living by operating three enterprises: a general store, a frozen products retail operation, and an electronic reloading business. Her husband, Jose G., 60, works as a Winsman Operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children ranging in age from 22 to 37 years old.

Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Thelma G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: K. Aminatou est née le 11 Octobre 1957 et est mariée à MOUNIROU Wabi. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Aminatou vit au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs onze ans. Aminatou vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les diverses charges de la famille. Aminatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs huit ans que Aminatou mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, riz, sucre, conserves de tomate et de sardine, huile végétale, lait, piles, mayonnaise, papier hygiénique, etc.) dans sa boutique. Aminatou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Dans le but d’agrandir un peu plus son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, Aminatou sollicite pour la cinquième fois un appui financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Aminatou was born on October 11, 1957 and is married to Mr. MOUNIROU Wabi.  The couple have four children, who have all been to school.  Aminatou has been living in the Minontchou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about eleven years.  She helps out her husband by working with him to cover the various family expenses.  

Aminatou never attended school. For about eight years, she has been running a business selling various goods (pasta, couscous, rice, sugar, canned tomatoes and sardines, vegetable oil, milk, batteries, mayonnaise, toilet paper, etc.) in her shop.  She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

She is a previous ALIDé client who does a good job repaying her loans.  With the goal of expanding her business a bit and increasing her sales, Aminatou is applying for ALIDé financial support for the fifth time.

loans.use: Buying canned foods, soaps, boxes of sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, estado civil casada, con cinco hijos y  grado de instrucción tercero de secundaria.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que pudo utilizar en la compra y venta de animales menores, ahora no solo se dedica al negocio mencionado sino también a la venta de cereales en las diferentes ferias de Ilave. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de cereales.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio y verlos profesionales a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Brisas de Río Blanco communal bank, located in the Pilcuyo district within the El Collao province and the department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married, has five children, and completed up through the third year of high school.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past seven years. The first loan that she requested was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she used for the purchase and sale of young animals. Now, she not only works in this business, but also in selling cereals in the different markets of Ilave.

She is currently requesting a new loan of 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) which will allow her to increase the capital for her cereal sales business.

Her dream is to continue with her business and to see her children as professionals. What she likes about the communal bank is working in a group.

loans.use: To increase the capital for her cereal sales business.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa, se dedica a la venta D. plantas ornamentales y frutales, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con su esposo y un nieto, la casa donD. viven es propia, aprendió este negocio por que en su familia ha sido esta la actividad que han realizado, ella ubica el negocio en el parqueo municipal D. San Miguel, actualmente está con la dificultad que necesita compra plantas, canastas y cestas pero no cuenta con los fondos, y solicita un préstamo para salir D. esta situación.
Su propósito es tener bien surtido el negocio, para que los clientes que la visiten puedan tener opciones para comprarle, además que su negocio sea estable y le genere las ganancias necesarias para pagar las deudas.
texts.en:
María Rosa earns her living selling ornamental plants and fruit trees.  She lives with her husband and one grandson in their own house in San Miguel.  She learned the business because it's what her family did.  The business is located in the San Miguel municipal park.  It's difficult for her now because she needs to buy plants and baskets but she doesn't have the money, so she is seeking a loan to mitigate the situation.

María Rosa's intent is to have a well-stocked business so clients have options for what to buy.  She also wants a stable business with sufficient profits to pay the bills.

loans.use: To buy plants and baskets.

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Rosa blanca", esta ubicado en el municipio de las vigas guerrero, decidieron ponerle este nombre por que dicen los integrantes, que para ellas las rosas blancas significan paz y armonía, es por eso que optaron por este nombre, la historia es acerca de la señora Silvia C. G., ya que es la presidenta del grupo ella tiene 21 años, esta casada con el señor Enrique, tienen 2 hijos, Luis y Antonio de 6 y 4 años de edad, los dos están estudiando el mas pequeño el segundo año de preescolar y el otro el primer año de primaria, ella tiene una dulcería y también vende refrescos.

Silvia decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que un familiar le comento que era una muy buena fuente de ingresos, también por que esto le ayudaría para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, al igual que para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella invirtirá su préstamo en la compra de mas mercancía como son: paletas, chicles, frituras (chicharrones y palomitas), refrescos, jugos y aguas, para tener un poco mas surtida su tienda. 

Ella esta muy contenta por que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes, y por lo mismo sus ingresos también han incrementado satisfactoriamente, tanto que hasta se compro una plancha.

La meta que tiene doña Silvia es la de continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas el lugar en donde tiene su tienda para así tener mas variedad de productos, y mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen de hace algún tiempo y son muy responsables con sus pagos, ya que no quieren defraudar la confianza y apoyo que le están brindando.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia al igual que continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno de los integrantes del grupo rosa blanca.
Humbelina R. G.-dulcería
Agraciana G.
texts.en:
This group is called “Rosa Blanca” (White Rose) located in Las Vigas, Guerrero.  They named it thus because the members say that white roses represent peace and harmony for them and that’s why they chose that name.  The story is about Mrs. Silvia C. G. who is the group President. She is 21 years old and married to Enrique.  They have two sons, Luis and Antonio, who are 6 and 4 years of age.  Both are in school, the youngest in second year of preschool and the oldest in first grade.  She has a candy store and also sells beverages.

Silvia decided to start this business because a family member commented that it was a good source of income and also because it would help her help her husband meet household expenses and to pay for the education of their children.  It would also help improve the family’s quality of life.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like: popsicles, chewing gum, snacks (chicharrones and popcorn), soft drinks, juices and water in order to have the store a little better stocked.

She is very happy because she says she’s been doing very well with her store; her sales have increased as well as her customer base which has led to her income also rising satisfactorily, so much so that she bought herself an iron.

Silvia’s goal is to continue supporting her children with their schooling so that they will complete a professional career and thus have a better future. She also wants her small business to grow because she wants to expand the space where she has the store in order to have a wider variety of products and increase and improve her profits.

She comments that she works very well in her group because all the members have known each other for a long time and are very responsible with their payments because they don’t want to disappoint those who have trusted them and helped them.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva lenders for the unconditional help they are giving because thanks to it her quality of life and that of her family has improved as well as she’s been able to continue investing in her business.

These are the names and activities of each of the members of Rosa Blanca:

Humbelina R. G.-candy store

Agraciana G.

loans.use: To buy more beverages, water and juice.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She has a grown son who is married. Her son and daughter-in-law live with her. Valentina is a tomato farmer with five big greenhouses. Last year she planted 15,000 short-growing tomatoes. Valentina is a veteran in the sphere of agriculture – she has been working in farming and gardening for about 32 years. She has already invested 70,000 Grivnyas in her business. 

Valentina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouses. Valentina is planning to plant 10,000 tall-growing tomatoes this farming season. These tomatoes grow and produce fruit for a long time until the frost comes in the fall. One of her further plans is to continue expanding and construct another greenhouse for tomatoes in the future.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-age children. He helps his wife with the family's income. His wife works as a babysitter. He has worked as a freelance wall foliage specialist for 30 years. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he has been a reliable Ameen borrower with consistent, on-time repayments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and renew his tools. He is very positive about his future and willing to take on multiple construction projects.

loans.use: To improve his business and renew his tools

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Каландаров Зафар житель района Хамадони. Ему 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Уже год как занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания и стройматериалы. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Zafar K., 45, lives with his wife and four children in Hamadoni. Zafar has secondary education and works in sales. He owns a store where he sells food and construction materials. Zafar is applying for a loan to increase turnover.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Senzakahle Group

texts.en:
Ntombi is 32 years old and single with three children, between the ages of two and eleven years. She also takes care of one relative. She runs a retail business selling paraffin, candles and chips in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.  She has been running this business for one year and faces the challenge of customers who buy on credit and do not pay. 

She has requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase clothes, chips, sweets and airtime to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to school and make a profit. In the future she sees her business growing in such a way that she will open a "spazza" shop. ("Spazza" shops are small corner stores where you can buy food, drink, and other basics.) 

Ntombi is pictured in the middle and is wearing bright pink.

loans.use: To buy clothes, chips, airtime, sweets.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with two children, who are both still young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamkasi has operated a business selling firewood for the past two years, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She earns additional income by selling coconuts and fried fish. Mwanamkasi faces the major challenge of competition from other firewood sellers in the market. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Mwanamkasi plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase a bundle of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation within society.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of firewood

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie D. O. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is currently in the business of selling items like small fish. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, with 5 children three of whom go to school. Emelia borrowed a loan to stock more small items like small fish to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more small fish to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero sin hijos. Vive en casa familiar con su hermana y madre, en un humilde vecindario del distrito de Tumán en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida trabajando como obrero en una empresa donde cosecha y procesa caña de azúcar. Lleva un año en este empleo. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos y tambien comprar muebles para el hogar. Se proyecta a darle mayores comodidades a su casa. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Este préstamo permitirá que Santos trabaje más tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento familiar. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Santos is 39 years old and is single with no children.  He lives in his family's house with his sister and mother in a humble neighborhood in the Tuman district in the north of Peru.  He earns a living working in a business that harvests and processes sugar cane.  He has worked for one year in this business.  Currently, his home is in a somewhat deteriorated condition.  He would like to make some improvements to the home and buy some furniture.  He would like to make his home more comfortable.  In order to do so, he is requesting a $200 loan from Edpyme Alternative.  This loan will allow Santos to work more comfortably without having to go to informal lenders that would charge him very high rates.  Such lenders make it difficult for Santos to get ahead and improve life for his family.  He is grateful to the lenders from Kiva who are helping him improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home and buy furniture.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth L., 46, a resident of C. Jose Street, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ramon L., an employee, and is the mother of three children, two of whom are already working, while the other one is still in school. By the grace of God, Elizabeth has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the rest of her children all the way through college, which is a dream for most Filipino parents like Helen, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Elizabeth has managed her own beauty salon for quite some time now. She is an all-around beautician and runs a small beauty salon in the comfort of her home. Upon the request of customers, she also provides home service, doing manicures, pedicures, haircuts, hairdressing and make-up. She also sells cosmetics offered by direct-selling companies like Avon and Sara Lee. Monthly, Elizabeth earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 48,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more supplies and new equipment needed for her salon operation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elizabeth hopes that her business will continue to grow and she will be able to send her youngest child to college.  She prays for good health and to be able to enjoy a peaceful life with her family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and new equipment for salon

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
Doña Geronima R. P., es casada, tiene 45 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a oficios domésticos, como también cuenta con un negocio que le genera sus ingresos economicos para su sustento falimiliar, lleva 4 años años en el negocios D. criar animales en este caso cerdos y gallinas.

Con el fin D. aumentar capital D. negocio, deciD. organizar un gurupo D. señoras la cuales realizan diefrentes actividades productivas: crianza D. animales, venta D. mercería, y la elaboración D. canastas. El préstamos que solicitan lo utilizarán para comprar cerdos y gallinas ya que es la labor que realiza doña Geronima,  en el futuro esperan tener mas cerdos y mas gallinas, ya que esto hará que su producción genere mas ganancias y D. esta manera mejorar sus ganancias y la condició D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gerónima R. Pérez, 45, is married.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has five children one of whom is studying.  She is a housewife but also has a business that generates income for family support.  She’s been raising animals, pigs and chickens in this case, for four years.

In order to increase business capital she decided to organize a group of women who do different productive activities: raising livestock, merchandise sales, basket weaving.  The loan they are requesting will be used to buy pigs and chickens since this is Gerónima’s line of work.  In the future they hope to have more pigs and chickens because this will make her production yield higher profits so that she can improve her profits and her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 58 years old and already a widow. She is living in Natappian East, Solana, Cagayan with her five children.

To have a source of living, Hilaria has a hog raising business. She has been in the business for more than five years. Through this said business, she is able to earn a net income of PHP 3,500 when she sells one of her animals. She uses her income for the daily expenditures of her family.

At present, Hilaria needs additional capital for her business, so she is requesting a loan form ASKI and KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 18,000. She will spend the loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines.for her pigs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace seis años aproximadamente, a parte de esta actividad trabaja en oficios domestico en un hotel,  ella  vive únicamente con su hijo de 23 años de edad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo, que lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos, esta compra será muy importante, ya que aumentara el numero de cerdos en la granja, para luego venderlos y obtener ganancias.
El objetivo de ella es que el negocio mejore, ayudar a su hijo en lo que sea necesario y poco a poco mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisca raises and sells pigs. She has been doing this for about 6 years. Aside from this job, she also does housecleaning in a hotel. She lives with her 23-year-old son. 

Currently she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs. This purchase will be very important since it will increase the number of pigs on the farm, so that she can later sell them to earn money.

Her goal is to improve her business, help her son with what he needs and little-by-little make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a hairdresser at Abura.  She also cracks stones for distribution. Faustina has been through junior high school.  She is married to a security man and together they take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy hair products for the salon and  stones to crack for resale. She anticipates reinvesting her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy hair products for the salon and  stones to crack for resale.

loans.name: Yadira De La Concepcion

texts.es: Yadira de 32 años vive en el Municipio de puerto Morazán con su esposo y sus hijos y se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Su negocio funciona desde hace 13 años, cuando por sugerencia de su esposo que es pescador. Empezó este negocio con recursos propios, aunque al inicio no le fue muy fácil. Este financiamiento que recibe comprará camarones, pescados, conchas, chuletas y punches. Su meta más adelante es lograr adecuar su vivienda, un local como taller y punto comercial para diversificar su oferta y posicionarse en el mercado.
texts.en: Yadira, 32, lives in the municipality of port Morazán, with her husband and children.  She sells shellfish for a living.  She started her business 13 years ago when her husband, a fisherman, suggested she do so.  She began the business using her own savings and at first it was difficult.  This loan will help her buy shrimp, fish, conch, chops, and punch.  In the future, she would like to fix up her home, have shop so she can sell a greater variety of products, and get ahead in the market.

loans.use: To purchase shrimp, fish, shellfish, chops, and punches.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and married to Zablon. She has been running her business for the past 12 years. She earns a monthly income of about 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she saves and uses both in her business and for personal use.

She has been loaned KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD.

She intends to use the loan to purchase stock of clothes for sale and raw material for making hair wax for sale in her second business.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business and support her family. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business with steady income.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes for sale and raw material for making hair wax for sale.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: 50-year-old Hope has been doing farming for close to six years now in the district of Rukungiri in Western Uganda. The happily married mother of five says she joined the agricultural sector because she bore witness to how income from this business was benefiting many rank and file Ugandans, especially in the rural areas. It is a business that has extricated many Ugandans out of their below-the-breadline circumstances. Hope is one such Ugandan who says agriculture, principally farming, has helped her a great deal. She says she has been able to provide better welfare for her family with income from her farming business. She focuses mostly on bananas on her farms but recently she has diversified to other cash crops such as maize and coffee. Hope harvests and sells most of the cash crops she grows on her farms. On the side, she too has a small alcohol sales business that she says she ekes out additional modest income from. Hope says she makes monthly gross sales revenue to the tune of Ugandan shillings 100,000. She says she intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase high-grade manure to apply to her farming gardens.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure

loans.name: The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “The Grace Of God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mayalie is the leader of this group. The 28-year-old is married with one child. Mayalie has been a businesswoman for three years now. She sells margarine, cotton cloths and body spray. With help of this loan, Mayalie is going to use her share to buy two pieces of cotton cloths and two cartons of margarine.

loans.use: to buy cotton cloths and margarine

loans.name: El Aguacate (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Aguacate está formado por 7 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes viven por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es muy visitada por su belleza arquitectónica, por su gente y sus tradiciones. La gastronomía típica de esta ciudad deleita el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente es muy amable, mantienen sus costumbres y tradiciones.  Nuestras socias son personas trabajadoras que luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias, laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Una de las socias es la Señora. Mercedes, vive por el sector de Monay y se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal.
 
Tiene 63 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son  mayores de edad, cuatro son casados e independientes  y uno trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. Su esposo le ayuda en casa, la casa en la que vive es propia siendo el resultado del esfuerzo y trabajo en su juventud.

Doña Mercedes se dedica a la cría de animales como: cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, también labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo y para la venta.
  
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para la cría y venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Aguacate is made up of 7 women and 2 men who live in the Monay neighborhood in the city of Cuenca.  This city is frequently visited for its architectural beauty, its people and its traditions.  The city's traditional cuisine delights the palates of residents and visitors alike.  Its people are friendly and maintain their customs and traditions.  Our members are hard-working people that strive daily to provide for their families.  They all work in different activities in the city of Cuenca.  

One of these members is Señora Mercedes.  She lives in the Monay neighborhood and this is her fourth loan with the communal bank.
 
She is 63 years old, married and the fruit of their conjugal union has brought them 5 children who are now adults.  Four of them are married and independent and one works and helps them financially.  Her husband helps around the house.  Their house is their own and is the result of their effort and hard work when they were young.  

Doña Mercedes raises animals such as pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.  She also works in agriculture and what she grows is for their consumption and to sell.  
  
With this new loan she will buy pigs, chickens and guinea pigs. 
 
Her goal is to have more animals to raise and sell.

loans.use: purchase pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 44 years old. She is a female operator of a tricycle transportation service. As a female driver, it is a little bit difficult, but she still goes on to thrive and pursue her occupation. She is working hard to provide the needs of her family. Aside from her transportation business, she is engaged in selling different kinds of fish in their community as a secondary source of income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy new tires and to buy fish for her businesses. She hopes to expand her business to be able to provide the needs of her family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old and single.  He runs a butcher shop to earn his living.  He has been in this business for five years and has employed two people.  He also does crop farming for extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save money.  He has used his previous loans to boost his business.

Samuel hopes to expand his business and get more clients.  He has requested 30,000 KES to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Three of the children are currently in school. For the past four years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which provides medicine to local families. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for his shop. It will help Isaac to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Isaac hopes that in the future, he will be able to start his own clinic. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for his shop,

loans.name: Nely's Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DE ACCHA”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Pisac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irene; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 12, 7, 3, 1 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la artesanía la socia realiza trabajos de diferentes motivos pero todos ellos recreaciones de la época andina y la llegada de los españoles, la socia realiza trabajos como ajedrez y las fichas, estas fichas son los inkas contra los españoles en la conquista, las fichas son únicas y coloridas, el tablero de madera que encierra las fichas para trasladarlas y es muy solicitada por los turistas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las diversas piezas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la realización de las diferentes fichas de ajedrez.
Los otros socios se dedican principalmente a la artesanía, ellos elaboran y venden diferentes trabajos hechos en arcilla, como ceniceros, tazas, silbatos, adornos para el hogar y la jardinería,  también una socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes, la otra socia vende verduras en el mercado central, otra socia tiene su restaurante y así cada socia con sus negocios.
La foto está dividida porque por acuerdo mutuo un grupo se reunió en una hora pactada mientras las otras dos señoras en la foto sentadas vinieron 1 hora más tarde y la otra señora está en su negocio cerca al local de reunión y no pudo asistir.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Accha communal bank, located in the district of Pisac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.  Irene, the member, is 32 years old and married with four children, ages 12, 7, 3, and 1.  

Irene works making arts and crafts.  She creates work with a variety of motifs, but all are recreations of the Andean period and the arrival of the Spaniards.  She makes artworks like chess boards, and the pieces are the Incas against the Spaniards in the Conquest.  The pieces are unique and colorful.  The wood box to carry the pieces is often requested by tourists.

Irene wants to use the loan to buy materials to make the various pieces.   She is requesting the loan to buy materials to make the different chess pieces.

The other members work primarily in arts and crafts, making and selling various works in clay such as ashtrays, cups, whistles, and home and garden decorations.  One member also has a grocery store, another sells vegetables in the central market, another has a restaurant, and so each member with her business.

The photo is divided because, by mutual agreement, one group got together at a set time, while the other two seated women in the photo came an hour later and the other one is in her place of business near the place of the meeting but was unable to attend.

Irene is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy the materials to make chess pieces.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 to 12 years and all are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Rose has operated a rental house for the past 10 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Rose's other source of income includes side jobs operating a water kiosk and charcoal stand. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees, food, and electricity.

Rose will use the KES 100,000 loan to purchase cement, sand and plywood to construct another rental house. Rose aspires to buy more plots to build rental homes in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand and plywood to construct another rental house.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita is single.  Everlita is 55 years old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
 
Everlita sells Fern-C vitamins to earn a living and has had this business for ten years.  Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase new stocks of herbal medicine capsule.

Everlita has become a member of PMPC this year, 2011.  In the future, Everlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of herbal medicine capsules.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is a widow with two children; one son and one daughter.  The son is in full-time employment and the daughter is in school. The family lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. 

Chanthou has full-time employment with an NGO in Phnom Penh.  She is asking for another loan of $500 to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer who raises and sells pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 18,000 KES to buy piglets for her business. 

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have her own meat shop.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is 30 years old and married with 3 children.

Fetu is starting a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Fetu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fetu's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 30 years old, single and has two children, ages two and four. She describes herself as an honest and God-fearing woman. She has been running a salon for the last four years. Her business is faced with the problem of low purchasing power, sometimes from the customers. She will use the loan of Kes50,000 to buy dryers and machines for reflexology. In the future, Faith wants to run a bigger salon.

loans.use: To buy dryers and machine for reflexology.

loans.name: Arjie

texts.en:
Arjie is 35 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. He is married and has three children.
 
Arjie has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 700 each month doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase equipment for his motorcycle transport business.
 
Arjie has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Tsetsegmaa aged 27, lives with her husband and a daughter in a GER /Mongolian national yurt/ in Uvurhangai province. Her daughter is 2 years old and stays at home. Mrs.Tsetsegmaa operates organic yogurt and organic milk sale business from 2011. Her husband starting his own business in May, this year. He is providing the small tire repairing service. Her husband rents a space along the central road to grow the volume of sales. As a result, he has been gaining more customers from day to day. Tsetsegmaa also runs the business to saw firewood for rural residents in winter time. Now mrs.Tsetsegmaa wants to help his husband business to improve his business and to cell tires of car. She is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT to purchase more tires for his husband business.

loans.use: To purchase more tires for his husband business

loans.name: Kitoben Women Group (Sigoan Centre)

texts.en:
The member raising her hand in the photo is Lilian. She is 28 years old, married and blessed with three children. She is a member of Kitoben Women group (Sigoan centre)which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and has benefited from enterprise development training.
She does potatoes, maize, beans and dairy farming. She is borrowing a kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and certified seeds and increase her production. She hopes this will increase her income and enable her continue expanding her farming activity.
She is grateful to kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and certified seeds hence more income to continue expanding her farming activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock in the secretarial bereau.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is a divorced mother with two daughters. Her husband left their family 13 years ago and she was forced to find ways to provide for herself and her daughters. She was familiar with the clothing retail business so she decided to borrow some money and start her own business selling clothes. Svitlana has been self-employed now for more than 5 years. She is very strong-willed and resolute. Her hard work, perseverance and ability to offer a wide assortment of clothing have helped her keep loyal clientele and expand her business. Presently, Svitlana has about $2,000 of working capital. Svitlana is requesting a loan of $800 to allow her to increase her inventory and to help open a new vending kiosk in another local market. She can purchase men and women’s clothing in bulk for good prices. If she is able to open a second sales kiosk, her sales activity will increase greatly and she will be able to meet the needs of more customers. This loan will give Svitlana a chance to expand her trade, increase profits, and invest in her business and her family’s future welfare.

Світлана – розлучена, в неї дві дочки. Її чоловік покинув родину ще 13 років тому. Отже, Світлана була змушена шукати можливостей забезпечувати себе та донечок. Вона зналася на одязі, тому вирішила позичити грошей та відкрити власну справу. Світлана працює сама на себе вже більше 5 років. Вона – дуже вольова та рішуча. Наполеглива праця та великий асортимент одягу допомогли їй зберегти вірних клієнтів та розширити власний бізнес. Зараз в Світлани – 2000 доларів в товарі. Світлана просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів та відкрити ще один кіоск на місцевому ринку. Вона планує оптом закупити чоловічий та жіночий одяг за помірними цінами. Коли вона відкриє другий кіоск, обсяг продаж значно виросте, а отже, вона зможе задовольнити попит багатьох покупців. Позика надасть Світлані можливість розширити торгівлю, збільшити прибутки, вкласти зароблені кошти в розвиток бізнесу та забезпечити потреби родини.

loans.use: To open another vending kiosk

loans.name: Lama

texts.en: Lama S. is 45 years old and has seven children to support.  She rents beach fales (small open huts on the beach) to tourists.  Back-packers or passers-by will use the fales to picnic or to spend the night.  The fales are located on a white sandy beach on Samoa’s coastline.  Lama can earn up to ST 300 (USD 120) per week.  She is very proud of the hospitality she can show the tourists and is grateful for their words of encouragement.  Currently she has ten fales, and she would use loan funds to begin building another as well as to make repairs on the existing structures.

loans.use: Build additional fales (huts)

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en: A. Shahmurad is a successful businessman and owner of two milk cows. He is 52, married, and has four children. The place where he keeps his cows is dirty and needs to be repaired. He applied for a $1000 loan so he can create better conditions for the cattle.

loans.use: Going to create better conditions for keeping cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Locale improvement.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz and her husband Leonce Guzman have a successful colmado, a little neighborhood grocery store. The couple started the business five years ago in order to provide a good education and food for their two children. Emperatriz also owns a small cafeteria in the public school of the township.

In her colmado, Emperatriz sells basic necessities like bread, milk, rice, salt, drinking water, and so forth. With the loan requested, the entrepreneur plans to purchase new inventory as to handily satisfy her customers´ needs. That way, the couple will better support their family financially.

loans.use: To purchase bread, milk, chocolate, rice, sugar and new inventory for her little grocery store

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith P. married in 1993 and has three sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor back in 1988. However, she began her weaving business at home in 2002. Her husband, Mr. Chea Vuthy is a blacksmith. He is currently in business welding metal in Phnom Penh city. He does not get to go home very often. He started this metal welding in 1985. With these businesses, all of their children are being sent to local schools. They expect to send their three sons to pursue higher education.

Mrs. P. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and some of it will be used to buy a welding air cylinder.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, and buying metal-welding  air cylinder.

loans.name: Joweria Nalubowa's Group

texts.en:
Joweria N. is requesting a loan to renovate her business premises as well as to allow her to send her son to a better school.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda
BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development.
