It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.
The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.
 In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Masriah

texts.en: Masriah, 27, is mother of a daughter, age 5. She sells snacks for a living, earning $3 a day. Her husband, N., is a laborer and earns $7 a week. She is a member of MBK and asks for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add business capital

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Thuận - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuận, 27 years old, a cadre, has small child. Her husband is a carpenter. Their weekly income is 18USD. She is taking out a loan to by tools for her husband. Mrs. Định collects scrap material and resells to depots. She is taking out loan to invest more into that recycle business. Mrs. Tám uses the funds of the loan for poultry and Mrs. Vui for buying goods for her stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Thuận 27 tuổi, làm cán bộ nhà nước, chi đang nuôi con nhỏ. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 200 000 đến 300 000 đồng/ tuần. Chị vay vốn để mua thiết bị dụng cụ làm mộc cho chồng. Chị Định thu mua bao bì rồi bán lại cho các nhà máy. Chị vay vốn để tăng vốn làm ăn. Chị Tám vay vốn để chăn nuôi. Chị Vui vay vốn để đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives with her husband and children in “anticretico" on Jose Saravia St. in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. [Translator's Note: An "anticretico" is a special rental arrangement offered in Bolivia. See: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html]

Maria earns a living selling fireworks, “cuetillos,” candles, ballons, etc, depending on the season, the holidays, and the customs of the country.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise. She has obtained a substantial clientele and her sales have increased dramatically. This is the second time that Maria has requested a loan through Kiva. The previous loan is completely repaid. Due to this prior history and the loan that she paid off she has been qualified for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en anticretico en la calle Jose Saravia de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; ella genera sus ingresos vendiendo juegos artificiales, cuetillos, velas, globos, etc., de acuerdo a la temporada y las fiestas y costumbres del país. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería ya que tiene mucha clientela y sus ventas han crecido mucho. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva. El anterior crédito está pagado en su totalidad. Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, ya que pago muy bien.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, including fireworks and ballons, to increase he supply of the holidays.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 55-year-old, married woman with five children. She has been selling varieties of scarves in her town for twelve years now, though she has to travel to Kumasi to buy the products that she sells. Scarves are very important to Ghanaian women because not only are they used for daily dress, but they also signify beauty and maturity; as a result, there is always a ready market for scarves.

Lucy is seeking a loan to buy more bales of the scarves from Kumasi in order to cut down on the number of times she has to travel there to purchase her products, especially in light of the fact that transportation costs are continually on the rise. She is a member of the group called “Eye Yehowa” (meaning, "it is God"). In principle, the members of her group agree to guarantee each other as a form of social collateral in connection with the repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bales of scarves in bulk to reduce transportation costs.

loans.name: Honoré

texts.fr:
Born around 1963 in Cannan, a small village in the Abomey commune (the historic capital of Benin), Mr. Honoré S. is a married father of 12 children, who all still live at home. He is a baker in Cotonou and makes different types of artisan bread. He also sells Hitarget brand traditional African cloth. He is an earnest man who is requesting his third loan to be able to meet his customers’ needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né vers les années 1963 à CANNAN dans un petit village de la commune d'ABOMEY (Capitale historique du BENIN) monsieur S. Honoré est marié et père de 12 enfants dont la charge lui incombe. Il est boulanger dans la ville de COTONOU et fabrique de façon artisanale du pain sous diverses formes. Il est également revendeur de pagne de la gamme HITARGET. De bonne moralité, il est à son troisième crédit afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of wheat flour, sugar, yeast and other products used to make bread

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Ms. Balbina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank, in the Yunguyo district and province. She decided to join the bank because she needed extra money to maintain her business making mana (a Peruvian dessert), and therefore she needs a loan of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles (local currency) to buy ten packages of noodles and 1 quintal (aprox. 46 kilograms) of sugar.

Ms. Balbina says that she has more capital than before and has a permanent stand to sell her products in the Chucuito-Juli province. Her stand is is located in the De la Madre Park, where she sells her desserts on Wednesdays and Sundays. This allows her to sell her products without losing money.

With the loan she's requesting, S/. 500.00, to be repaid in four months, Ms. Balbina will purchase ten quintals of corn and one of sugar, which will help her increase production and her income.

Ms. Balbina is 45 and has six children. She has studied up to third grade and lives with her husband, who helps her make the mana, helping their family stay united.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Balbina pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, decidió ser socia por falta del capital para mantener su negocio de producción de maná, por ello con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles adquirió 10 bolsas de fideo y 1 quintal de azúcar

Sostiene que tiene más capital que antes y tiene un puesto fijo en la provincia de Chucuito-Juli, ubicado en el parque de la madre en donde vende los días miércoles y domingos, de esa manera tiene garantía de comercializar sus productos sin pérdida.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de 10 quintales de maíz y 1 quintal azúcar, los mismos que están destinados ha incrementar su producción e ingresos económicos.

Tiene 45 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos, sus estudios alcanzados el tercero de primaria, vive con su esposo quien le apoya en la producción de maná, para sobresalir juntos y unidos en la familia.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of corn and sugar.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn S., 35, is married and has four children. He earns money operating a machine for rice grinding to produce rice meal. S. earns about US$4.50. His wife, Teav Saran, is 31 years old and earns income raising pigs and making and selling rice wine. She has been involved in this business for ten years now and earns around US$2.60 per day. The family lives in the Porysmach Village, Siem Reap Province. S. currently wants to expand his rice-grinding business and is therefore asking for a loan of US$1,100 to be able to build a hall for the grinding machine. The photo pictures Mr. S. and his wife.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Construction of a hall for a rice-grinding machine

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Mrs. Pal S. owns a small grocery store in the local market in Tropaing Pour Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Phy Chhanna, breeds pigs, and he also helps his wife when he has free time. (Mr. Chhanna is on the right in the photo.)

Mr Chhanna's pig breeding business is going well, and he wants to expand his business. Therefore, Mrs. Pal S. decided to request a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. S. is 53 years old, and has three children; one is employed in a garment factory, and the others attend school.

loans.use: Buy piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 53 years old. In 2005, she joined TYM Fund and accessed a loan to raise chickens and pigs and plant fruit trees. As she has a very big garden, besides planting fruit trees like longan trees and banana trees, her family grows vegetables, which are used for pig raising. With the assistance of her husband and children, her business proves more and more effective. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 8 million to buy more pigs and fertilizer to raise pigs and grow vegetables.

loans.use: Raising pigs and growing vegetables

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Amapro tiene 58 años de edad, habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Venezuela, tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad y que le ayudan a su mamá en la manutención del hogar ya que ella es viuda. Doña Amparo es costurera desde hace 15 años, negocio que empezó con recursos propios y que a lo largo de estos años ha luchado mucho para salir adelante. Doña Amparo desea invertir ahora en la producción de trajes para niños, es por eso que el préstamo solicitado será para la compra de telas para la elaboración de estos trajes. Ella desea hacer su negocio más grande, poder contratar más gente para así elaborar más piezas de ropa
texts.en:
Amparo is 58 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Anexo Villa Venezuela. She has four children, all of whom are grown and who help support their mother, as she is a widow. Amparo has been a seamstress for 15 years, a business that she started with her own funds, and which has struggled over the years to prosper. Amparo now wishes to invest in making children’s outfits, and the loan that she is requesting would be put towards purchasing fabric to make into those outfits. Amparo wants to expand her business, hiring more people to construct more items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make children's clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes Q. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey', which is made out of corn.  It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast.  Agnes has received no formal education.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Agnes has been selling 'Kenkey' since 2006.  She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and feeding her family.  Her loan will be used to buy more maize as the raw ingredient, firewood as the fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize as the raw ingredient, firewood as the fuel for cooking the Kenkey, and other things needed for the preparation of Kenkey.

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Mr. Aem U. is a 42-year-old and he now lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chan Doeun, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard to grow rice, they still can only get a little rice revenue to support their household.

In order to improve their income, Mr. Aem U. decided to ask for a loan to buy ice cream and an ice-cream box to start up a new business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. His wife is also present with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy ice creams and an ice-cream box to start a new business

loans.name: Luzbet

texts.es: Luzbet tiene 32 años, es casada y vive con sus  tres hijos. Desde muy niña se dedicó a la agricultura, ya que sus padres son agricultores y le enseñaron cómo cultivar sus terrenos, terrenos que ahora son suyos, ya que sus padres le heredaron una parcela de tierras para que pueda cultivar, y desde hace 6 años, que se casó, trabaja  junto a su esposo cultivando sus productos agrícolas, que luego de ser cosechados los vende en los mercados de su ciudad, pero lo difícil es trasladar sus productos, debido a que se tiene que pagar a los camiones para trasladar sus productos. Luzbet está en su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido considerada como una clienta responsable en sus pagos y reuniones. Esta vez invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la producción de sus tierras adquiriendo semillas y abonos para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Luzbet is thirty-two, married, and the mother of three children (all of whom live with her). Her parents were farmers, so Luzbet has been farming since she was a little girl -- her parents taught her how to work the land. Luzbet farms where she grew up because her parents left her some of their land so that she could continue farming. Since marrying six years ago, Luzbet and her husband have tended the crops together. After harvesting, she sells their products at markets in the city. It is difficult to transport their harvest though. This is Luzbet’s thirteenth loan with MFP, and she has always been a considerate, responsible client in payments and collections. This time she will invest the money she requests in acquiring seeds and fertilizer for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children: three females and six males. She says three of her children are currently in school, senior high and junior high schools. Some have completed some schooling and are working for a while before they continue. Mary lives with her family in a rented house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Mary is a hardworking woman. She runs two businesses at the same time. She treks oranges to the northern parts of the country and also distributes yams to the food vendors in her community. She buys oranges and tubers of yam from the farmers in her community and from the surrounding villages. She wants a loan to procure oranges and yams in bulk to be able to distribute to more customers. It is Mary’s dream to send her children to university and to help her husband put up a family house.

loans.use: To procure yams and oranges in bulk to be able to sell more widely

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: S., 52, lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999. She grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year: the dry season and the rainy season. Her husband Saron, age 56, works with her cultivating crops. They have six children; two of them are married and the others are single. To help meet the family's needs, one of their daughters is working as a garment worker. Crops are the family's main source of income. S. is asking for a $400 loan to buy some fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for growing cucumbers.

loans.use: To buy some of fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Dropati

texts.en:
Dropati M. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur, and lives with her husband and three daughters. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. M. is a shopkeeper in Thecho and sells pots and utensils. All three of her daughters are studying in grade 9, 7 and 3 respectively. Mrs. M., along with her husband, Mahandra, opened her shop 10 years ago. They equally contribute their efforts in their shop because they have no other source of income, and their children also help them.

Mrs. M. is asking for a Rs 20000.00 loan to expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses and hotpots to meet the increasing demand of customers. They want to strengthen the economic condition of their family by increasing their income.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Horogna (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Horogna sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes de ce groupe se situe autour de 35 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  6 enfants. Les membres du groupe Horogna vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles  élargies au  village de Paridara au bord du fleuve (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. 
Elles exercent presque la même activité  de vente de beurre de karité et de secco. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Horogna   décida d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter et stocker du beurre de karité et des Seccos qu’elles achètent avec leurs maris qui le confectionnent. Les Seccos sont vendus au comptant en détail au bord du fleuve à Paridara (où il n’y a pas  de marché). Quant au beurre de karité, il est vendu et à la maison et au marché de San. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 35 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Horogna are all married and average about 35 years of age and 6 children each. The group members live in large traditional extended families in the village of Paridara on the banks of the river (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they do almost the same work, selling shea nut butter and secco butter. The women are in high demand in this business of theirs.

To satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

They intend to use this loan to buy and store shea nut butter and seccos that they buy with their husbands, who process it. The seccos are sold in retail cash transactions on the riverbank in Paridara (where there is no marketplace). As for the shea nut butter, it’s sold at the house and at the San marketplace.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea nut butter and "secco"

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga T. lives with his wife and daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is four years old and goes to kindergarten. Battulga has a small business distributing milk. With his small truck, he goes to herder families nearby and purchases their milk at wholesale prices. Once he collects the milk he transports it to the supermarkets and food retail stores to sell for a profit. He has a contract to provide a daily milk supply for a few domestic supermarkets. With his profit he was able to purchase the small truck that he currently drives to collect milk. Battulga dreams of building and owning a milk distribution center in the city. He requests a loan to purchase more milk from herder families.

loans.use: To purchase more milk from herder families.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum N., 49, pictured here with her husband, is married with four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She is a professional tailor and earns US $2.5 per day. Her husband makes US $2 per day as a farmer. The family is also aided by three children who are garment factory workers. Oum would like to take out a loan to buy a sewing machine and purchase a water pump for her husband to irrigate the farmland.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and water pump

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru: Рохила Зуюнова более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она продает шторы и ее принадлежности на рынке. Рохила проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 36 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить новые, модные шторы. На полученную прибыль хочет купить детям компьютер, чтобы их обучить.
texts.en:
Rohila Z. has worked in retail for over 5 years. She sells draperies and their accessories at the market. Rohila lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 36 years old, divorced, and has two children. She is seeking a loan to buy new, fashionable drapes. She wants to use the income earned to buy her children a computer for them to learn on.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Guillermo Nicanor

texts.es: El señor Guillermo A. tiene la edad de 57 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado y sus hijos son mayores de edad, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer mejoras a su casa, el trabaja vendiendo leña y metales reciclables ya son veinte años de experiencia, el cual inicio con fondos propios para llevar día a día la alimentación a su casa. Por falta de capital no ha podido crecer, pero ha podido estar estable con prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado para poder hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este préstamo es el sexto ciclo el en que invertirá en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer aumento a un cuarto y cambiar una hojas de zinc que tiene en mal estado, y poder estar en buenas condiciones con su familia. Su objetivo es incrementar el volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Señor Guillermo A. is 57 years of age and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of the capital of Managua. He is married and his two children are adults. His plans are to be able to finish making improvements to his house. He works selling firewood and recycling metal. He has 20 years experience at this which he began doing to keep food on the table in his house. His business hasn't grown due to a lack of capital, but it has been stable with loans that AFODENIC has approved so that he can make improvements to his home. This is his sixth loan cycle and it will be used to buy construction materials to build an addition to a room, to replace some galvanized roof panels that have deteriorated and to make things nicer for his family. His objective is to increase his sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 35 years old, and she is married and a mother with two children. Currently one is schooling and one is breastfeeding. She is a food vendor for eight years now at Sefwi community where she lives with her family. She sells rice with stew; this food is mostly purchased by the schoolchildren during their break time and those in the community. Her food is prepared in a hygienic environment and because of that many buy from her stand. Theresa urgently needs the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal and others. She is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the events of a price hike. Her proceeds, she said, would be used to cater to the children and business growth.

loans.use: Theresa wants the loan to buy foodstuffs like rice, cooking oil, charcoal, spices and meats, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz Orieta

texts.es: La Cliente se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y perfumes desde hace dos años, trabaja con las lineas Yambal, Ebbel y Essika, tambien trabaja como instructora de aerobicos en un Gimnasio, es soltera, muy responsable en sus pagos, es su tercer credito en Emprender; vive en casa de su madre, ayuda a su madre con los gastos de la casa. Por ultimo, esta estudiando en la Universidad Estatal la carrera de Psicologia.
texts.en:
Beatriz has been selling cosmetics and perfumes (Yambal, Ebbe, and Essika brands) for two years. She is also an aerobics instructor in a gymnasium. She is single and very responsible with her repayments. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Emprender. She lives with her mother and helps her with the costs of running the household. Beatriz is studying psychology at the State University.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more products

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a diligent and responsible mother to her six children. She is engaged in the hog raising business and also busy in managing her rice retailing business. At present, she has two hogs left in her pigpen. To be able to maintain the business she is planning to purchase an additional piglet to raise.

Jesusa is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000 for additional capital. She will use the loan to buy feed and piglets.

Jesusa is married to Edwin who works as a farmer. They have six children: Gemma, the eldest, is already married; Edwin - 20 years old, graduated from high school already and is planning to continue his schooling next year; Edwin's twin brother is Francisco, who is now in his college studies; Harold - 15 years old, is already in his first year of high school; Geny Rose - 13 years old, is also in high school; and lastly, Erica - 10 years old, is in her grade school.

Jesusa said that, no matter how difficult life is, she will do everything to provide for them and their desire for education. She just hopes that her children will understand their situation if sometimes they have insufficient allowances.

loans.use: For feed and to buy piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Jariya

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Jariya owns a salon in Rwengiri Trading Centre. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with four children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years old. Her husband is a herdsman of cattle and he sells produce. Two of the children are in school.

Mrs. K. Jariya wants to use this loan to purchase more hair relaxers, hair extensions, rollers, etc. for her salon. She aims to own a large scale salon for ladies so that she can attract an awesome number of customers from her community. So far, she has been running her business for over eight years.

loans.use: To  purchase more hair relaxers, hair extensions, rollers, etc.

loans.name: Mala-Naa I Group

texts.en:
T. S., age 22, is a married Liberian entrepreneur with two small children who are not yet in school. For about three years, he has sold dry goods such as salt and seasonings at market.

T. faces challenges with illiteracy and financial shortage, but he is successful in attracting his customers through effective customer service and courtesy. He dreams of building a provision shop which will enable him to support his children, provide for their education, and ensure that they all receive good medical treatment.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods such as salt and seasonings to sell at market

loans.name: Rosefemar

texts.en:
Rosefemar, 29 years old, is married to Franklin D. C.. She is blessed with a son named Red Mar Francis, who is five years old. Her husband is an OFW, or Overseas Factory Worker. Rosefemar stands in as father and mother to her son, due to the absence of her husband.

Rosefemar manages a grocery store and veterinary-product store in the village of Mapalad San Agustin. According to her, the business she’s managing is improving, but she still needs to continue what she has started. In this regard, she is requesting additional capital amounting 50,000 PHP, which will be utilized for business improvement. Rosefemar hopes that she will be able to get the loan amount that she is requesting to be able to purchase more items for her store.

Rosefemar says that “Through patience and humility you can attain success in life.” She also prays that God will continue to guide her in managing her grocery store for her family's needs. Her first business focused only on veterinary products, but nowadays she has another kind of business, which is a grocery store. Through the income she generates in her business, and the support given by her husband, she has been able to put up her grocery store. She hopes that her business will expand.

loans.use: Additional capital for purchasing more items for her store

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer divorciada de 37 años, actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde niña se dedicó al comercio junto a su madre, y desde hace 5 años ella cuenta con un puesto afuera del mercado de su localidad donde vende tubérculos desde muy temprano por l mañana. Patricia debe alternar su trabajo con las labores domésticas, ya que trabaja sola para mantener a sus hijos. Ella es una persona muy carismática, por ello sus clientes siempre vienen a buscarla, sin embargo considera que si tuviera un puesto en el interior del mercado podría generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que con responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizará su trabajo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tendrá la posibilidad de dar un adelanto de pago para obtener un nuevo puesto en el interior del mercado, con el que podrá obtener mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia is 37 years old, divorced, and currently living with her 2 children in a rented house. Since childhood she has worked retail together with her mother, and for 5 years she has had a stand outside of her town's market, where she sells tubers in the early morning. Patricia must alternate her job with her domestic chores, since she works only to support her children. She is a very charismatic person, for which her clients always come to look for her. However, she believes if she had a stand inside the market, she would be able to generate a better income for her home. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is sure that with responsibility and commitment in her payments, her job will be guaranteed. With the money that she is requesting now, she will have the possibility of giving a deposit in order to obtain a new stand inside the market, with which she will be able to obtain a larger number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Deposit for a stand in the market

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja y madre de único hijo.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Él se dedica a la siembra de plátanos, café y frejol, en chacras alquiladas, por las que paga al año entre 400 a 800 soles, dependiendo del área que utilice. Wilder cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa para sus cultivos, de ese modo su trabajo se hace más llevadero. Es así que por muy complicado que sea su labor, disfruta de su actividad, puesto que sabe que gracias a su dedicación obtendrá buenas cosechas. 
Su cultivo preferido y el más rentable es el frejol, el cual una vez cosechado lo comercializa en los puestos de uno del mercado de su localidad, donde la pagan el precio real con el que mantiene a su familia.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual en sus pagos, asimismo, para este ciclo, se somete a la misma responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Wilder is 25 years old and lives with his partner and mother of his only son. He sows banana, coffee, and beans in small rented farms, which he pays per year 400 to 800 soles, depending on which area he uses. Wilder has the support of his wife when tending to the crops, which makes work more bearable. It is because of this that despite how complicated his work is, he enjoys it and knows that thanks to his dedication he will have a good harvest.

His preferred crop is beans because he is able to sell it once it has been harvested and sells it in a store near his home where they pay him the actual price of the crop and he is able to provide for his family.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) in all this time, he has shown to be punctual in his payments and commits to do it this time as well. The money he needs will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria Petrona

texts.es: Gloria Petrona tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y le gusta muchos su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 20 años inicio esta actividad porque anteriormente ella impartía clases en un colegio público, ya que ella empezó a llevar ciertos productos para ofrecerlos a sus compañeros de trabajo, por lo que esto le dio la iniciativa de salir adelante con esta fuente de ingresos. Todos su créditos han sido han sido aprovechados para su negocio. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en más productos. Su deseo es engrandecer su negocio para mejorar su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Gloria Petrona is 57 years old. She is very hard working and loves to work. Her business is the sale of general merchandise, which she has done for more than 20 years, before which she taught classes in a public school. She began by carrying certain products to offer to her co-workers, and this gave her the intiative to move ahead with this source of income. All of her business loans have been approved. Currently, Gloria is requesting financing to invest in more inventory. She hopes to increase her business and improve her source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nsimya Group, Jinja

texts.en:
N. Jamilah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hardworking lady and the mother of four children. She also takes care of some other orphans.

Jamilah is a businesswoman involved in a fish selling business from Nsimya village and this has been her business for a very long time.

Before having access to loans, Jamilah’s business had limited capital. Together with her group members, she needs a loan to expand her business by buying more fish for resale so that she is able to make profits and savings for her children’s education come next year.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith A. is from the "barangay" (village) of Tipan, a village located in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Judith owns and operates a business in her own store selling food, particularly coconut, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximate 10,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Judith is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconut-based products to sell. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase CDs and accessories

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham, de 59 años, vive en su casa propia, es separado pero tiene 5 hijos mayores que se dedican, como él, a la construcción.
Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de albañil, al principio sólo miraba, pero cuando estuvo seguro no hubo quien lo detenga en el trabajo.  En la actualidad es maestro de obra, es decir que lo contratan para un proyecto de construcción y el lleva a su equipo de albañiles, al cual guía con su experiencia hasta culminar el trabajo. Esta actividad le apasiona, pues tiene mucho trabajo y gana muy bien, además es el oficio que les transmitió a sus hijos, quienes ya formaron sus propias familias y las mantienen con su trabajo en construcción, como lo hizo su padre. 
A pesar de su edad,  Abraham es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante y tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como constituir una empresa de construcción, con su propia movilidad y máquina mezcladora de cemento, así lo contratarían para proyectos mayores y ganaría mucho más dinero.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura será muy puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas para continuar progresando. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un taladro y otras herramientas que le hacen falta y le serán de mucha ayuda para el mejor desempeño de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Abraham, 59, lives in his own home. He is separated but he has 5 grown children who, like him, work in construction. When he was very young he learned the trade of bricklayer. At first he only watched, but when he was sure nothing stopped him from this work. He is currently a construction foreman, that is to say one who hires for a construction project and brings his team of bricklayers, which he leads with his experience until the work is finished. He is passionate about his work, since he has a lot of work and has good earnings. In addition, it is a trade that he passed on to his children, who have already formed their own families and are supporting themselves with their work in construction, like their father did. In spite of his age, Abraham is a man who has a strong desire to get ahead and who has many plans for the future, such as building a construction company with his own vehicle and cement mixer. In this way he would be able to hire for large projects and would earn much more money. This is his third loan with MFP, and he assures us that he will be very punctual with each of his payments, so that he can continue to advance. With the money that he requests he will buy a drill and other tools that he needs that will help him to do his job better.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools for his work

loans.name: Suthela

texts.en:
Suthela G. is from the village of Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old. Suthela is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Suthela owns and operates a small Sari-sari store. Suthela has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month in this business. In August 2009, Suthela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Suthela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional items for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her store

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en: To earn a living in Ibadan, Amidu sells engine oil at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business dearly and he hopes to expand in his business. Amidu sells his engine oil daily and he loves the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He is 56 years old and married with 5 children. He is happy because some of his children are married and he is also a grandfather. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is 26 years of age. She has a series of businesses such as selling charcoal, chips, and shoes.  She has two employees who assist her in these businesses. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her about keeping proper records in her businesses.  She hopes to expand her businesses and improve her living standards in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add stocks of charcoal, ladies and children’s shoes, and potatoes for cooking chips.

loans.use: Charcoal and shoes for resale; potatoes making chips
